Review: excellent food and wonderful service.  The pane vino restaurant was delicious and our waiter Adel rahman was helpful, friendly and very efficient.  We found the price is very reasonable and the view was great. This is a must place to eat if you‚Äôre in this area

Hotel location is good. Walking distance to a couple of tourist spots in downtown Cairo. Breakfast is nice. House keeping guy Taha on 15th floor is very nice and helpful. Good place for long stay. Safe and comfortable.

GATE 1 arranged this luxurious hotel for our Cairo stay ! It was an amazing experience, very friendly, hospitable , comfortable, efficient! The breakfast was fantastic ; views from rooms of either the Nile or Tahrir square were simply magnificent!  The luggages , check ins, check outs of ALL 57 of us were handled seemlessly by GATE 1 ! The buses were new, with WIFI and charge ports in every seat ! The drivers were  friendly and professional too ..,  THREE CHEERS to GUDES RIHAM, NEHAL and our driver ZACHARIYA! üëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèº  The restaurants were fabulous too , especially the Indian  and Thai ones !

Great Hotel with Solid Service. Especially the receptionist Yasser helped me and my mom book a reservation at the Revolving Restaurant & we had an amazing date and ambience over there which we really enjoyed.   Highly recommend and especially letting our dear friend Yasser do all the bookings, tours and reservations for you !

‚Ä¶.. that there was a time, before retirement, when the Intercon group was my very favourite and I enjoyed their highest status of Royal Ambassador ‚Ä¶ but these days I travel using my own money but still choose this brand when I am able to. The receptionist smiled when he found my card had lapsed some 14 years ago but my smiling request for a Nile view room was ignored as he is clearly not able to use his discretion for ‚Äúold friends‚Äù!! He did however offer my a rate on the daily breakfast that my agent had not sort to include in my booking ‚Ä¶. a good guy who went the extra mile!  Breakfast is a Bun Fight in the In and Out Cafe!! The receptionist very organised and one of the staff named Omnia a service ‚Äústar‚Äù ‚Ä¶ the perfect staff member that we dearly loved to have in the days when I ran hotels myself  The breakfast restaurant clearly lacks organisation ‚Ä¶ in my four days here they have never ever managed to have sufficient fruit juices available to meet demand ‚Ä¶ it is a crying shame! The price charged for breakfast is substantial and the food offering and general service does not reflect that  We have also had a meal in the lobby cafe each evening of our stay ‚Ä¶ and here we see classic Egyptian management at work! When I opened restaurants in Egypt we found that one of the major hurdles was to teach managment to be proactive in quickly addressing guests needs and not expecting staff to do everything ‚Ä¶. I am easy on service because I understand but having to approach service staff and demand attention or serve myself my own drinks means that I have had enough!  I like this hotel and will return ‚Ä¶ it is so very easy to get to anywhere in Cairo and the Bell Captains help in securing me local taxi was everything as it should be. The front door service, reception desk and Omnia deserve full recognition!!!  Final Question? ‚Ä¶.. why is the same sandwich served three different ways in three days ‚Ä¶ the F&B director needs to question why standards are not being followed‚Ä¶

We stayed , I and my wife, in Semiramis intercontinental Cairo, for 16 nights from 19/10/2022 to 4/11/2022. It was , as always, a wonderful experience . The reception was very courteous , we were upgraded to a stunning suite, the ladies in the executive lounge looked after us very well. The food was of wonderful variety..this is my 11th year of staying in Semiramis , will never stay anywhere else, in fact we , already, booked our trip for next year. I would like to thank Karim Zereef who helped us enormously, thanks to Mena  in the front desk, the ladies in the lounge, Mena, Hidi, Reem, Nermin . Thanks to Amanny, Waleed, Mehmood, Muhammed, Abu Zaid and the rest. Thanks , once again, to all of you who made our stay so nice and pleasurable‚Ä¶ See you, all, next year!! Najim Ghulam and Hala Safari‚Ä¶

My wife and I stayed here two nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  Very good location and attentive staff.  Our room was large, bed very comfortable and we enjoyed sitting on little deck over looking the Nile and the city.  The dinner and breakfast buffet was extensive, food well prepared and there was room for people to move around without banging into each other.  All in all a very nice stay and we would recommend.

The worst reception and service I have ever had in a so-called 5-star hotel. No recognition of my Ambassador status. Disorganized check-in and check-out. They gave me a room that was not ready yet. The terrace bar of the hotel is simply dirty. The management of this hotel should be ashamed of the quality of the respect given to the customers. IHG should audit this hotel thoroughly.

I‚Äôve been to over thirty  intercontinentales, and as a royal ambassador I can say this was one of the top one or two. The hotel is remodeled, the staff (especially Haremos and Waleed in the club lounge) were very attentive and friendly.   The ambassador club is also one of the best I‚Äôve seen, out of all the intercontinentales I‚Äôve visited. Only the one in Seoul is of the same caliber.   The location is perfect, right on the Nile and next door to the museum.

Booking and staff are very good and friendly.  THE ROOMS ARE A BIT TIRED,  Doors does not close properly. They are very old and they have not been modernised.  The views are great overlooking the Nile and I could see the pyramids from my balcony.  Breakfast was good, but it was very busy and doesn't feel like a personal experience.  Some of the staff are stressed and some are pleasant.  Reception staff are good and helpful.  We had a room which was next to the lift shaft.  This room was very noisy all night and I had to fight to get it changed.  Overall, the experience is good but not excellent.

We stayed for 3 nights here in early November. The hotel was 5 star all the way. The morning breakfast was a spread that can't be matched. So many choices. The room was a good size and was very comfortable. The bed was the perfect firmness. There was a choice of different pillow types. The shower had plenty of hot water and good amenities. It had a rainshower head which we prefer. Our room steward/housekeeper was the same every day. His name was Mohamed Abdelslam and he was awesome! We frequently saw him during the day or evening and he always had a smile, asked us how we were enjoying our stay and if there was anything at all he could get us or do for us. It was a welcome home each day we saw him there. The front desk and concierge were always helpful with directions and answering questions. The location was great for getting around and we always felt safe.. We would highly recommend a stay here and would happily stay here again.‚Ä¶

It is my first visit to the hotel. I like it so mach in general. The hotel is so clean and comfortable and suitable for family. The staff are friendly and kind and corporative. My experience was great specially in area of open buffet in breakfast. There were a variety of dishes that can meet different test . Actually I recommend every one to come there and enjoy it. I gonna to visit it again üëçüèæ

Best stay 3ver i would repeat it without thinking the hotel is located nera to museum and all tourstic place's stuff is so kind and helpful qnd having good idea about hospital llitt thanks for everything

This is first stay in Cairo and it‚Äôs amazing stay I was here for 3 nights all stuff are good and helpful and friendly I try the breakfast and Cairo bar it was so good and waiters are great and very cooperative

The staff and the hotel is super nice .  Pool is cool and food is perfect, Huygen and fresh and staff is super friendly.  Honestly i wouldn‚Äôt stay at any hotel rather than this one from now on.  Location is near everywhere in cairo and rooms are super clean and well organized and clean and big

The check in was smooth and the rooms were very nice and clean and comfortable the breakfast was perfect and organized, the housekeeping were attentive and helpful, the pool was very nice and they were prepared a tv fo World Cup matches

The staff was very nice & friendly, the room was clean, the food is good, loved the place.  I checked in the smoking floor,  was great, i loved the place.  You can see the world cup, with good service.  The breakfast is perfect.  The bazaar is beautiful and cheap.

The room was clean and properly maintained. The staff were pleasant and cordial.  The bar - yes, they sell alcohol - was welcoming.  The food at the morning breakfast buffet was ok but nothing special.  The breakfast dinning room was packed on the three mornings we were there because many tour operators use the hotel, and it was difficult for us to find a table, even at 6:15 am.  The neighborhood was acceptable.  Mike & Bev NYC

Ashraf was absolutely the best! He made our dining experience wonderful! He was very attentive to our needs, courteous, and polite ask for him when you are there he will make sure you are well taken care of

First stay in this hotel we were in capital suite we stay four night it was great hotel the breakfast was amazing and housekeeping team and the receptioni was good and very smily and helpful I will recommend this for anyone

Kempinski has been my home for a year since I have moved to Cairo for work and I have nothing but great things to say about this exceptional place. What makes it exceptional is their staff, from the reception guys which I will not say all their names but Mohaz, Mohamed are amazing, to their butler service, to Hassan making you feel most welcome to this hotel, to the cleaners And the guys that take care of your comfort. The hotel is small compared to some of the other chains here I. The Nile but, is quiet, clean, well located, and is price friendly compared to the others. The staff at this hotel go out of their way to accommodate our every need ( change rooms, better towels, directions, etc etc) they are impeccable. The amenities at the hotel are simple but on point, the view at the pool amazing, the spa 5 stars, the gym small and practical. I could write forever since I have had the chance to test every aspect of the hotel by living here for a year. On the food side, breakfast is amazing, Mariam greats you and Omar , Hossam and Mina and all others I might not memorize every name make you feel special. Blue is a good tasty Italian place and Osmanly is the best Turkey food you can ask for. Chocolate bar and lounge always good music and amazing deserts ( try the orientam plate)  I have to say thank you for making me feel at home away from home.  Ivan‚Ä¶

We were on a tour of Egypt and stayed at the Kempinski twice--once at the beginning and once at the end.  Both times, we were impressed with the service, the quality of food at breakfast and room service, and the freshly ironed bed linens.  Unfortunately at the end of our trip, we were quarantined for 5 days due to a positive test for Covid.  The staff provided us with everything from food to linens at our request in a timely and polite manner, which helped alleviate the boredom.  The concierge was outstanding.  She was able to find us a doctor to evaluate our ability to travel after 5 days, when no one else could--not our tour company or the American Embassy.  When we left, there were two pre-packaged breakfasts for us to take on our flight.    We definitely would recommend this hotel.‚Ä¶

A big thank you for Hady (your French is perfect) and Amir on the reception, guys you are amazing!!  So nice and friendly!! The services was perfect ! Thanks to all the personnel to make this s√©jour so nice and comfortable!! Very good Hotels that I recommend at 100%  Souad

The staff are amazing and beyond. The food is great. The room is great with a view, clean and neat. would like to thank matiam from the blue restaurant and Abeer from the guest relations and all the staff.

Great stay!The room was huge with fantastic views. After each day out, having a drink by the pool a great. We loved the Turkish restaurant and the buffet breakfast was delicious. The service was great and Carlos at reception was super helpful

Nice hotel with a great rooftop area to chill out. Very friendly staff especially Harem. Done if the areas of the hotel need a little maintenance. Loose tiles in the pool BBC area, tap handle in room kept falling off. I‚Äôm sure they will sort this.

The madiena suites are spacious and nice. Breakfast is good and the service is amazing from all staff! Special thanks to Abeer from Guest Relations for her kindness and great service. We would definitely repeat the stay.

Mohamed was very nice and made sure to answer our questions and assist. The hotel was very nice as well. The hotel was staff was nice. They have multiple restaurants to dine with. The rooftop pool was very nice also.

Extremely clean environment with friendly staff everywhere.....and the food was always hot, served time and the outstanding friendliness of the initial great and check on and check out. I will surely come again and apply for a long time rela.

Hotel was great, a little tired round the edges but the staff were hugely attentive and professional. Thanks to Mina Girgis for all his help.  The breakfast spread is outstanding, boots were well and truly filled for the day. Location was good for us and despite taking life into our hands somewhat crossing roads, we could walk at night to various restaurants .  One thing, the breakfast manager asked if our servant was doing a good job. Might be worth the Kempinski addressing how they title their staff, having a ‚Äòservant‚Äô didn‚Äôt sit well with us. Our waiter was excellent and polite.

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights to attend a wedding.  The decor of the hotel is really nice; however, most importantly, the rooms were really dirty. We had a chalet by the pool. The floor of the chalet was dirty, as if you were walking outside. The toilet was terrible, filled with dust and mold.   Housekeeping service is terrible; they didn‚Äôt vacuum the floor; they just made the bed without changing the sheets; and they only provided new towels.   I don‚Äôt recommend this hotel, and I am not coming back.

I have no idea how this hotel got the 5 start designation‚Ä¶‚Ä¶not sure where to start but I will do my best to describe the experience as clear as possible. First of all, this hotel is one of the biggest wedding destination in Cairo which is perfectly alright except that weddings last till 4:30-5am and the music is so loud which means you will only be able to go to sleep then and not before.  Im by no means a litte sleeper. Second, the entire hotel smells like cigarette smoke including my room.  It is an awful smell for a non smoking person. Third, the room feels like it is dirty with carpet stain all over. Fourth, I had no hot water in my First day and when the plumber showed up, he ended up complaining about the unique system in this hotel which is every room has its own water heater‚Ä¶..I had to take a cold shower that day. Fifth, upon check out I called the front office to send over a bell man to help with luggage, that took 45 minutes (literally) I ended up brining down my own luggage so I do not miss my hired ride to the airport. I wish I read a review like this one before I made my plans but oh well, travel and learn‚Ä¶.‚Ä¶

Excellent place ! The room was clean and quiet. Excelent service . Great choices of restaurants . Food selection was great . All the staff was very helpful specially Thanks for all the help to Asem Husainy for his hospitality.

Had a pleasnt stay staff were friendly olce was clean cafe was nice  Place had a really nice view  Garden looks nice and amazing  Yousif ibrahim was helpful and nice  He was helpfull and understanding  Umbiya sameer as well was friendly  Place is nice

This place is beautiful and the staff is wonderful 10 out of would recommend.  Asem and mosalah were great! The building is one you can't stop admiring, from the plants the building and lighting. Nicest place I have ever stayed.

wonderful reception people was very good restaurants are wondeful and lasobthe rooms (in particular the renowned rooms) I will return for sure very good ratio Money/Quality the garden outside is very well kept and pleasant for a walk.. Gymn is well equipped

The hotel is actually quite lavish from the inside and has a lovely large garden, so ideal for an evening walk in winter. Lovely cafe, small cinema and nice restaurants. The rooms are ok, very standard. Amenities in the room are worn out. The SPA is below average and not enticing at all. The gym is working out and some treadmills don‚Äôt work. On check out they tried to pull a fast one, telling me that I consumed something from the mini bar and I know I didn‚Äôt. They even wanted to show me the wrapper from the garbage. A failed stunt to get money. So watch out.

The staff veryyy helpfull...very kind...They updgrade our room to the biggest room in the hotel... it was great...the breakfast very nicee...the hotel very unique architecture...clean and complete facility... the staff mahmood and the team amazing very helpfull......very recommend hotel....love it

everything is clean and the staff are accomodating. untill next time üòä surely we gonna have visit and check in again..  thank you Mr. Mohamad Hassan for wonderfully accomodating us and Ms. Omnia as well

Everything is perfect! The whole place full of activities ( cenima , restaurants, etc) you can spend all your time there,, the service is great the staff are kind and welcoming! The prices is very good too! ,, definitely will come again!  Specially from front office ms omniya samer and mr mohamed hassan

What a experience! Amazing food, quality beyond belief.. Tarek our waiter was amazing and the service that was provided; 10/10. Steaks are premium and not to forget about the scenery, it is amazing. All the other waiters were welcoming and held an amazing conversation of the country.

To start, we scheduled an airport greet and transfer through the hotel.  This was the best thing we ever did.  Ahmed was so professional and helped us speed through the process,  He loaded the private transport car and our driver explained all of the sites to us along the way to the Hotel.  We were greeted immediately upon arrival and check in was a breeze and super fast.  Our room was upgraded for our joint Birthdays and Anniversary and we had rose petals around the room and a big heart on the bed with rose petals.  The most delicious sweets along with a strawberry shortcake was waiting for us in the room.  The hotel is so beautiful and our room has a view of the city and the Nile river.    We could not be more pleased.  What a great experience overall!

When you are in Cairo you must come here for an awesome start to the day with a sumptuous spread of breakfast. What made it worth memorable is the excellent service to go with the lovely spread of delicious food. Really loved the service of Asmaa being such a nice hostess and The rest of the team they made our morning extra special

I stayed for 2 months and as long as you can afford it I 100% recommend it. The location is perfect. The staff is the best. When you go for breakfast look for Mr Tarek tell him Andre sent you. He will take good care of you.

We had a confirmed booking but the hotel told us that they had no vacancy when we arrived. The receptionist offered to book another hotel for us of similar quality and price. The second hotel wanted to charge us the same rate as our original choice. Fortunately we checked online and found that the room should only cost half what they quoted. Always check the rate on an independent website  if one hotel refers you to another, while promising similar quality and cost. it could be a scam.

The bests restaurants are here in special the smoke house, the best meat, excellent Service, so kind and nice, very friendly. 100% recommend. If you want to eat the best burgues and bbq this is the place.

JW's Steakhouse was the best dinner. The food was amazing and the staff are the best. Emad and Farouk were friendly, funny and knowledgeable. Come dine here when you are in Cairo. You will not be disappointed.

Here at Restaurante Tuscany and enjoying the hospitality (and sampling the great wines) with Tarek!  Great day in the city and a good atmosphere here.   The breads were incredible, the mushroom soup spot on in richness and taste. The sea bream was cooked perfectly and was seasoned nicely by the garnish.  Recommended

The Cairo Marriott Hotel is a large hotel with lots of dining options. The rooms are mainly in two large towers, they are a little tired but functional. All they staff we dealt with were excellent. Great choice of outside dining in the evening. Breakfast was a buffet but had a good choice. Overall a great stay, would recommend.

Amazing bbq and attentive service...would definitely visit again. I had the beef short ribs and the meat just fell off the bone. The Hasselbeck potato was okay but might needed to be cooked a bit longer.

Reception and Senior staff  Our group of eleven arrived at the hotel after a late evening flight from Aswan for our three day-stay in Cairo.    The hotel was pre-booked by the Tour Company, but the reception staff were not ready to receive us, and we had to wait for over forty minutes until the rooms were allocated. Then we found that the rooms were not allocated as specifically requested. For example,  two single female guests were given a room with a double bed and a couple were given a room with twin beds! This gave the impression that the Reception staff either did not read the information supplied in advance or if they read them, they did not pay due attention to them.   The Reception staff did not appear to have much hospitality experience. The senior staff were rude, unhelpful, and unfriendly both on the telephone and during face-to-face meetings.    Portage The bell boys or porters were not very helpful, and the guests had to carry their own luggage to the rooms. This was significant given that the group members were senior citizens. This was the first time we had experienced poor service in a ‚Äú5-star‚Äù hotel.   Room Service Room service was prompt, house-keeping staff were very helpful and friendly.    Wi-fi Wi-fi connections and signal were excellent in the rooms and elsewhere in the hotel.   Rooms and bathrooms Rooms were spacious and quiet. However, they were outdated with many defects and shortcomings.   Some of the bathrooms did not have hand towels; some had no bath towels. Although there were tea/coffee making facilities, often there were no cups, teaspoons, tea, or coffee. The air conditioning was switched off and had a very unpleasant smell. In one bathroom, the electric wire in the hairdryer was wrapped in sticking plaster! Bathrooms had mould around the walls and round the bath. The tiles were broken or cracked. A common complaint by all the group members was that the bath handles were coming apart,  and dangerous to hold on to getting in and out of the bath. Door handles were loose and could not be closed securely. Some lights bulbs were not working, and some could not be switched off. These had to be turned off at the socket. Some rooms had not been serviced at all. This gave the impression that the supervisors and the managers had not inspected the rooms.    Restaurant and Meals  The Restaurant area was very small for a hotel with several hundred rooms. There was hardly any room to walk between tables once the diners were seated. Breakfast and dinner menus were basic and not much variety. If you went for a late sitting, food ran short. The Senior Restaurant Manager on duty for one evening was extremely rude and shouted at a guest. We had to report this incident to the Director of the Tour Company to resolve the issues. The restaurant waiters worked very hard but due to a shortage of staff, the service was below expectations.   Cleanliness There were bags of leftover food outside the room in the corridor.   Reporting At the end of our stay, we complained to the Assistant Guest Relations Managers Nermine Wagih and Madonna and provided them with a video and pictures of the state of one of the bathrooms. It was interesting that none of the mangers chose to speak to us and apologised for the poor conditions and service.   Conclusions Based on the above findings, we rate this hotel as 2-star, not 5-star. The contrast was obvious when we compared our experience at other 5-star hotels we stayed in Egypt. The advertised rating of this hotel is very misleading. It is damaging to the Egyptian hospitality industry too.   We have reported the above facts to the Director of the Tour Company we used.   We have made the above observations in good faith with a view to galvanising the hotel management to remedy the shortcomings listed above so that their claim to be a 5-star hotel is well deserved.‚Ä¶

Mr Ahmed and mr Ahmed were very helpful we had an issue and mr Ahmed was quick to resolve the problem the room was great it was the dulex sweat was very big with 2 bathrooms service was great I really appreciate how they handled things  ÿÆÿØŸÖŸá ÿßŸÑÿπŸÖŸÑÿßÿ° ÿßŸÉÿ´ÿ± ŸÖŸÜ ÿ±ÿßÿ¶ÿπŸá ÿßÿ≥ÿ™ÿßÿ∞ ÿßÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ŸÉÿßŸÜ ÿ¨ÿØÿß ŸÖŸÖÿ™ÿßÿ≤ ÿßŸÑÿ∫ÿ±ŸÅŸá ŸÉÿßŸÜÿ™ ÿ±ÿßÿ¶ÿπŸá Ÿà ŸÉÿ®Ÿäÿ±Ÿá ÿ¨ŸÜÿßÿ≠ ÿØŸäŸÑŸàŸÉÿ≥  ŸÖÿ≥ÿ™ŸàŸâ ÿ±ÿßÿ¶ÿπ ŸÑÿÆÿØŸÖŸá ÿßŸÑÿπŸÖŸäŸÑ  Keep up

This is our 4th time staying at the Sonesta and here are our observations from this visit.   Front desk assistant manager, Ahmed Sobhy, was super helpful again as he always goes above and beyond to make sure we are enjoying our stay.  The hotel itself is in a good location, rooms are fairly sound proofed and clean. Housekeeping (Mohsen) was super attentive (as always) and quickly replenish whatever they notice you consume the most.  We were always used to staying at Sonesta whenever we travel to Egypt. And I must admit that this time the restaurant didn‚Äôt feel the same without Rosaline (Rose) around. She was always the first to greet us by name and make sure we are enjoying our breakfast to the most. Hopefully, she will be back in the restaurant managing things again soon.   Another drawback is the fact that they allow guests to smoke in non-smoking rooms. So expect to always smell cigarettes during your stay. This will probably never change as this was our 4th time to stay in this hotel, and they don‚Äôt seem to have leveled up to the non smoking policies adopted outside Egypt.‚Ä¶

My name is tharwat I am happy to stay with you all this time it will be a part of my life really  It was great great great time in this hotel let me share with you my stay  When I arrived I found a great place looks like something shining all things desk, floors, walls all things may be some body always cleaning this points  After my checked in I went to my room I think it should be 833 I was a greatest room I stayed before not because the hotel is the better one but whose working about it was amazing  when I entered my room I found everything was stable and organised even some lights it turn on making something special and amazing to show the room I feel happy for this in this time I makes sure that I will not find any comments  Frankly I search about comments but for real I am not found  And I forget to say it was smelly  It has a good smell  Carpet taken some articles I feel comfort from the beginning time  It is good to feel this great work from a good man I feel it  Really thank you for this stay  Happy to see you  Am I will return back to you with my family and friends  I promise I will do  Thanks and good luck‚Ä¶

The manager of this hotel was incredibly rude when we brought this issues of cleanliness to his attention. He said that we would never be satisfied and to find a different hotel.   Our room when we arrived was in a very unfortunate state. There is black mold growing all around the bath and it has cracked away from the wall. We have not been provided with a bath mat or hand towel since our cleaning yesterday. The toilet roll holder is broken and we were not given more rolls. The electrical plug under the window is dirty and doesn‚Äôt work. Our mini fridge is in a disgusting state and looks to be covered in old rotten food stains.   We were moved to another room on the senator floor and I immediately noticed that room was also a mess. There was dried urine splash on the bathroom floor, green mold growing in the mini fridge and the coffee cups were dirty. It also seems they don‚Äôt vacuum the carpets in between guests.   We were taken to a third room which again had a dirty floor, dirty mini fridge and black mold around the sink. We accompanied the head of housekeeping and the manager to the third room and showed them the mess. The head of housekeeping told me I was mistaken and the marble floor in the bathroom just looked like that. However, when she wet a tissue and wiped the floor, the tissue came away dirty. She then shook the dirty tissue in my face and told me it wasn‚Äôt dirty.   The wifi is very unstable and disconnects constantly. I had to reconnect almost every time I unlock my phone.   The staff here have been quite rude when we have been eating in the restaurants. In the Italian restaurant, I was brought the wrong order and when I asked for it to be corrected, the manager said it was what I had ordered, implying it was my mistake. I specially pointed at the meal I wanted so I don‚Äôt know how this confusion occurred. The correct meal was brought but I was disappointed by the rushed quality of the food.   The next night, we ate in the sushi restaurant and the waiter huffed at my order. He was rude and inattentive. We had to go ask for multiple items. We were one of only two tables in the restaurant so he wasn‚Äôt busy.   We then had lunch in the cafe and after the waiter was rude about my order, he brought the wrong sandwich. The sandwich was taken to be fixed, brought back and again had incorrect ingredients. I had to take the sandwich up to the manager and go over the specifics of what was wrong with the food. It took 55 mins for my sandwich to arrive correctly.   We have had four meals in this hotel and we have had a problem every single time. We are quite unimpressed with the state of this hotel and we would recommend you do not stay here until they fix the attitude problem amongst the staff and clean the rooms better.‚Ä¶

Good service and a nice room with different sights and with clean sheets and each room have its distinctive stamp which makes u feel like u r in ur home and all the staff are really helpful from point a to z

All of the staff we dealt with were very professional and helpful. Special call out to the chap in Spekes (sp?) Bar last night Sat 05/11, the wait staff in La Gondola at lunchtime today Sun 06/11, and the amazing chap in the Patisserie today Sun 06/11 at about 1500 - what a gem he is. I hope the management read this and pass it on to the relevant people. The hotel itself has a faded grandeur about it, the rooms are definitely tired but the ground floor areas have charm.

I stayed for 5 days what an excellent hospitality, great location, small incident happened at the hotel, l lost my phone but the management at the hotel found it I really appreciate the Mr, Ahmed Sobhy and the Managment, highly recommended

Wonderful experiment really enjoyed my time there the food are delicious n they have really gentle kindheart n frendly staff the best restaurant i ever visited is la gondola Italian restaurant there i met really gentle cute guys less something i gone say about thim they r serving with passion we even became friends mr mohamed sherif n cheff sameh n cheff sherif n the young gentleman waiter kerolos really nice guys love there jop n knowing new friends

The hotel facilities are very poor staff are ok .. rooms need improvement in the service overall I didn't enjoyed my stay .. I will not recommend this hotel to anybody .. food also was not good. Pool and gym I didn't like

first of all I would like to mention Mr Amir, the director of this hotel, because he is one of the nicest persons I ever met, he tries his best to help and make you feel welcome. All the people in general are extremely nice and helpful but he is much more. The hotel is not in the centre but it is only 20min far from the airport and it is in direct communication through the garage to the Citystars shopping centre, the biggest of Egypt. Thanks to this, you do not have to take a taxi to go to any restaurant, as inside the Citystars there is a wide choice of high level restaurants with very high ratings in Tripadvisor as well. Being the Staybridge the same family of Intercontinental, from the shopping centre you also have direct access to this other hotel where there are other excellent restaurants. Prices of restaurants are also much cheaper than staying anywhere else in the centre. In any tourist area prices are at least double. I did not give 5 stars because they need to improve breakfast service and quality. All the rest is really excellent, rooms are big, very confortable, very clean, they leave bottles of water every day, laundry is for free, beds are very confortable. Wifi works perfect. There is no swimming pool while the gym is very good. There is nothing outside the hotel and the area is not nice, but it is the standard in Cairo, as pollution and traffic are terrible, and quality of the buildings is extremely poor. The hotel is a gem in the area. The shopping centre closes at late night therefore in case of any need you find anything in there‚Ä¶

The hotel is very clean and quiet and have excellent location with direct access to the city stars mall which contains all sort of shopping, dinning and fun places. The food served in the included breakfast was very good as well with good variety and options to dine in the restaurant or the room.

Great experience thanks to a wonderful staff. Shady and Muhammad Abdullah at the front desk remember you and your room number throughout the stay. Very helpful. Rehab and Nagwa run the restaurant with caring and efficiency. Suites are as big as my first condo. Two caveats: 1, there is no pool. You can walk through the lovely Intercontinental pool area (sister hotel next door) but you can‚Äôt use it. 2, no dedicated tour desk. The front desk staff will help arrange anything you request, though!    The hotel is connected to an upscale mall with gourmet grocery store, theaters, and tons of restaurants.

I came to Egypt and found out about an event called Ramadan. Ramadan is a very important and sacred event for Egyptians. I am currently staying at Staybridge. The staff at Staybridge will give me great support as a foreigner. During Ramadan, the staff provided me with a comfortable room. I am deeply grateful to Miss.Asmaa and Mr.Amir. PS Staff Abdelrahman, Mina, Salah, Nagwa, Rehab, Adel, Tarek, Michael‚Ä¶ The staff are all wonderful people. Service is perfect.. the view from my room fantastic  thank you Staybridge and the   team is freindely and politely special Miss Asmaa Elhadary  and Mr. Amir Mahmoud   from the reception exceeded my expectations

We stayed at this hotel in October 2021 for 12 nights. From the first moment of our arrival ,we felt the exceptional customer service. Mr. Mohammed Abd Allah the front desk manager who met us did an excellent job trying to accommodate our need.  The room was excellent,  breakfast was great and lots of varieties and the location of the hotel was superb being in city star itself.   I would give 5 stars for all the friendly employees for their excellent customer service trying to do all they can so you can enjoy your stay . I really would stay there again whenever I visit Cairo.

Service is perfect.. the view from my room fantastic üòç thank you kempinski and the team is freindely and politely special Mariam from geust relation and ahmed from the reception and mohamed from conserige

I booked 2 rooms at the hotel last week, and I truly enjoyed a remarkable experience from checking-in till departure! The hotel exceeded my expectations. I highly recommend this hotel for: 1) Great, friendly staff. 2) Spacious, fully-equipped rooms. 3) Exceptional sense of security. 4) Location & direct access to city stars mall. It's the best choice for Families and travelers who appreciate the 'Home, away from home experience'

This is our third stay at this amazing hotel. We stayed in suite 1012 between 24/09/2021 - 08/10/2021. The hotel in general is beautiful and suites are specious, clean and beds are extremely comfy. I also loved the view from our room. The staff are friendly and I must say special thanks to (Michael) who works in the reservation department "thank you for your time and gracious hospitality. Thanks again for doing everything you could to make us feel at home and thank you for going the extra mile for us I really appreciate your efforts and can't thank you enough" .  I must also say special thanks to (Bahaa) (housekeeping manager) for being so generous and helpful. He looked after us very well during our stay :)  A Big thank you to (Rehab) for preparing a decent breakfast for us every morning, she was extremely generous, I can't thank her enough for looking after us during our stay as this made our stay unforgettable.  Thanks to everyone else for the warm welcome. Hotel facilities are superb.  I highly recommend this fantastic hotel.‚Ä¶

Nice place! Super super helpful staff even with my language limited to English only. I never made it to breakfast but it was nice to just pop over to the mall via the parking garage when I needed to. Bathroom a little small but there is the kitchen etc so that explains why. Overall good stay.

I had a hood stay at Le Passage, and the staff assisted with all my requirements especially that I was on an extended stay due to an off-sick 3 days of non-travel. The staff assisted recommend a good hospital and ensured I had a comfortable room. Thanks Martina and Andrew. Thanks Le Passage for your warm hospitality and beautiful hotel conveniently close to the airport.

I really enjoyed my stay at LePassage Cairo; taking food at Orangeire restaurant was really amazing & delicious.  The staff is so organized, pleasing & welcoming specially Mr Zakaria, Menna, Mai & Esraa - Great team work & collaboration.

The food is good and the service staffs are approachable. Highly Recommended Hotel for travelers. the room is clean and complete with essentials. the wifi is free and fast even in my room. thanks to all orangeri staff.

Good food and accommodating staff. The room is clean and desserts are uniquie. Will come back again. Wifi slow in room and strong in lobby. Shuttle bus is free from airport to lounge. A truly remarkable hotel

hotel the hotel and service are very good . the lady ( duty manager ) helped me very much though check and check out . and let me ti stay in the room till 2 PM  the food is good and I will come again with long stay

Great experience.. excelent food with different kind of Choices. Room is well maintaind clean.  crew and staff are freindly, and approachable.Thank youfor the great experience.accomadating venue site....

The stay was fantastic. The buffet was outstanding with a wide variety of dishes. The rooms were well cleaned and up to the standard. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Will for sure visit them again.

The place was super. We were 3 Germans and an Egyptian and this was our hotel stay from Cairo airport. The food was great, the atmosphere was great and there first really didn't want to leave from the beauty of the place. Thank you so much for the hospitality.

I had the pleasure to stay in le passage Cairo Hotel. 7 stars Services Excellent Customer Services  The best food by chef Mohamed Said Best customer service by Zakaria and all the team Hiba & Esraa all top quality service.l recommend this Hotel for customers who are looking for top quality customer service

Really nice! Without Ahmed it may have taken ages to go through all the process of passing the frontier and controls!! A really nice guy. Helped us get fast and easy to the hotel. Also hats off to Hoassan in the reception, which was really speedy and helpful. All in all a great service!

Hotel is in a beautiful spot, restaurants are good, and room service is pleasant and quick. Mohamed-Al Akam served us twice and was very nice both times.   Giza is a short drive away, and so is the airport.

Fabulous room service! Great way to spend the night relaxing. Every dish was delicious and came with lots of nice extras like bread rolls and fries.   Many thanks to Ahmed Nassr for his wonderful and polite service, always smiling.

Spacious room, nice view from Balcony, friendly staff, food is good especially at the Egyptian restaurant. The food at the Egyptian restaurant  is very delicious served with home made Nan bread. I have never had such good ones before. Will definitely come back again. Beautiful foyer, nice outdoor swimming pool.

The hotel is a very comfortable and clean. Sobriety it is boat due to guests parties. What makes the stay homely is Ahmad nasser from room service.  He ialways provided very hospitable and welcoming servi e when delivering the room service.

We had a great experience at this hotel. Management and staff were amazing, beyond any expectations. Location is great (close to most of the touristic attractions), very clean, great food, and lovely atmosphere. The Moroccan restaurant served a variety of tasty authentic dishes and the staff was very pleasant and hospitable. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Cairo.  A unique and very pleasant experience for sure. Thank you Sofitel Aljazeera for making our vacation one to remember for a long time.

We had a wonderful stay at Sofitel Gizerah. Great views and great service. Room service and housekeeping staff is excellent and very sweet. ESP. Mohammad Al Alam and Ahmad and from Laundry Tarek were wonderfully kind and helpful! Highly recommended.

My family of 8 vacationed to see the beautiful city of Cairo.  We booked via Memphis Tours and our hotel was Sofitel.  The hotel is centrally located In Downtown Cairo.  There are many good food options available and onsite as well as a spa, casino and gym.  The hotel is dated however it is extremely clean and the customer service is top notch.  Egyptians are always very nice and the staff at Sofitel lives up to that. Every employee we came in contact with was generous! Mohamed Al-Akam was our room service attendant.  He was extremely nice with this huge smile on his face!!  And told us to call any time for our room service needs.  I will definitely stay here again in the future!

Our first time visiting Egypt to celebrate our Mother's Birthday was so special and exceeded all our expectations . The Hotel hospitality made us feel very special, especially the hotel general manager Mohammed who was so welcoming and generous. The spectacular views of the Nile River were breathtaking , whether from our Balcony or the outdoor restaurant and Lounge. We highly recommend this Hotel.

The service at this hotel is outstanding. A wonderful retreat in Cairo. The amenities and food are fantastic. I would like to thank Mohamed Al Okam who was particularly helpful, a fantastic host who was very kind to us. He was so knowledgeable and informative. Thank you so much

Best room service and hospitality ever especially mr mohamed el akam! He‚Äôs so generous and helpful and tries his best to make you feel welcomed and comfortable. Very fast housekeeping and they pay attention to details.

It was my first time to sit at your hotel.we liked the hotel so much the bar atmosphere and good service from very good staff.the reception and guest relations are very professional and so friendly. And thank you for everything

Good hotel for travelers. Was there with a tour for two nights and left my wife‚Äôs back brace. Came back a week later and they had it waiting for us! That alone says something about their service. Average rooms. Good buffet any meal.

Radisson Blu cairo is a real wonderful and very distinguished hotel in terms of service and high professionalism of the staff the rooms are very clean and the cleaners are wonderful in terms of dealing and the reception is very good thank you

Let's start with the positive. The lobby is beautiful and the property is nicely decorated. Now for the less positive. Although nicely decorated the hallways upstairs are showing  wear with many poorly done patches in the carpets. Our first room. It seemed like there was a bit of cigarette smoke as we first walked in. We started to unpack and the further we went into the room the worse it got. My eyes and nose were burning after only a couple of minutes. We also noticed the refrigerator didn't work when we went to put our water in so it would be cold in the morning. I complained to the desk about the smoke smell and they offered to clean the room. At 10 o'clock at night and a tour at 6AM that was not an option. By the way, cleaning a smoke fouled room is not as simple as wiping things off and changing the linens. It takes a number of hours of an ozone generator running in the room to accomplish the smoke removal. They provided us with another room. It was smoke free, however our clothes and luggage reeked of smoke, the refrigerator in this room didn't work either and the TV got no signal. Our cloths and luggage still smelled after arriving home. The clothes needed to be washed anyway but I had to clean the luggage and run our ozone generator for a few hours to get rid of the smell. This was quite a disappointment for a Radisson and unlike any other we stay in around the world.‚Ä¶

The bed was comfortable. Difficult to communicate in English.The rooms and hallway on the 5th floor had an epoxy smell we were choking on it .The lobby carpets were black with dirt ,room carpets were dated and dirty.

Its ine of the best hotels in Cairo, specially the location and cleanness, the breakfast is great too, They really care about your opinion, thank you Carolina for your follow up, you and all the staff are professional,

The room were so comfy plus the whole vibe at the hotel were amazing  I will totally recommend the hotel visit for my family and friends to enjoy the same experience i had at my last visit  Thank you for having us ‚ù§Ô∏è

Amazing customer service - i am extremely happy with the experience i had so far - Amal Maher has helped me and my family A LOT she is wonderful and she has been great- thank you for the great experience and please keep it up‚ù§Ô∏è

Housekeeping Mohamed and Dina are friendly and helpful, rooms are clean and tidy. Breakfast is good. The spa was very good, overall the hotel is good. The service is good but need a little more attention.

Rooms are spacious, room needs maintenance and renovations   For the staff they are amazing with supervisor Mr Mohamed Ramadan and the room attend Mohammed Mostafa, where very professional and helpful all the time

Mr. Ahmed Eldesokiy and Ms. Sara were attentive with great hospitality during our breakfast time. They always made sure that everyone were well taken care of, even our children.  The food was delicious and the ambience and atmosphere was amazing.

Had a great time staying in Dusit, and this is not our first or our last time staying here while we are in cairo whether with friends, family . We keep returning to the hotel for their amazing hospitality and cleanliness. I have to emphasis on their amazing breakfast at the restaurant, if you are here be sure not to miss it!! We would like to thank all of the restaurant staff especially Mohammed Abdulaziz and Hossam Ali as they had the essence of true Egyptian hospitality, always smiling and welcoming of us and if we had any requests they were great at accommodating them. An appreciated gesture was that they made sure every breakfast item that was served to us was done fresh, the feteer, and falafel and eggs are at the top of the list! We will most definitely come and enjoy the breakfast even if we were staying elsewhere.‚Ä¶

Our stay at Dusit Thani was so amazing especially the services at Straight Kitchen, there food and services was top notch, mostly was served by Mohammed Abdul Aziz who was soo nice and did his work diligently also to Ahmed Samir and Aziz thank you for your service and making our stay there lovely

We had a great dinner in Baladi restaurant in dusit lakehouse , the best thing was hospitality of Mohamed Abdelnaser the waiter üòçüòçüòç and then the food was tasty and value for money especially el FETEER with Sojuk .

We had a very good experience while having three days business workshop ,the staff was very helpful and responsive. Meeting rooms,Service,food and timing were very good all days. Only one challenge we faced with AC,room temprearure was very cold,no way to control it from the room itself and we asked the staff many times to switch it off.  In general our experience was amazing except AC point.

Amazing breakfast, great service. I went there with my friends and everyone was super nice. The breakfast buffet had a variety pf options and the food was truly delicious. Would recommend Dusit Thani for all leisure and business stays. üëçüëçüëç

I had a great experience specially with Straight kitchen restaurant the staff there were amazingly helpful specially  Mohamed  Abdulaziz and Ahmad Rafaat they were extremely friendly and helpful Thank you guys

I've good time at Straight kitchen restaurant tasty dinner and wonderful environment with amazing stuff as I remember Mr. Mostafa Magdy  Kareem Salam and cheef Khaled.  Definitely I will return back to Dusit hotel in my upcoming visit in Cairo

Balady Restaurant üëèüëèüëè‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è Lovely Experience of Hospitality and good taste  Thanks Mr : Tamer  Thanks Donia  Thanks chef Ahmed Tony  Thanks abdelRahman Atmosphere Is really nice and you should check it

My stay has been amazing, the hotel has amazing rooms and the sizes are huge. the experience at breakfast has been unique. Mr. Reda is kind and helpful. The minibar is FOC and is replenished daily. Only wish pool timings were till 10pm as from existing 6pm. The gymnasium is well equipped.

As a Bonvoy Platinum Elite member, I stay in a variety of Marriott's brands throughout the year.  The Le Meridien Cairo Airport stands out for several reasons.    It is, without question, the most convenient property for those in transit.  The hotel is easily reached via a bridge from terminal three (domestic flights) and, for those arriving internationally in terminal two, access is also a breeze.  Beyond convenience thought are the professional staff that make the property special.  Selma, the guest relations manager went above and beyond to make my stay a pleasant one as did Fady, the night and assistant manager, and Abdelaziz, the front desk supervisor.  All three individuals are assets to this hotel.

Great airport option. There is a walkway to the domestic terminal and a shuttle that can take you to the main international terminal in 5 minutes. Staff were very hospitable and the suite was quite large and comfortable.  Next time we are in Cairo and needing airport accommodation, this will be our choice.

You're probably staying here as you are coming / going from the Cairo airport and as far as convenience to the airport it can't be beat as it is literally connected to Terminal 3.  With that said my room was definitely worn and needed an updated / refresh.  While not horrible, for a Le Meridian it was not nearly as nice as the other I have stayed in.  The staff was helpful, the common areas nicely maintained and hotel restaurant options were great.  There was a wedding the day I was there so seems the locals like it enough to host a wedding there so not just people going to / from the airport.  There is a complimentary shuttle bus every 30 minutes to the airport which is actually helpful especially if you are not in Terminal 3.  While you can walk to the other terminals if you have a lot of luggage, etc, the shuttle bus is nice.‚Ä¶

Staff behaviors and attitude made it a terrible experience for me; they lacked professionalism.  very disappointing. The location is also terrible if you want to spend some time in Cairo. Nothing is around it

This is indeed a very comfortable hotel for transit passengers. The airport is linked to the hotel via an overhead bridge. They serve breakfast at 4am and you have a generous spread of buffet. Coffee is included so you just need to order with waiters.  As for dinner, the spread is also pretty generous. The only problem I faced is limitations of meat selections because I do not eat beef. Water is only served at 1 glass per person. I am not sure whether the waiter was joking with us or not but he told us it is. We are traveling in a group so we just take from other table.  Swimming pool is good for soaking.   Always check your bills and also ask for the price before ordering. Due to communication problem, you might face some problem during payment.

We always end our Egypt tours in this hotel . Conveniently located opposite the airport it is an elegant , modern and very clean hotel  We recommend all restaurants , especially the Lebanese and Chinese , excellent tasty and well prepared . The staff usually is incredibly kind and helpful . The only hassle is communicating with the front desk . One thing you should know , bring tip money in general . It‚Äôs quietly expected. And you should put down a deposit for various treats like restaurant or spa /massage. Egyptians seem to me incredibly afraid of being cheated ,  mistakes cost people‚Äôs jobs apparently. Let‚Äôs say I‚Äôve been lectured at front desk when I had repeatedly been asked to prepay .  Coming to Egypt  often this is nothing new but in this place a guest should not feel distrustful .  Again it‚Äôs an observation and overall our stay was great before we headed out for another 18 h flight‚Ä¶

As a solo traveler I had a highly enjoyable time here. Room service met beyond my expectations, the food and service in which accompanied it was superb and the hotel itself was beautiful. I hired a driver from the hotel who was absolutely amazing, a true gem.. Shoutout to Sug! Again, as a solo woman traveler having him escort me gave me a sense of security. This hotel is known more for passerby's however I stayed for a full 5 days and enjoyed it.

A wonderful one night stay at this modern and convenient hotel. Since my husband has mobility issues, they send a bell boy from the hotel to meet us at the airport and snd show us the way to the hotel. The room was well appointed and the executive lounge served very nice snacks. Since we were celebrating our anniversary, they send us a beautiful and delicious cake ! Thank you all the staff for your service and for making our stay a memeorale one. Would highly recommend.

This is an excellent hotel just by the domestic terminal at Cairo airport. It certainly provides a great place stay before (or after) your flight. Comfortable sizeable rooms which provide everything you need. Breakfast was quite good although they were slow at replacing empty plates on the buffet. WiFi is free although you do need to join the hotel brands website (which isn‚Äôt initially obvious) Recommended

This is a large and very well appointed hotel, just across a walkway from Terminal 3 of Cairo Airport. We had a large and very comfortable room with a view of the lovely swimming pool. There was a well equipped bathroom, although the bidet didn‚Äôt work. There were lots of seating areas both inside and outside, including an excellent range of sun loungers around the pool. Breakfast was superb, with lots of variety, including an egg station. One disappointment was that the coffee bar stopped serving snack meals at 8pm and we didn‚Äôt get in until 9. However, limited sandwiches and amazing cakes were available. Service was a little slow, but always polite and friendly. When we checked out we were swiftly transferred to Terminal 2 by courtesy transport.

Wonderful experience at the fairmont. Beyond our thoughts expectations. Great attention to details. We also enjoyed the heated sky pool at the fairmont. People are so thoughtful. Thank you Walid, Mahmoud and all other whose names i forgot.

This is a beautiful luxury hotel situated on the Nike River. My husband and I are here for a few days prior to our Nile river cruise. Staff is extremely helpful at the dining areas, rooftop pool or just in the lobby areas. If you look confused they jump Right in to ask how they can assist you.   Restaurants - Middle eastern restaurant on the BR level was excellent - we had chicken soup, pigeons stuffed with rice etc. pigeons were a nice surprised with very dark meat but nicely spiced. E had a couple of tajines - but was way too much food for even the four of us.  SUGGESTION - Disclosing the portion size at ordering would help prevent food wastage. We felt bad at how much food we couldn‚Äôt eat. The restaurant on the R level was good for breakfast with representation of varied cultures. Ample types of food for people to decide what to eat. Pool bar - we came later in the day. Rooftop was clean with comfy lounges and couches. We had a couple of cocktails and some nibbles to watch the sun set.  Room COMFORTABLE BED! Slept really well. Soaker tub was appreciated and it helped me to wind down so I could sleep. Spacious bathroom. They stopped by and asked if we needed water. Appreciated  Maybe we can try the spa tomorrow‚Ä¶ Definitely would recommend!‚Ä¶

Celebrating my birthday in Cairo. The treatment provided by the rooftop pool bar staff was second to none. The surprise with cake and song was overwhelming,   The hotel standard and service level in general is higher than one could expect   Just a fantastic place to stay and the best choice celebrating the day

Fairmont is the Best hotel to stay in. Outstanding friendly staff. They get you what you need before you even ask. Ola and Ashrakat in the restaurant were amazing and super friendly. We would definitely stay in Fairmont Corniche el Nile on our next visit to Egypt.

Beautiful property. Went swimming on the top floor and had amazing service - especially from Walid. Thank you for making our stay so comfortable! Would come back to stay again the only the future anytime.

The Fairmont Nile city is the best hotel I‚Äôve ever been in!!!!!! The hotel rooms are amazing, the view is good, and the pool is amazingüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄ!!! The buffet has excellent quality!!! and the server, Sunrise, was very very nice! I would highly recommend this hotel!!üòçüëçüëç  Aidan 9 yrs

Sky pool has the best view of Cairo that I‚Äôve seen. Good music, food and helpful staff. Walid Selem, Moustofa and the DJ made our afternoon at the pool very enjoyable. I‚Äôll be back next time I‚Äôm in town.

Wow- what an experience! Came for day-use of the Pool and Sauna and will definitely be staying here when I come back. Wonderful service and incredible gratitude staff. Monica at the spa is so sweet and helpful. Moustafa at the Sky Bar was amazing and shared stories and recommendations with us. Also he makes delicious drinks! Very grateful for the whole experience and will definitely be back. Also not to miss, the best shower of my life in the Cool Mist Experience Shower after hanging by the pool all day.

Convenient location, great view, friendly and helpful staff.  Mohamed Moussa from housekeeping went extra mile. Asian restaurant was delicious.  Lounge and bar had good late evening DJ.  Best part is definitely rooftop terrace with pool and a bar. We had several drinks and food up there. Everything was top.  Special mention of great bartender Moustafa, who couldn‚Äôt be  nicer during our time at the pool.

Very warm and pleasant welcome from (Perry el ashmawy FG manager) perry was very helpful and supportive with her team as well . thank you perry  , The room was very clean and the furniture is new and modern as well

I‚Äôm using this hotel a lot at the moment whilst I work in Cairo & just love it.  Rooms are spacious & well equipped, although traffic noise from the bust ring road can be bothersome if you‚Äôre a light sleeper, which is surprising as the hotel is set well back from the highway.  The restaurants are excellent with a great selection to choose from. The breakfast buffet is enjoyable with an excellent range of good quality local & international fare.   Without fail, the staff are incredible friendly & helpful, a special mention for Karim & his colleague in Lucca who make sure my frequent visits for dinner & stress free & enjoyable & the team in business lounge on the third floor who are so welcoming after a long day at work.   Close to the airport, perfect for my needs.

The Hotel is so clean and the staff are so professionals and nice.  They celebrated the Birthday by bringing so nice Cake to our room.   The Italian Restaurant experience ‚ÄúLucca‚Äù was so nice and the service was so good. Thank you Mina!  The breakfast experience in the main resturant is really nice with all the varieties. Thanks to the clever Chefs!   The kids area is nice and the pool is really clean and the staff accommodates all our and kids requirements. Thanks to Ahmed Lasheen and rest of staff.  Points of recommendations: - V. Parking for Guests should be fee  Thanks, Bessada‚Äôs family

The service was excellent   Staring from the valet   Reception and bellmen   The staff very nice,   Wael the room service   and  Islam & Saad life guards  Breakfast variety and quality is great  Pool temp  Kids area  Thanks a lot

Excellent hotel very clean rooms specially thanks for esraa Mohamed from  housekeeping,Mr.hossam housekeeping supervisor and all friendly staff and Sabrin from guest relation excellent restaurant specially the Italian one thanks for all staff.

Nice Italian restaurant . Nice food , with big portion . Great service , Karim was gentle fast and efficient .  Hotel is nice ,  maybe it needs a bit of renovation.   Area is nice in new aerea of Cairo .  Generally I enjoyed my weekend  at kempiski hotel .

A great visit.  Good beds. Wonderful hospitality.   Fahd provided excellent housekeeping.   Food in all of the restaurants was delicious and reasonably priced.  Breakfast buffet provides more than needed for a busy workday.  Highly recommended.

Very nice Italian restaurant. We ordered chicken Cesar Salads because we arrived late and weren‚Äôt very hungry.  Vert friendly staff and knowledgeable, especially Karim and Hani. Will revisit again for sure.

Everything was perfect. The room was clean. The indoor heated pool at the spa was a very good option specially that the weather was a little bit cold. We had dinner at Lucca and the food was amazing. Karim the waiter was very friendly. The overall experience was nice.

Karim in Lucca was excellant. He was extremely kind and helpful. We had a great time here and enjoyed ourselves alot. We were recommended what to try and the special of the day by Karim whixh was very helpful and it tasted amazing. Would highly recommend!

The rooms were clean as well as the hotel. Bed and pillows were comfortable Staff were friendly food was excellent. The waiter Mr Kareem who served us at the Italian restaurant was very kind. Would love to come back in this hotel again.

Wonderful experience at the fairmont. Beyond our thoughts expectations. Great attention to details. We also enjoyed the heated sky pool at the fairmont. People are so thoughtful. Thank you Walid, Mahmoud and all other whose names i forgot.

Fairmont is the Best hotel to stay in. Outstanding friendly staff. They get you what you need before you even ask. Ola and Ashrakat in the restaurant were amazing and super friendly. We would definitely stay in Fairmont Corniche el Nile on our next visit to Egypt.

Beautiful property. Went swimming on the top floor and had amazing service - especially from Walid. Thank you for making our stay so comfortable! Would come back to stay again the only the future anytime.

The Fairmont Nile city is the best hotel I‚Äôve ever been in!!!!!! The hotel rooms are amazing, the view is good, and the pool is amazingüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄ!!! The buffet has excellent quality!!! and the server, Sunrise, was very very nice! I would highly recommend this hotel!!üòçüëçüëç  Aidan 9 yrs

Sky pool has the best view of Cairo that I‚Äôve seen. Good music, food and helpful staff. Walid Selem, Moustofa and the DJ made our afternoon at the pool very enjoyable. I‚Äôll be back next time I‚Äôm in town.

Wow- what an experience! Came for day-use of the Pool and Sauna and will definitely be staying here when I come back. Wonderful service and incredible gratitude staff. Monica at the spa is so sweet and helpful. Moustafa at the Sky Bar was amazing and shared stories and recommendations with us. Also he makes delicious drinks! Very grateful for the whole experience and will definitely be back. Also not to miss, the best shower of my life in the Cool Mist Experience Shower after hanging by the pool all day.

Convenient location, great view, friendly and helpful staff.  Mohamed Moussa from housekeeping went extra mile. Asian restaurant was delicious.  Lounge and bar had good late evening DJ.  Best part is definitely rooftop terrace with pool and a bar. We had several drinks and food up there. Everything was top.  Special mention of great bartender Moustafa, who couldn‚Äôt be  nicer during our time at the pool.

Very warm and pleasant welcome from (Perry el ashmawy FG manager) perry was very helpful and supportive with her team as well . thank you perry  , The room was very clean and the furniture is new and modern as well

I sent this to the hotel and the Touring Company.  Dear Gentlemen or Madam I stayed at your hotel while on a tour with Aventura Tours at the end of October.The first 2 nights I stayed in room 1439. The room was filthy.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†   1. The carpet was stained, had something ground into it in areas,¬† discolored and did not appear to have ever been shampooed.2. The phone was sticky to the touch.3.The bathroom had a pubic hair on the back of the toilet. The door heeded some soap and hot water applied to it. The beautiful stone walls did not appear to have ever been washed. I suggest steam cleaning. The second stay in room 2249 was better, but the rug was still very dirty and in need of cleaning. The last evening of my stay I required a wakeup call. I had asked for one but when I thought about it I was uncertain I had given the men at the front desk the correct room number. I went downstairs to ask them to check and they refused to do so. A gentleman from my party tried to help me make them understand that I needed a wakeup call and perhaps they would wake up the wrong person because I had given the wrong room number.I must have spent 15 minutes trying to get it straightened out. Never did.Lasty, the man guarding the breakfast buffet woud not let me go in to get breakfast. I googled the Grand Nile Tower before leaving on the tour. You had a 3. I believe that is generous. You have such great potential to truly be a five star hotel. I hope you make changes or just deep clean the rooms.I can not and would not ever recommend this hotelunti changes are made. ¬†If this is the quality of hotels Aventura books, I need to really investigate accommodations before booking with them again. ThankyouKaren Dedmon ‚Ä¶

The hotel is perfect. Nothing went wrong. The room was spacious with amazing nile view. Everything was clean. The beds were so comfortable. Breakfast was varried that you will find anything you need. It is worth every pound paid. I really enjoyed my visit

Visited the hotel November 25-28.  Room 2246 with excellent views of the Nile and the city.  Be sure to visit the restaurant on the top floor.  Very friendly staff.  Special thanks to the manager Muhamed, a professional in his field.  Helped organize a great weekend, solved any issues and responded to all requests.  Thanks

The rooms were spacious with a great view over the Nile (I was too low to able to see the pyramids), the standard was so-so, but you could easily tell that this has some age to it. I would not exactly describe this an luxury hotel, but I do think I might have a bit higher standards. The room also had one of my pet peeves, but I was aware of it: carpets on the floor. The room was also seemingly clean, but I could see a few spot on the carpets that in addition to some dorm bunnies. The A/C worked somehow, but it was difficult to adjust the temperature. The TV in the room didn't work, nor did the mini-bar/fridge in the room. The bathroom were also aged, and it was a bit of a hazard to get in and out of the bathtub/shower. The hair dryer worked nicely. I did have some issues the key cards several times, but it was all easily fixed in the reception.   I did not have any problems with the Wi-Fi, it was very easy to use, and I was a bit reassured when I arrived and saw how it was, as I don't really like an open-open Wi-Fi service. But a lot of my colleagues had more troubles with the Wi-Fi, which I found a bit confusing.   I also payed for breakfast included with the room, the breakfast area in the lobby (Fotana Restaurant) had a lovely view, although it was quite noisy due to the layout. There was a great variety of food and drinks, but it was a hassle to ask the waiter/waitress for plain water everytime. The staff quite quick to remove the plates, but in terms of making the table ready for the next guests were so-so. I also observed that the coffee/tea part were changed during my stay, from self-service on a counter, to the waiter walking a trolley around. I also had breakfast down in the food court as I believe the lobby-area was full at certain time. I have the same remarks for there.  I went around the hotel as I had some free time, it was very nice that the hotel offered two ATM (which was particularly lucky for me, as I could get one of them to work for me). Be aware to get money in cash, there's few places that have changes for bills, especially the restaurant, but at least you have the option to pay by card. I was pleased that there were A/Cs throughout the hotel, but I do question how they were operated, as certain days it was so cold that I was actually freezing in the hotel. The swimming pool area was nice with a great view. The terrace floor was also nice, but completely empty of furniture. I checked some of the gifts shops, which were nice and bought some things since it was so easy, but I do think that the person in charge was a bit too pushy with a bit of a communication problem. I did inquire about the airport transportation - which was quite expensive, so I used a third party service which worked nicely. But for the ease of it, I would consider using the hotel's airport transportation if I traveled here again for the convenience.  During our stay I tried two of the restaurant located in the hotel: The Revolving Restaurant and the El Sakya Souk Restaurant with a group of colleagues. We were most satisfied with the Revolving Restaurant in terms of the food, but the services was better in the El Sakya Souk Restaurant. But the view at the Revolving Restaurant is gorgeous, just a shame that about the air pollution, as I believe it could have been even better without the air pollution. I would not recommend trying the pizza at the El Sakya Souk Restaurant. It is also prudent to remember the 12% service charge + taxes, and there's no alcohol, only non-alcoholic options.   It seemed that the hotel did a lot of things, I could observe at least two weddings during my stay, a lot of tourist groups; and there was some loud music happening in the evenings. In additional to our own conference, the facilities for it was satisfying. There's also quite a lot of smokers in this hotel, especially in the lobby, which was a huge cultural shock as this isn't usual for me/us. Grand Nile Tower is a very busy hotel, lucky I could not hear or sense this in my room. The staff were very friendly and polite, but I do think that there were some communications problems/errors. ‚Ä¶

I've been there many times everything is good at the hotel breakfast is good, dinner needs more variety, the lady who works at the VIP lounge is very helpful and professional, the receptionist gaber wasn't helpful for handling my reservation  he kept me waiting until he make check in for other group until he call his friend from the shift before to check my reservation, over all good experience

The staff was very helpful and friendly üòÉ The view of the Nile is very magnificent from the room Nice room üòÑ the food and drinks was very good üëç and diverse  Room service was very good üëç and very helpful

We had dinner at the restaurant.  The wagu beef melted in your mouth, the prawns perfectly cooked.  We had the blue crab bisque as our appetizer.  Best meal in Egypt.  And the view is stunning.   Highly recommend - well worth the money.  Service was A+.  Will definitely go again.

When arriving to the hotel you have large expectations. Huge and elegant lobby. Unfortunately loud music during the evening. Large and clean room with balcony. The room are a bit worn out. We got a room with a view to the Nile. Beautiful! We arrived late as a group. Despite several calls in advance no keys were prepared for us, so we had to wait a while.  Breakfast the first morning was in the food court. Many guests had to wait for clean cups. The waiter came only with 3 - 4 cups at a time. No cold milk for the cereals. Cutlery were in plastic. Breakfst the second morning were in the lobby and all went fine. When arriving for dinner the first evening our group were refused access to the restaurant. It showed to be a mistake from the hotel. There were only 2 waiters in the restaurant to clean the tables and receive orders for drinks. They did what they could but could not avoid the guests had to wait to be able to order their drinks. It was not possible to get the drinks on the room but we had to pay before leaving the restaurant every day. No alcohol on the hotel!‚Ä¶

The only good thing of this hotel is location. Drinking coffee next to the Nile is a fantastic experience. And that's for pros, cons are: dirty rooms, misinformation about open bars/restaurants, Area for storing baggage is open to everybody! And actually, one couple's luggage was lost in this hotel. Someone just came in and took their luggage! No alcohol in the whole hotel - that's not a 5* hotel as they claim they are

The Grand Nile Tower hotel is one of the most beautiful hotel in Cairo. Our staying here was incredible! The room view was breath taking and inside the room was very clean and the internet connection was really fast and full of signal, the services were excellent. Also the breakfast was rich and full of choices. The staff here was really welcoming and kind! I definitely recommend everybody to come and stay at this hotel. The price of the hotel for all that it offers is affordable.

The only good thing about the hotel was the close proximity to the airport. Otherwise it was nothing to write home about.   The room we had had a dead wasp. There was mold in the shower rack. The room we had was so far we had to go outside and into another building.   The check-in was awful too. We were early and even offered to pay extra for early check-in, but they didn‚Äôt allow it until 9am when we arrived at 6am. We were also had our luggage searched because it seems the guy doing the check can‚Äôt tell how a shaver power cord looks like.   The hotel lobby was filled with cigarette smoke too.   Check-out was also painful when we requested for a bellboy to help us transport our luggage. No one picked up the guest service line.   The meals downstairs were also bland and not really good. Although I can give them credit that I did not get sick, which was why I stuck to their buffet offerings instead of eating out and risk getting sick before a long 12 hour flight.   I‚Äôll never recommend this hotel even if you need to be close to the airport. Truly terrible all around experience here and in Egypt.‚Ä¶

Novotel Cairo airport hotel is my favorite hotel for staying over in all my international and domestic air travels to and from Cairo. I used to spend at least one night before and after my inbound and outbound flights for relaxing. Good location, good rooms and excellent services including free shuttle bus services to Cairo airport terminals. Efficient reception and guest relations staff, perfect house keeping services makes the hotel environment Covid safe.

Several of us were put in this hotel because a delayed flight meant we missed our onward connection. Check-in wasn't great, as commented by other reviews. Worse was the room which smelt like an ashtray - if there were non-smoking rooms we were not asked if we would want these; the room was disgustingly filthy, especially the bath and shower curtain; there was a half eaten muffin on the desk in the bedroom. We only had a 4 hour stay but it was awful, the smoking smell was s strong that I couldn't sleep even though very tired.. Other travellers on my flight who had also been placed in this hotel said their rooms were equally bad (but they didn't have half eaten muffins) and they also didn't sleep.  If you are a non-smoker and are forced to go in this hotel by your airline, ask if they have non-smoker rooms.‚Ä¶

Modern hotel near the airport with shuttle - a bit soulless but neat and clean - with nice pool and pretty decent restaurant.  Only issue - which is common in Egypt - is staff expecting you to have exact money. They try to collect city tax in cash but have no change available and get angsty when you have no change either. Novotel - you are the one running a business - how hard is it to keep a drawer of change on hand.

Hi . Check in experience was horrible right from shuttle at the airport to the front desk. . When at the hotel the front desk did not have the courtesy to look after my reservation and they were busy with Egypt airline cancellation bookings ‚Äì they were totally unorganized and ignorant looking after people who came after me. . The agent in front desk did not brief anything about our room had to get information from the   bell boy. That was pathetic and I was served as though its free accommodation given. . Did complained with the duty manager by the name Amir and he was apologetic on the    experience and he assured by on my check out he would have a breakfast box ready since we had to check out time at 4:00 am and I was not surprised even this was not obliged as well. Overall pathetic experience I would not recommend anyone to this property. ‚Ä¶

Check out services teriible. Plenty of wasting time. Being close proximoty to airpprt very busy but staff at reception takes too much time. All the info is there in the system but they need to check inside etc. Very disappointed.

I picked this hotel for my one night stopover at Cairo before flying back. As it is right next to the airport with a free shuttle to and from the airport, it was a no-brainer. I also asked them to keep my luggage at the hotel for 3 days before my check-in and they had no issues. It was tagged and kept in the back storage room safe and sound. They also provided me a number to contact the driver when I land, but that number didn't work. Even the hotel number on their business card was not working (saying it is invalid), which was weird.
