However, after much fiddling I did get a hold of the driver and was able to catch the shuttle from the airport. The shuttle to the airport runs every half hour (at the top of the hour), if there are passengers present, so that wasn't a problem.  The front desk staff was a pain to deal with. Not that they were not friendly, or helpful, but they were slow. If you thought DMV was slow, guess again. Either they were overwhelmed or they were all trainees, but this is the most time I have every spent at a check-in our check-out at any of the hotels I stayed at. The lobby is very nice with a pool in the back, and the night we arrived they even had a live concert (Arabic) happening. Thankfully it finished around midnight else sleeping would've been an issue.  The passageways to the rooms are visibly dated. They felt more like a motel than a Novotel. However, the rooms were clean and all the amenities were there. Our night sleep was much more comfortable than I could've imagined. Also, our room door had a broken deadbolt, so that was something. Food service was sub-par. We ordered dinner around 9 and they gave us stale bread, maybe 2 days old. Even the meats were not fresh. I would advise eating ahead before coming here. Breakfast is a buffet spread and that was good. But we did not have it included so had to pay $10/person. Overall, a good hotel for a quick stopover before catching your flight, but do not plan to stay longer.‚Ä¶

->Area and Surroundings: The hotel is great in terms of location as it is next to the Nile River and connected by two bridges on the either side. One can walk for 5-10 minutes for reaching a general conveno store.   ->Room: I was upgraded to Nile facing room by hotel compliments. The walk to the room was very long, the carpets in the corridor made it difficult to drag the bags, the ceiling height of corridor and room was pretty low.   The room was a normal room, and I did not find it to be too big in room size. All the furniture in the room was decent. The design of the room was pretty old compared to the new modern hotel rooms which are able to take our more space in the same size of the room.  The view from the room was of NILE river and that was one of the consoling factors. At the time of our stay the hotel was undergoing paint work, hence we had to use sheer curtains / blackout curtains for privacy.  The service was very very slow. We asked for water and ice it took them 1 hour to get it, each time we called reception they use to say ‚Äúthe person is on the way‚Äù. They well knew that there were two guests in the room, then also only 01 water bottle was placed on each day instead of entitled two bottles. The reception gave a QR code to contact hotel for services on whtsapp, when I tried, there was no response on the same.  The pillows were extremely not comfortable, when asked to change for feather pillow, thin pillow or orthopedic pillow, the hotel simply denied.  ->Bathroom and Bathing experience: The bathroom was also decent. The setup for shower was like an arrangement which may fall apart at any moment.   ->Hotel Staff: The staff was not upto the mark. We requested the evening staff for preparing our meal boxes as we had a 3:20 AM departure to catch a light. They took our preferences and confirmed. Next day morning what was provided in the breakfast was totally different from what was confirmed.  ->Breakfast: The buffet breakfast was well managed and the spread was good. There were plenty of vegetarian options. The desert / pastry was a miss.  ->Swimming Pool / Gym / Spa: The hotel had a swimming pool like there are few at houses/ appartments. Simply basic  ->Lounge access: I did not have the lounge access.  ->Special mention: Wifi is free, and the speed is not very good. I would suggest a overhaul to the hotel for its floor or reduce charges of the room rate. Its not value for money.‚Ä¶

This place is an absolute tip and the service from reception staff is appalling.  Stayed here on 2 occasions for 1 night at the start and end of my trip. First night the guy at reception insisted we hadn't paid although we had as it was a business trip. He was rude and kept shuffling the card machine towards me for payment, insisting we couldnt check in until parent was made. His attitude changed when he realised we had someone with us who spoke Arabic, then he was full of smiles and allowed us to check in stating parent had been received, he just couldn't allocate it.  They take scans of your passport and leave people's personal details in full view on the counter  for anyone to see or even take.  The room clearly hadn't been cleaned and I booked a double when I was given 2 singles with an unlocked adjoining door which made me feel on edge the whole night.   The second night I stayed there, I asked the man on reception if he could confirm payment was received on their system and he insisted it had and we could check in (great). The room this time was disgusting. Dirty carpets that hasn't been hoovered, the bathroom was falling apart with paint flaking all around the shower and just overall grim appearance. Two single beds again when a double room was booked and the Aircon was like a jet engine!  Got woken up on several occasions by housekeeping from 7am wanting to clean my room. Their urgency to clean my room was a shock given the general state of it.  Upon checking out my colleagues had no issues until it was my time to check out and again, they insisted I had not paid. I evidenced booking confirmation and they did not want to accept it and again kept pushing the card machine towards me. The staff were rude especially a female member of staff who had appalling attitude. This went on for nearly 30 minutes with the staff instsiting I hadn't paid, getting the general manager to talk to me and state I could not leave until I paid. This was extremely stressful given I had to leave for the airport. After 30 minutes of them being rude and calling me a liar, the general manager said I could go. When I asked if he'd located payment he stated no but I could go and he would chase up with my organisation for payment & this never happened.   Clearly a hotel with staff trying to con people out of more money. DO NOT STAY HERE.‚Ä¶

DON'T GO THERE unless you don't have other options. The reception continued doing whatever he was doing and didn't acknowledge my presence. The room untidy and smeely. I couldn't wait to leave, it's just my flight was taking off late. I wouldn't recommend it

We spent a one night layover at the Hilton Heliopolis in Cairo.  An impressive hotel. It was huge & very busy with tourists. Our room was on the 5th floor.  The best thing about Hilton hotels is the format & amenities are the same, wherever you go in the world. Big bedroom, big bathroom. The bed was huge & so comfy. Without doubt it was the comfiest bed I‚Äôve slept in, in the last 12 months. It was like sleeping on a cloud. There was a welcome platter of fruit & pastries waiting for us. The hotel has many restaurants to visit. We are & drank in the English bar downstairs next to the casino & watched the World Cup football matches. Food there was very good. Breakfast in the morning was standard Hilton fare, but with some local dishes. Peacocks in the gardens too! A complimentary shuttle bus brought us to the airport. A delightful stay. Would highly recommend..‚Ä¶

If you are looking for a hotel in Cairo, you have just arrived at the best option. Hilton Cairo Heli√≥polis surpassed all of these expectations.  As soon as we arrived, we realized that security is a detail that makes all the difference. All cars are inspected and the bags go through a metal detector and x-ray.  When we entered the hotel we understood why all security: surely only the highest authorities stay in this hotel. In fact, more than a hotel, the Hilton Cairo Heliopolis looks like a big conglomerate. During the three nights we were in Cairo, we didn't have to leave the hotel for dinner, because inside the hotel there are Arab, American, Italian, Japanese, Mexican restaurants... and much more...  The leisure area is sensational!! The pools are for all tastes, whether for children or adults. In addition, we realized that the hotel is keen to ensure that we are well taken care of at all times.  The breakfast was amazing, highlighted by chefs Ahmed and Mohamed who were very friendly preparing our fried eggs and omelets. We love the incredible experience provided by Hilton Cairo Heliopolis.  Finally, we are grateful to the helpful hotel concierge team who assisted us with everything we needed, from tours to local activities. On the last day we needed to take the COVID test and the concierge arranged for a doctor to come to our hotel room, making our routine a lot easier.  We recommend the hotel without a shadow of a doubt, you will be very well attended!  Philippe (@pspelomundo)‚Ä¶

Dear Rania,     I'd like to thank Mr. Mahmoud Abdelaziz  the best hospitality's employee that i ever seen among Hilton's hotels all over the world.  Cause he always make me feel like that i'm stay at my home.

Was a nice experience, location is great, rooms are small need little more maintenance  TV was large and amazing  Breakfast was nice with a lot of variety  Many thanks to each and every team member I already planned my next stay there very soon

Very Elegant Hotel with excellent working atea either at room or lounge ,very beautiful lobby & Health center ,great Experience with a very professional team  Excellent Hospitality ,tasty Food ,Clean Room & amazing Sauna & Spa  If you are HHonor Member ,Just ask for Luaren ,she will offer you a great help & support during your stay exceed all Expectation  Easy check in ,Room upgrade & offering late check out

All the staff was so friendly especially ms . Sarah samir from the guest relations and nerimine from the ice bar.the rooms are clean and spacious. The food at the restaurant tasted great and there was alot of varieties .

Our server was Fatma and wow how she made us feel so welcome to the restaurant. Her English was enough to understand and coffee was the best I have had in 2 weeks here. Pistachio cake was amazing as was onion soup and bread.

It was one of my best experience and it starts since I have enter the hotel .  Every this was clean and clear the hotel smells good.  The lobby bar was amazing,  specially Shema (the Hosts) she was lovely with a beautiful smile and smell she was like a girl on fire üî•  she was a super professional and she was so active with all gust.  Definitely I will have to come back again.  Thanks for making my day perfect.

A great hotel, with plenty of dining choices - the rainbow bar food was very good. Mohamed in the pool bar was great. Rooms a little dated but clean and comfortable. They run an hourly shuttle bus to the airport. Good facilities including luggage store.

I was here during the month of October 22, reception and staff are lovable and nice, ready to help. Breakfast is very abundant and nice. All staff is very helpful. I've had dinner in hotel at lebanise restaurant in the hall, very very nice food. I've used the shuttle to airport and everything ok. Room clean, only matter is that tents are not closing and lights came inside.

first time in eygpt . hotel was great staff frienfly and helpfull  the  club lounge upstairs was great. the .service to food up there perfect .thanks for an amazng staying  my room  looked over the nile rive

I arrived at 3 PM to the Hotel , At thecheck in time , It was very busy time with long line , when my turn come and I meet the wonderful lady at reception she was high professional team member , she was very welcome,  supportive,  she give me all details I need at my stay , even when she was tried badly by one of the guest at my check in time she kept here professionalism appearing in here replay to hem ,MRS, Zainab , Thank you for your welcoming , One of the reasons that will make me back to this Hotel is you,  Secondly:-   MRS,Saidah at Housekeeping, there is no word can exceplain you kindness and the spirit when you serve the guests , truly there is no word can describe your kindness and hospitality.  Both of you , wish you all the best in your live and I will back to this Hotel because of you.  Ayyaf Alzahrani  Room 2919‚Ä¶

The hotel is very conveniently located in Cairo and the rooms are spacious but didn't seem very clean. The hotel is too big - such that you have to call again and again for services. The breakfast buffet was very good - lots of variety and tasty food. However, we opted for the packed breakfast the day of our departure as we had an early flight and we were given absolutely nothing. Cold,  dry buns with some eggplant in them, bottle of juice and water in each bag. We could not eat the buns at all. Very disappointing.

I am a Diamond reward member, and my tour operator booked the room for us for Nov. 14 and 15.  We checked in rather late and told the front desk of my status.  We were given room on the 11th floor. When we got there the room smelled with cigarette and the bathroom tiles had molds in them.  The faucets were constantly leaking, and there was not enough covering on the bathtub to keep the water from spilling on the floor when we took a shower.  My wife who is asthmatic, and has cancer, and myself did not get that much sleep. The following day, I complained to the front desk and was transferred to room on the 19th floor which was somewhat better as there was a shower curtain, although the faucet was also leaking.  The breakfast was good though and the Indian restaurant was great!  Other than these positive comments, honestly, this is our worst hotel stay ever.‚Ä¶

A heartfelt shoutout to Remonda Adly, Silvia Samir, and Mohamed Taha from the Executive Floors team: thank you again for the great experience, it was very much appreciated!  Location: If you're trying to stay downtown near the Egyptian Museum and Tahrir Square, this is very central. The Egyptian Museum is literally a 3 min walk, and the corniche walkway is right across the street.  Breakfast: Great selection of local and western options. Onsite chef can customize your omelets, as well as other fresh options. Coffee (americano, espresso, cappuccino, etc.) and tea selection is pretty good. They also had 2 onsite options of freshly squeezed orange juice and mango juice while I was there.  View: the Hilton is probably one of the tallest buildings in the vicinity and the top floors give you great sweeping views of downtown, parts of old Cairo, and the Nile. If you have lounge access, you'll have ready refreshments to go with the view, as well as some breakfast options. The room I stayed in was recently renovated, and had all the amenities you would expect from a 4 or 5 star hotel.  Service: this is where the hotel really shined for me. Taken I do have status with the hotel, but I couldn't have asked for anything more. From early check-in to late check-out, everything was very smooth and personable, and all the staff members I encountered were quite helpful. I was also given access to the lounge after my checkout until the next step of my itinerary. Ramses Hilton definitely knows how to take care of its tier members.  Other notes: The gym was a little bit on the smaller end, but had everything I needed. The elevators are a little outdated and could be a bit slow, especially if you're heading to the top floors, but personally I didn't mind: these are all small prices to pay for all the other benefits. Definitely a 5/5 in my book :)  I look forward to coming back soon.‚Ä¶

During our stay at the Ramses Hilton the entire staff, from the check in professionals to the room cleaners, to the concierge were proactively helpful, respectful, friendly, and kind. I needed some special support services during my stay and the entire staff helped in any way they could. I highly recommend the Ramses Hilton. Incredible staff.

The staff at the Ramses Hilton in Cairo provided us with outstanding customer service.  I would like to give a special commendation to two employees that went above and beyond to ensure we had an excellent stay.  Thank you Fatma Abbas and Abdallah Abou kbier for providing us with EXCELLENT customer service throughout our stay! We truly appreciate the outstanding service we received.

Where do I start? Staff is super nice, but the rooms are utterly disgusting. Old decrepit filthy musty obscenely neglected. By management! This seems to be a Hilton thing. Filth! Avoid it at all cost.

Super wonderful classy hotel i can not get over how much i loved all the stuff and all details and the food is tasty with a wonderful view great thanks to mr mohammed taha the amazing Exexutive floor manger and the lovely mariam and special thanks to mohammed rabie and yassen from executive lounge i do love all of you and recommend ramais hilton to anyone to enjoy the nice view the amazing location and the lovely hospitality üíôüíôüíô

I would like to thank the hotel‚Äôs management and the brilliant team for their great services provided during my stay with my family @ Ramses Hilton, really we have enjoyed due to the wonderful hospitality and smiley team along with their always support and assistance particularly the front desk team and F&B team. Again thank you and definitely will see you all soon. Sincerely, Ahmed and my lovely family:)

Dahab Hostel exceeded all of my expectations. They helped to arrange a trip both from and to the airport, even for my flight that arrived at 2:00am. The location of the hostel in the city is excellent. Very convenient for all locations you may wish to visit. Located on the top floor, the open air rooftop layout of this hostel offers excellent views and wonderful communal spaces. Dahab hostel provides a wonderful breakfast every morning for a very affordable price; the perfect way to start your day. The bathroom facilities were very clean and the staff was very attentive. The bedrooms are small, but with all there is to see in the city, along with the shared spaces available, you'll only need your room for sleeping. I would recommend Dahab Hostel to all my friends looking to visit Cairo. ‚Ä¶

The best hostel in Cairo! The location is amazing, everything is quite close.   The Egyptian National Museum is a 5-7 min walk far away!   You can order food, booking tours etc.  It is a place for old and young!   I enjoyed my time a lot there.  Some people staying there for one month or longer because it is so lovely!  Now I can understand why.   The people are amazing there!   The best staffs ever. I became good friends with some of them!   Especially Esra, Achmed & Mohamed (Gaber) are really ambitious and passionate staffs there!  Hope to see you again! :-)   Best regards,  Mo

Great location, clean and simple room, lovely rooftop atmosphere. All the services and comfort a weary traveler requires. The staff were very knowledgable and helpful in booking day trips, taxis and even delivery food app. Went above and beyond to help and were very accommodating.

I had an awesome time at the Dahab hostel! It's the place where I started and ended my  3 week journey throughout Egypt. It's also a great place to meet other travelers, plan your journey or just chill on the rooftop!! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Shout out to Salama, Esraa, Gaber, Ahmed.. Huge thanks to EVERYONE (including the kittens) for a wonderful stay! ;-)

I had the greatest time in Cairo while staying in dahab hostel  they offer a Great service  The staff is Cool and very helpful  Not to mention how amazing the vibes in that place Very clean and hygenic place and very much secure It's located in downtown Cairo where everything is close by and at reach

We had a pleasant experience, the hostel is centrally located , right next to the Egyptian museum and Tahir square yet peaceful , the cats in the premise are adorable and fun to watch.  Shout out to the staff especially Ahmed and Salama , they go out of their way to make you feel comfortable.  They also help you plan your itenary and organize your trip at very reasonable rates.  It's their warmth and Willingness to help that I rate them the highest for.

I've had an outstanding time in Dahab Hostel. The staff Ahmed, Salama, Mohammed, Hassan,  Essraa played a big part in this experience. Feels like coming home in this tranquil oasis after wondering off on the busy streets of Cairo. Would also recommend the Nile Cruise they offer, just be prepared to wake up early some days.  Thank you Dahab Hostel!

The staff is amazing, always ready to help, super friendly. They take care of many cats and kittens, they will make you feel at home immediately. Location is in the middle of down-town, but the rooftop-hostel is like an oasis and we felt so relaxed. Not noisy at all. Reception is open 24/7, good breakfast and beds.  We had such an amazing time at this hostel, we came back at the end of our trip and I would recommend it to anyone! As a solo-traveler you can easily meet new people. Many places on the rooftop to chill, chat or take a nap.

Completely beautiful place - amazing fun helpful easygoing staff and gorgeous vibe. It felt like a big family. Awesome views over town. Fun part of the city, vibrant lots of streets to wander. Wish I could have stayed longer. Especially enjoyed rooftop chats with Samala! Hope I can come back soon

Fantastic hostel. Staff extremely helpful and assist you not only with hotel related stuff but also with trip advice, safety and assistance.  Salama was very helpful when assisting me with my train booking to Alexandria. He was also very kind when asking about my plans and giving me local knowledge of the different parts of Cairo. Ahmed checked me in on several occasions and always enquired as to how I was doing and gave me some sterling safety advice when taking public transport. The lady who made me breakfast every morning 'Ohmmaqmood' I think her name was, accommodated my nutrition requirements without question.   Overall if you are visiting as a solo traveller or a couple, I wouldn't stay anywhere else. The service is second to none!

I am frequently travelling to Cairo as part of my current project. I always prefer to stay at Marriott group hotels. JW Marriott Cairo is in a different league altogether. Being a platinum member, I have access to lounge and other fantastic facilities available. I would like to specifically mention the name of Ms Karen who takes care of each and every guest with at-most care with highest sincerity. JW Cairo is absolutely a class apart.

Had an amazing two week stay in July 2022.  Was in Cairo for work and got to spend two weekends and evenings here in this wonderful hotel.  The hotel is very clean, the rooms are fantastic, and the staff is very helpful.  Used the concierge for several bookings with the hotel car and a day tour to the pyramids.  Everything went very smoothly and I didnt have to worry about a thing.  The executive lounge is excellent with delicious food and plenty of drinks in the evening.  the staff in the lounge is excellent and always met me by name with a smile.  I would be remiss if I didn‚Äôt mention a specific staff member, Aya.  From the moment she checked me in until i checked out two week later she was a constant bright spot in my days.  She anticipated anything i might need and always checked to make sure that I had everything i needed.  She truly is one of, if not the best, Marriott employee i have ever encountered.  Always a smile and always thinking about how she could help me.  She is an asset to the JW Cairo for sure.  I cannot wait to come back and visit again as soon as I am able!‚Ä¶

It was a pleasant stay, friendly staff, JW tends to keep the high standard of service among other places, special thanks to Ahmed Sameh  ( front office) as he was vey helpful and is very keen to keep everyone satisfied during their stay. JW Marriott will always be my first choice for luxurious and comfort stay

We highly recommend this hotel and lounge. The service is next level and the staff super kind and attentive.  The lounge has amazing food, snacks and drinks all day. Full breakfast and dinner buffets. The spa is lovely and offerings are great! We had an amazing stay and look forward to returning!!!

Wow, what a place. Friendly, smiling staff whatever the time of day. Spotless room, best breakfast selection I‚Äôve ever seen!  Didn‚Äôt have time to use spa sadly but will return and make use of all the facilities. Very handy for the airport (15 minutes away).

One of best hotel in cairo.  I travel to cairo offer and JW definitely is one of the best.  The services always High extant. The stuff always friendly and super helpful.  The gym is amazing one of best in all the hotels I ever have travelling. Good food! Easy to access to the airport!  Hour drive to old cairo. But Uber works very well and cheap !   A special thank you to Logiem on reception. She did our check in and out. Absolutely professional and friendly. Always caring about our stay and how we spend our week here.  Thank you so much for all make this hotel special.  Wish I could remember all the names. To all who make this hotel special. See you all very soon.

This hotel is my favorite and best choice in Cairo. Their customer care is the best.  I would highly mention and thank Peter from the reception team because he‚Äôs super helpful, supportive and makes the experience of my stay like very exceptional. He is proving that customer service is a key and because of it, I asked all our team members to stay in the same hotel every time we visit Cairo for business meetings.  Having said that, I conducted couple of events there and he also helped big time along with the event team; nada included to provide us with all the needed for our events.

Great stay highly recommend and appreciated. Personnel rooms and food were great and the room very clean. Breakfast among live piano music was excellent experience to have. Definitely I will be back for my next visit in Egypt

The property is quite grand with lots of grounds to walk on. The gym and recreation area is excellent with good working equipment the hotel also has several nice restaurants which is good. The staff are very helpful and always keen to please. I left a two garments however the Hotel has not called inspite of inquiries

Great hotel, luxurious  clean rooms and lot of green space. The staff are welcoming, smiley and cheerful. Special thanks to the receptionist Aya who went out of her way to resolve a billing issue and make us feel welcome. I will definitely come back again

Stayed here on a family holiday for 8 nights. Had two superior rooms with sofa beds in each, with city views (quieter than Nile view?)  Reception staff were extremely helpful allocating both rooms on the same floor, close to each other, Floor 5. Rooms were a good size, very clean, beds very comfortable and the sofa bed adequate for two children aged 6 and 7. People have complained about the outside noise from Nile cruises into the night but this did not cause a big issue. We had read reviews so were well aware. Do your research before you stay! Housekeeping staff were very attentive to any needs or requirements for our room, always with a smile. The buffet breakfast was excellent with lots of choice of both hot and cold food. Omelettes etc. were also made to order. The rooftop restaurant was a nice place to chill with great views over Cairo. The swimming pool was on the small side, very clean and a relaxing place to chill as a family. Used Ubers for getting around and walked to many places too. Plenty of Restaurants in the area and small supermarkets for drinks, snacks etc. All in all, a very welcoming, well equipped, spotless hotel with great staff.‚Ä¶

One of our best places that we visit for sure We will recommend this hotel to our friends and family the hotel has an amazing nile view and a wonderful city view with the cairo tower and opera house also we got our dinner at one of the best restaurants ever at the hotel rooftop. Thanks for the staff starting with a talented guest relation also reception team and the helpful house keeping team.

The noise in the room from the outside of the hotel makes it completely impossible to sleep. There is absolutely nothing the hotel can do about this . But if I knew about the noise I would I stay at another hotel . The music is so loud you can‚Äôt hear the TV   The hotel is ok . Basic and clean .  The rooftop bar does not serve alcohol .  We don‚Äôt eat or use the facilities.  Although well located I would not recommend this hotel based on the noise .

If you intend to sleep, DO NOT stay at this hotel. For a 5 star hotel it was a terrible stay.  I stayed for 3 nights on both sides of the hotel. Either side you stay it was extremely loud and could not sleep. It sounded as if the there were no windows or the windows were open. ABSOLUTELY NO SOUNDPROOFING. Nile side had party boats and nightclub playing extremely loud music directly across from the hotel till 3am and the other side had the opera house which also played very loud music till late at night. I could hear absolutely everything from extremely loud music, constant beeping on the streets and call for prayer music. After reading the reviews from others it appears they always reply with customer care is a priority however all the rooms are renovated but the issue of soundproofing was completely discarded. Complete disregard for customer comfort. Also wifi within the hotel unusable. Don‚Äôt even bother with wifi. I don‚Äôt often write reviews but for this hotel I felt it is required so no one else experiences what I did. DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY AND TIME AT THIS HOTEL!!!!‚Ä¶

This hotel is wonderful I really had a good time in this hotel and the Houseman he was a good man I liked him  Thanks to novotel team  And pesificly omar el ashry He made me happy by his laugh at me in the morning

Stayed in a nicely renovated Nile view room which was  NOT Soundproofed.  Why spend the money to renovate and not address such a fundamental problem ?.  The nightclub and party boats that moor across the road play loud music until 03:00. Then at 4:00 there is the first call to prayer by they equally loud  and mega-sized speakers from the mosque next door.   Wifi terrible but this is Egypt so buy a local SIM.  As for the noise, even earplugs couldn‚Äôt fix the problem.  Stay somewhere else ( even the 3 star we previously stayed in which had better soundproofing).

This is a very nice hotel, right on the base of the Nile. The hotel staff very kindly arranged a car from the airport to the hotel and a room was lovely. Breakfast in the morning is good and the concierge helped arrange dinners. The only problem that I would advise Travelers to stay away from is the Hacienda tours in the hotel lobby. They are, in my opinion, somewhat shady. Buyer definitely beware.

Dears .. first of all i need to thank the staff to make our stay perfect. The rooms was cleans and our room had a beautiful view on nile view . They have a beautiful roof top it‚Äôs a panoramic view ‚ù§Ô∏è  Very recommended and i will come back again for sure

Offered an upgrade to Nile facing suite and whilst appreciated I suspect the rooms on the Nike side are often vacated for quieter rooms on the other side of the hotel. Party boat music starts in the late afternoon and finishes after 2am. Loud irregular drumming and some amateur sounding singing does grate on the nerves. Turning the fan up full on your rooms AC does help to drown out the noise slightly but occasionally there was a live female singer whose voice could shatter the hotels windows. If you wear hearing aids or sleep with noise cancelling headphones then you‚Äôll be okay. The actual room and the view over the Nile was very nice so hopefully the Novotel has plans to add some social glazing in their windows for the party boat noise. Pool was small, some reception staff had difficulty with English and ambiance of hotel seemed more for Egyptian business people.   For cheap water and snacks: exit the hotel facing the Nile. Turn to your right and walk down the first street to your right ( you dont have to cross the road). A very honest man that does not export tourists owns a small minimart. Small water 4LE, Small Sprite 5LE, Small Dorito chips 6LE.‚Ä¶

Really a terrible shame.   What could be a very nice hotel,let down by complete neglect.  Internet completely unworkable.  You may be able to log on occasionally, but it is unusable.  They say you can go to the lobby and use and fob you off with stories about passing complaints to IT manager.  People are not going to Egypt to surf internet, but in todays connected world where everything is done online this is really too much.  Want to check your flight details? Bad luck, head to the lobby.  Want to talk with family and friends back home, bad luck.  Want to order an under eats or car to go to the airport, your outa luck.  Want to keep kids entertained with YouTube after a long day touring? You guessed it.   Room service food I found terrible, but kids liked it.  If you have taste of eight year old child then I guess this is good enough for you.  Rooms in bad need of refurbishment, but the beds are genuinely comfortable.  Staff are nice and friendly, trying to help where they can.  There is a fun fair and disco river boats stationed directly across from the hotel.  The noise is extremely loud.  Kids talked me into taking them down and we had a good time.  If you are thinking of sleeping anytime before late/early morning than think again.  Avoid at all costs using the tour service in the hotel lobby.  After confirming the tour with them and all costs involved they immediately started asking for extra money for entry fees, extra money for car entry, insisting that they pay for entry tickets etc etc.  They immediately stoped at a papyrus ‚Äúmuseum‚Äù for high pressure sales, and when at the pyramids then dump you with aggressive camel touts and insist that the tour you paid for is only a taxi fee to drive you back and forward from the hotel. Only the threat of getting police involved  as the camel tout was leaning in the car screaming at me and my 8 year old daughter who was shaking in fear when we refused to pay hundreds of dollars for additional add ons to the ‚Äútour‚Äù got them to leave.  In short do not have anything to do with this hotels tour services.  A complete disgrace and an embarrassment for the Novotel hotel range to be associated with.‚Ä¶

i would like to thank you Mr.Alaa Helmy the butler manager for the welcome and helpful thank you very much for your efforts and care and make my stay special thank you very much Mr.alaa Helmy see you soon again  mohamed myasser

The hotel is great at all standers,all facilities are available,staff more than amazing,great hospitality.We had enjoyed our stay. "La Sconda " the Italian restaurant down there is perfect, delicious food and great serving.the manager Mr.mohamed was more than perfect:) we had a great dinner. The breakfast variety was distinguish,fresh and wide range of dishes for all tastes.Staff at the main restaurant were all outstanding and professional  Stay there is Highly recommend :)

My family and I visited the St. Regis due to an emergency evacuation at another hotel. The night manager went above and beyond to coordinate our transportation to the hotel and stayed engaged with us every step of the way. When we arrived, we were greeted with kindness and excellent customer service. The property was well maintained, the room was beautiful and everyone on staff made our visit very enjoyable. The property is far from Giza and other tourist areas. However, the St. Regis team will definitely make it worth your while. Would absolutely stay there again.

The worst experience in any hotel‚Ä¶.made a reservation months ago and 4 days before my scheduled arrival, i got a message from the hotel that they are canceling my reservation.    First I thought something happened to the hotel and they had to close it for an emergency. I went to the hotel website to make a new reservation for the same dates only to find out that they have lots of availability but the price is doubled. I have been traveling for 45 years with thousands of hotel experiences and never have I experienced anything like this. Avoid this hotel at all cost just in case they do the same thing to you before arrival.

The hotel accommodations are excellent,  the staff and their services are one of the best so far in my experience traveling around the world either for business or pleasure.  The service and the food at their different restaurants are excellent and they go an  extra mile to make sure you're having a good time.  Their SPA offers a very professional and great service.   It's a little far from the main attractions in Cairo, but definitely it's a great place to stay and relax away from all the noise from the city. Again... Definitely recommended 100%  Their  entire staff from the reception at your arrival all the way to you departure  and everything in between. They will make sure you have all you need and that you are enjoying your stay.  I'm pretty sure will be back again and stay here in my next visit to Cairo.‚Ä¶

The hotel is a grand complex indeed - but much is closed and areas fallen into disrepair.  The main spa was closed (Utopia), and most services we tried to access were not available.  Staff rude, service non-existent.  Took over two hours to get food at lunchtime, and 25 minutes to get a Diet Pepsi by the pool!  Management did not care. We left after two of a planned seven nights.  Absolutely not befitting a 5 star rating or the St. Regis brand.

Reception Staff: Excellent. Pool Staff: Excellent. Restaurant Staff: Excellent ++ :). Dinner in main restaurant: 3/5. Breakfast: 5/5 ++++. Room: 5/5.  This is a family/kids friendly hotel 30 minutes from new cairo and excellent for long:short vacations.

Where to start, my booking actually started by me doing a search for a weekend away with my daughter, the hotel wasn‚Äôt even on the list I was searching within, until I saw it on booking.con, so I decided to call the reservations team at the hotel to learn more about the hotel, the rates and so on.  A lovely young lady - Ms Sara Hussam El Din was the Member of staff taking my call, she was VERY friendly, pleasant, attentive to every detail I mentioned and was the reason why I actually booked our weekend! I had asked her for a special arrangement for my daughter and it was much better than what I had dreamt of. Sara was so professional that she managed to make me willingly stay at a hotel that is almost 1.5K more than my initial budget :) (and I type this with a huge smile on my face)   We arrived at the reception, staff were amazing and friendly, especially Menna and Maryan (I think) Menna knows who I‚Äôm talking about. Please refer to her.   We were guided to our STUNNING room. Then we went to the pool- a huge thank you to Hany at the pool who was very supportive, friendly and had a huge smile on his face- very welcoming and attentive as well. I want to thank Hany for being dedicated and focused, I forgot my expensive tanning oil and when we went to the pool the next day he had kept it for me in lost and found which I really appreciated.   I also want to thank Dyana at the pool bar, she does the best lemon mint smoothies, she‚Äôs always smiling and pleasant to talk to. She focuses on details mentioned and doesn‚Äôt forget what was requested. She‚Äôs very professional as well and is keen to be a great representative to the hotel.   Food Quality Review: - breakfast buffet: was good, diverse and clean.  - pool bar: drinks we ordered were lemon smoothies and chocolate milkshake, clean, fresh and refreshing, we ordered a pizza on the pool it was also good. Nothing fancy, just a usual pool side pizza which we enjoyed.  - room service (or private dining as they call it): they made us an amazing cake for my daughter, fruits are fresh and clean, bakery is amazing at this hotel, my daughter had a which sauce pasta with chicken which she enjoyed, I had ordered the cold m√©zza platter, it needs to be revisited and I had shared my feedback with Mr Alaa the head of the Room service department and he was keen to know my feedback for improvement which Im sure he would work on as he seems like a professional and experienced Manager.   Housekeeping; When we arrived the room was amazingly clean, spotless and was well decorated for my request. Thanks to the team. My only comment is that the following morning I had the sign on for the room to be cleaned from 7:00 am until 12:30 and when we came back to the room it wasn‚Äôt cleaned. I would highly request for the housekeeping team to keep a close eye on such small details as they‚Äôre doing an amazing  job keeping the entire hotel clean.   Overall rating is a 8.5 and I would definitely go back again for a vacation!‚Ä¶

We have been in the hotel and we spent there a really wonderful time and I would like to thank everyone who are working in the hotel including  Asem , Mahmoud and Talat  It was really wonderful time 2022

One of the finest and most luxurious hotels in the Middle East . The work is done in a wonderful and orderly manner. The service is excellent and I hope to visit again soon and recommend it to visitors from inside and outside the country

It was the worst stay of all services and unexpected,,  1 The reception is very bad  2 The staff is unhelpful and not friendly  3 The reception manager is not cooperative at all, and he does not have any solutions to the hotel's mistakes  4 The rooms are old and bad, their furniture is bad and their smell is bad, the bathrooms are old, their marble is broken, and they have sewage.  5 The reception of the breakfast employee is rude and unwelcoming to guests at all.  There are so many comments that I don't want to waste my time writing them Attached is a summary of my visit to the worst 5-star hotel in the history of my travels, where my stay was for one day, and thank God for that, it was an experience and will not be repeated, no matter how much the hotel offers me upgrades,,

The hotel staff was what made this stay special. We had multiple problems with the rooms during our stay but Mohamed Mustafa intervened directly and resolved everything to our satisfaction.  In addition, Executive Lounge staff Osama Yassin, Ahmed Saeed, Merna, and Ramy Nader were welcoming and attentive.  They were all extremely pleasant and great communicators.    I want to call out Bellman Ahmed (don't have his last name, sorry) who was especially helpful when our local tour guide did not show up.  He made multiple phone calls to the agency and made sure that the issue was resolved.  He was very pleasant and professional.

Just perfect and very helpfull n kind staff Everything was ultra clean Room service is superior Food and service at Esplanade restaurant was more than perfect Cocktail dinner at business lounge was very deliciousüòä

Excellent stay superb breakfast professional staff exquisite health club nice massage, room service was good and responsive to complaints the pool was nice and clean I would definitely recommend it to everyone, I am a regular visitor and always look up to staying there

Luxurious hotel connected to Citystars mall in Cairo.  The architecture, design and decorations in this hotel are gorgeous.  The employee are very friendly, and the room is very spacious.  It‚Äôs location is unbeatable since it‚Äôs 10 kilometers from Cairo International Airport.

This is a very nice property close to many attractive sites. Wonderful staff willing to extend help whenever you ask for. Very goods variety of restaurants and tasty food. I liked Fyruz and Alkhal. We enjoyed the entertainment program in Fyruz. Really enjoyed it.

Again, I am here in Intercontinental City Stars Cairo. A wonderful place to enjoy and stay in one of the most luxurious hotels in Egypt. I so grateful for their hospitality as all staff spare no efforts to make your stay as a part of heaven. Location is perfect.

I'm a frequent traveler and it's hard to find a hotel that I like. I really like the intercontinental in cairo, because of the great location. The hotel is within walking distance of every place and is very quiet in the evenings. When I stay there, I always stay in the same room because I love the feeling of a hotel room with a nice view.  My favorite little feature that I like about the hotel is pool, the staff was very nice specially mr. ahmed hassan from front office , i would like to revisit the hotel again.

I was looking for a new hotel room for my family and this was the best choice by far! When we got into the room, we were surprised by how nice it was. The room was well-appointed with a comfortable king-sized bed and a large flat screen TV. The bathroom was even nicer; we all love going to the pool  together and it was so much fun The best part of this hotel, though, was the location: it was close to many things, In the end i would like to thank Mr. Hatem Samir and Mr. Ahmed Hassan for welcoming me.

It‚Äôs really one my favorite hotel . I prefer my stay there. All staff are very kind especially Mr Roger he is helpful and co- operative alwyas help me booking my stays. Room is organized cozy and comfortable

Seemingly a high standard hotel, but an unpleasant surprise... From the outside, the hotel looks new and luxurious, as well as in the common areas of the hotel. However, the rooms are small, the beds are uncomfortable, the windows do not close completely. The rooms need updating, you can see that they are old. There were 3 people in the room, we only got 2 sets of towels. The staff took our luggage to the room (not asked for it) and insistently demanded a tip for it. In general, the service is very imposing when it comes to luggage, even when you say that you can handle it yourself, they snatch it from your hands (of course they want a tip later). If you want to sleep, you won't be able to either. The hotel plays very loud music and there are live shows until 00:00. It's unacceptable for it to be loud for so long. In addition, at 04:00 someone was making a fuss in the next room and the phone to call the reception did not work. Breakfast decent but we never got the tea we asked for. This is one of our worst hotel experiences. The only plus is the free shuttle to the airport.‚Ä¶

A charming hotel with all the amenities a guest could wish for , a fantastic regal staircase is a joy , plenty of restaurants and cafes within the hotel . The cafe in the lobby has some of t(e best cakes and sandwiches in Cairo. There is a wonderful outside cafe and Shisha bar were you can watch the football , chat and have some fantastic food

Concorde 5 Stars on the outside 1 Star on the inside... Great location only 15mins from thr Airport.  Gated with armed security at check in. The grounds,lobby and everything outside the rooms are 5 star luxury.  NOW everything else. Rooms: Very old, looks like furniture, doors, lighting and everything but the sheets were from 1970. The 1st room we had the bath tub wall fell in and cause major flooding so we moved to a new room.  2nd room: Still very old and smelled like smoke. Must be from 1970s cigarettes. Coffee machine was broken, 1 light fixture wouldn't stay on and the fridge didn't turn on.  Room Service: Large menu back everything we ordered lacked any taste.  Breakfast buffet: The spread was amazing Large and looked top notch 5 star. Unfortunately 95pct of the food had no taste so we left disappointed.  Other: Food service delivery did not deliver here.  This place is all about the looks.‚Ä¶

Don‚Äôt stay here if you want a quiet hotel! Loud music all night past midnight! üò°  There was a wedding party each night that took over the entire pool area. Not a relaxing experience at all. This hotel should create an in closed banquet/party space to cater to  weddings. This would allow other guests who actually paid to stay here to enjoy the amenities. Hotel has nice decor. Room was good size with comfortable bed. Refrigerator in room. Restaurants were ok but service was very slow. Breakfast was good with many options.

The Hotel is clean, friendly staff members (some let you down though) the breakfast buffet was excellent with a good selection of savoury and sweet selection. The penne ariabata was amazing from the Italian restaurant. The waiter was kind enough to make us a non alcoholic mohito. Tje chef at breakfast was very good too interactive and no request was ignored.   I was traveling with young children ranging from 2 - 8year old and 2 other adults. We had connecting family room with a cot bed. Room service always cleaned rooms. The bathroom could do with some renovating but overall it was OK. The balcony had a nice view facing the swimming pool. The swimming pool was warm however kids pool was cold! There was a play area for kids, which was constantly being cleaned and it was great fun entertainment. They had a big screen outside but not anything decent to watch. It would be nice if they had movies playing give it an outside cinema feel.  They did have weddings there in the outside area and the music was a little bit loud but to be honest we really enjoyed it. The music kept going until after midnight.   We booked most of our activities through the hotel and our driver Mohammed was amazing. He made us feel safe and made sure we had an excellent time. The hotel should be very proud to have him. The manger of the activities (didn't catch his name) was the complete opposite. He made inappropriate comments towards us which made us uncomfortable. The other thing that really was not nice was the constant bugging from porters asking us where we had been and how much we paid for the activities!!! We did bring this to the hotels attention in the end. I understand why they would ask in the reception and write the info down but the porters were riding up elevators with us to ask!!!! This should be prohibited as it becomes very awkward.   Overall stay could've been 10/10 easily if the few things could be improved. Great stay for families with young children.‚Ä¶

Everything was perfect, Room well maintained,  very clean bed sheet and room carpet. Excellent breakfast buffet Excellent Room service And house keeping.  Free shuttle bus available every hour. There's always some entertainment activity in the hotel.

Stayed for 1 night as this was the last hotel from out tour to Egypt.  Room was okay with the tub that is so high to get into. nice pool area with outdoor dining. Service was okay with check in took a little while.  Food in the restaurant was just fine with the breakfast being plentiful and okay.

Concorde el Salam in Cairo is a large, busy hotel used by many travel groups.  It's possible to gather many people in their foyer lounge areas.  - Rooms are large with more than adequate bathrooms. - The second time we stayed there we were given a room overlooking the pool.  It was very noisy as a DJ and singer entertain there each night. - The drinks in the foyer bar are expensive. - The food in the outside area near the pool is reasonable and good. - There are two  small gift shops in the foyer. - The breakfast selection is very large and good.

I was at the hatem cafe restaurant it was spectacular experience beautiful atmosphere great workers especially Mahmoud in the black suit, and great food I really loved it , i usually travel all around at 5 stars and that‚Äôs is the best thanks .

Peace be upon you.. I would like to thank from the bottom of my heart all the workers in the restaurant of the Concorde Al Salam Sports Hotel in sharm elshikh, including Mr. Mohsen and the workers Khaled, Ahmed, Muhammad and Mohamed Fares. Yasser henydaq , and especially Mr. Muhammad al-Sayed for saving my daughter‚Äôs life today.. He (Mr Muhammad al-Sayed) and he has another friend who took us in a car The clinic has the credit, after God, for keeping my daughter Tia alive. I will never forget his noble attitude throughout my life... Thank God, thank you, Concord, thank you, Mr. Mohamed El-Sayed‚ù§Ô∏è

Apart from the hairs on the sheets from previous visitors, cigarette holes in the blankets, no lamp, a broken TV and a pathetic breakfast, this is a passable hotel. The manager avoided me after I pointed out the exorbitant charges for some of his tours... $75 for the Luxor trip when it was available for $15 in the city. I would strenuously avoid this hotel if I was planning a return trip to Cairo.

‚Äì A nice place in downtown Cairo. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. The room was good value for money, This is the first time I stay in this hotel. Really it is a great hotel especially the staff and the cleanliness of the place and I am very happy to try this hotel. Clean and tidy rooms with air conditioning. Staff extremely welcoming and good breakfast in the morning. Positioned close to Tahrir Square and very near the Egyptian museum and the Isle of Gezhira. Great experience.

Very convenient location as it is comparatively near to all the tourist spots and best part is the staff who are very friendly and cooperative. ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶∂‡¶Ç‡¶∏‡¶æ ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶Æ‡¶§‡ßã ‡¶∏‡¶æ‡¶∞‡ßç‡¶≠‡¶ø‡¶∏‡•§ ‡¶∞‡ßÅ‡¶Æ‡ßá‡¶∞ ‡¶õ‡ßã‡¶ü ‡¶ñ‡¶æ‡¶ü‡ßã ‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶õ‡ßÅ ‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶æ ‡¶•‡¶æ‡¶ï‡¶≤‡ßá‡¶ì overall ‡¶≠‡¶æ‡¶≤ ‡¶Ö‡¶≠‡¶ø‡¶ú‡ßç‡¶û‡¶§‡¶æ‡•§

I very happy to stay in Grand Royal, Everything was Good manager, staff, Reciption everybody helped me to get what I need, Internet work fast, Break fast was wonderfull ÿå when you stay in this hotel you feel stay with your family, I feel cheerful

The rooms were very vlean , stylish and internet worked great . The staff was amazing and helped me get everything i need for traveling. I highly recommend this hotek if you are looking to feel safe , comfortable and well taken care . Thanks

Well, for sure the location and friendly staff are the biggest positive of this place. The rest is messy unfortunately. The rooms were big, but not all rooms have bathroom inside. The rooms provide a balcony, mini fridge, small TV, well working A/C, wi-fi and comfy beds. The hotel is situated on 6th floor, bur the building and ground floor looks scary, old and not approachable. The lift feels like it will fall apart. The price is good. The breakfast can be served to the room. They have offered omelette, some yogurt and bread roll.

I booked 2 nights and had paid extra for a room with a balcony and private bathroom specifically. On checking in my room did not have a balcony, and on asking for a change they said they didn't have any left and they could change me the next day. Not great for a 2 night stay. When I did get changed the next evening, the private bathroom was actually across the hall, accessible by key and super inconvenient. The rooms themselves are huge, but have no personality or character, just all white walls, white bedding, bright overhead lights. Staff were friendly enough until they realised I didn't want to book any tours or private drivers with them, then they lost interest. It's a budget hotel, so I didn't expect the Ritz, but there are better out there.  The location is the best thing about this hotel, right in the centre of downtown and very convenient for most things to do. Sadly I would not stay again.‚Ä¶

The manager and staff make you feel at home the hospitality i received was exceptional breakfast is delicious.ive stayed in many 4 and 5 star hotels all over the world. Grand royal is one of the best hotels I have stayed in .lookimg forward to returning in September

Reasonably priced  nice old place in downtown Cairo. The staff will bend over backwards to make sure you are taken care of. Madeline and Hussein were quite helpful with arranging tours all over Egypt. I also had a wonderful personal driver, Ahmed who took me wherever I wanted to go. Room was perfectly fine since all I ask for when I travel is a bed and a bathroom. Egyptian hospitality at its finest!

We highly recommend this hotel! The location is excellent, on a safe street full of people on one of the main squares. The staff is very nice and helpful. Our room & private bathroom were cleaned very well daily. When we return to Cairo, we will stay here again.

We stayed here for one night as we had a late flight and early train but it was absolutely terrible. The room had not really been cleaned the bath was grimy, there was wet dirty tissues next to the toilet, the sofa was stained but worst of all the bed had pieces of dirt &  hair in it. It was disgusting. Our flights were delayed so by this point it was 2am & we had to move rooms from 114 to 714. we complained and were given a new room, but At no point did anyone apologise or offer us compensation. On top of that the receptionist said we could have a free breakfast but then she made us pay for it because the manager wasn‚Äôt there. We asked to speak with the manager and waited for an hour from 9-10 and they still didn‚Äôt turn up and we didn‚Äôt want to waste more time on our holiday. We ended up paying for the room and breakfast which we feel is not justified given all the problems we had with this hotel. The receptionist then assured us the manager would call to discuss a refund of at least the service charge but it is now 2 days later and we have not heard anything from them.‚Ä¶

We stayed at this hotel twice as part of an arranged tour (therefore didn‚Äôt choose ourselves). It is convenient for pick ups and drop offs to the airport as it is located in Heliopolis, but there is little to do in the surrounding area. The lobby is nice, but the rooms are dated and on both occasions ours were not cleaned to a good standard. On the second occasion the room smelt heavily of cigarette smoke. The breakfast was buffet and included and is of a good standard. We were quoted 25 USD for an evening buffet, which was too expensive for Egypt for us to try.  Overall an average stay with unclean rooms

Close to the airport, more for business people rather than tourists. About 20 mins away from the city centre and the Nile. The lobby and ground floor is very smart, however it is deceiving the room standards are much lower and rooms are tiny.   If you in the first wing of the hotel, the room are even worse with no windows or views, luckily we managed to get it changed immediately to the second wing where we had views of the palace. The food was delicious and amazing. Restaurant stayed open till midnight as our flight was delayed. They had a rooftop pool but it was out of commission sadly. Wifi was pretty good.

Close to airport. Nice hotel and clean. Never forget this hotel. Room is nice and clean.  reception team very well & very friendly. aquiet place   I will back soon and thanks front office team. especially MR. Taha

Is a beautiful hotel in the hearth 0f Cairo, politeness and clean.. Good people that make you feel special with all the accommodations, access to landmarks like the Baron Palace their cuisine is excellent with, good choice and Buffett , the morning  buffet was excellent !

Amazing stay, room was very clean and has a good smell. Fantastic view. Front office staff was very helpful and the check in was fast. food was delicious and there is many variety. Many dessert options.

Really I would like express my happiness with my experience at baron hotel Cairo, I was lucky that my trip has been cancelled so I got the opportunity to stay there, they change my bad mood, I have stayed there for 2 nights and it was the best stay in such area, I have stayed before in Le Passage, Le Meridian, Sonesta but Baron was different, at the beginning I had some challenges with the 2 ladies at the reception but honestly I met the resident manager (Salah) I think his name who handled the situation then I have met front office manager (Taha) who completed the rest of the procedures, really I appreciated their efforts, they upgraded my room and I was lucky that I met them, they changed my mood totally, and Salah helped me in my tickets modifications and even arranged me the transportation to the airport, and I have received very nice fruits, sometimes the hospitality and attitude can change the defects, the have major problems in the elevators but really each time was meeting them, they could change it positively. Thanks a lot for both, thanks for Emad in the restaurant, Fatma my room cleaner, Amr in the restaurant was super polite and has very nice attitude‚Ä¶

I have stayed in the hotel for 3 nights, it was great honestly, although the hotel is 4* it provides 5* service, there many 5* hotels around but not that much good compared to Baron, since I arrived, I have met the front office manager, who greated me immediately and checked me in, it was a surprise for me to find a manager standing in the reception, it seems he loves his job a lot, the room was clean and neat, the service at the restaurant could be better but still no complaint, I had an issue with my door lock, which was close to ruin my stay, they spent almost 40 minutes to fix it, but when I complained, they referred me to hotel manager who was super and handled my case immediately with fast action, Mr. Salah is really the best image of the hotel, I should thank him for his service, almost around and you will find him everywhere üòÄ.... For sure I will be back, I got a promise to be upgraded for my upcoming reservation  Thanks Baron for such stay.‚Ä¶

Clean rooms, comfortable beds, and good food ... but this is what you expect in any decent hotel. However, Le Baron really stands out thanks to their friendly hotel staff, always available and eager to please their clients, always with their signature Egyptian smile. All I needed to do was to ask once ... wake-up call, shuttle to the airport, towels, sewing-kit, replace scale battery, fix loose bathroom fixture ... all done quickly and efficiently. Breakfast buffet was also quite an experience ... I went for the typical Egyptian fare and was pleasantly surprised with an unsolicited special offer of fresh falafel delivered to my table by the chef! I also got to sample their unique best mille-feuilles in Egypt. I will not list any names for fear of missing any ... thank you all for your hospitality. Now would be a good time to make Le Baron a non-smoking hotel :-)‚Ä¶

i‚Äôm so excited for everything. and the staff was very friendly  . the service was good and great. but wifi needs to be better. the room was clean and very nice. Mariam in reseption was kindly and friendly.. i will come again in the next few weeks.

If you are budget concerned, then it should be among your choices. Located on 12th floor. Small noisy lifts. Small rooms. Bed was noisy too even if you turn your side. Cleanliness not very good. I had stains on bed sheet & blanket. Small shower place in washroom which was stinky too. Breakfast was ok. Staff was good & friendly. Definitely if they consider minor details in cleanliness & improve it, it‚Äôll be very great.

The hotel was nice, the location is perfect and the team very friendly. Unforutnately, it's very loud, the walls are paper. The stay could be improved by vaccuiming the floor a bit more, having a lamp next to the bed and a bit better breakfest. As european, it was really not for our taste. Otherwise, the stay was really good and I would recommend this hotel.

We first arrived and it took about 40 minutes to go up the elevator - the hotel shares the elevator with other commercial offices.  The hotel wanted to charge $30 for a cab when Uber was charging $6.  The beer was $10.  The breakfast food is terrible - flies everywhere. Our room was not very clean - the water stopped working for an entire day - had to brush with bottled water and not shower.  The staff was bunch of greedy men who just want to make money of you.  NOT SURE HOW THIS HAS A TRIP ADVISOR SEAL - THEY MUST FORCE THE GUESTS TO WRITE REVIEWS FOR THEM.

When we arrived there had been a mix up with our booking. Kareem quickly sorted it out and gave us a very spacious room with a small balcony. The air conditioning worked well, as did the WiFi  and there was plenty of hot water. I had some washing that needed doing and they were very happy to do thisThe roof top bar, where breakfast is also served,  is quirky and a good place to wind down after a day of sightseeing. Breakfast does not start until 8, or even a bit after which was rather late if you are trying to get out early to beat the heat. However, there was plenty of selection, including some very nice falafel, Carlos did an excellent job. Overall, for a two star hotel, and considering the price we paid, it was very impressive, especially the friendly staff.

I couldn't believe the price of this hotel which included breakfast for 2 people. Wasn't sure hoe it would work out but decided to give it a try. The taxi driver that took us there from the airport was uncertain if we were in the right place but I recognized it from photos that I had seen online. It is a very basic hotel but was clean and tidy and we found the location pretty good. The hotel is on the 12th floor and there is an elevator to take you up. The lentil soup that they serve in the restaurant is very good.

Really amazing hotel , with a well trained staff.  Totally recommend for everyone . Food and buffet were excellent and have several types of food . Special thanks for Mr Mohamed Fateh el Bab events manager he was very cooperative person

I'll give you the positives first. The place is clean, has a pleasant lobby with a reading room on the side. The restaurant on the top floor is good; this is important because the restaurant choices in the neighbourhood are limited. I had laundry done, and they did a good job for a low price. As for location, it's within walking distance of the Museum of Egyptian Antiquities and Tahrir Square. The staff is mostly very helpful, BUT... anybody who has traveled in Egypt knows that the quality of customer service varies greatly. In my case, when I was checking out, the woman at the desk told me I had to pay cash. I said, OK, no problem, where's the nearest bank machine? She said, "banks are closed on Sunday." That, of course, was a ridiculous response. Fortunately, another employee within earshot said that there was an ATM around the corner. Turned out that he was wrong, too. There are actually two ATM's a half block down the street. So no problem, but you really have to wonder, how can somebody work in a place and not be aware of where the nearest ATM is? It's important to know that the reception desk is actually on the tenth floor. This isn't an issue during the daytime, because there's a desk at the building entrance. However, if you arrive at 3:30 AM like I did, that desk will be unmanned. I had to bang on the elevator door for a while before the front desk guy became aware of my presence. The staff should really advise people of this when they book for late arrival. Finally, most taxi drivers don't know where the Osiris is. This is no surprise, because most Cairo taxi drivers don't know where anything else is, either. But be sure to have the hotel's business card with you to show the driver, and have the hotel's location on the GPS app on your cell phone.‚Ä¶

The Osiris Hotel was wonderful. The staff was considerate, helpful, flexible, and exceptionally kind. Whatever I needed, they were incredibly helpful and very welcoming. They were never pushy! While everyone there was wonderful, I'd like to especially thank Carlos, Abed, and Mina for making my stay wonderful. (Oh, and their English was excellent.) The location was great - right in the center of everything yet quiet. The breakfast (included) was very good, as was the dinner, all on the rooftop with a great view of the city. The staff at Osiris really made my vacation great. Highly recommended.

The staff at Osiris are all very helpful and friendly, and not in your face trying to sell tours etc.  My room was great - clean and the heater worked just find, and the bathroom also was great as the hot water was really hot!  The cleaners come and clean your room on a daily basis is you wish.  The wifi is great too.  The location is excellent as it is down town and right by Tahrir Square so close to the Egyptian Museum and the underground so very quick and easy to get to Giza.  There is also a great caf√© close by down the street on the way to Tahrir.

Just wanted to say a big Thank You to Mr. Karam Saad ( receptionist ) !  He is doing his job with a friendly attitude and he is doing it great, he is an example how everyone in hotel & hospitality business should act !  It's not good when I easily see in someone's eys that all he wants from me is money. And I could see this in almost every Egyptian eyes, but not in his ! Just a friendliness, that's all. Thank you Karam !  Big Thanks to manager Karlos also !

This is my 1st international trip. It is great experience. Staff and the owners of the hotels are very co-operative. Rooms and services-are very good. Because of their hospitality I did not feel like my 1st trip. Will definitely recommend this place.

We booked this hotel for 3 nights thru Agoda. Five minutes after we got in the room we walked out. The bottom of the bathtub was dark gray from dirt. The chair was very much worn out, and there was disgusting stain on the bad sheet. We showed it to the receptionist and he told the owner or manager. They told us, he was the owner. We told them that we are leaving and asked if they were willing to refund our money. We were told yes but only thru agoda. However I could not cancel it thru agoda because it was after check in date. I sent e mail to agoda but no response and I could not find a phone number for them.

Great location   , Clean Rooms , Helpful Staff , Fresh tasty daily breakfast  , Comfy beds , They helped us to arrange our tours around whole Egypt at a budget prices . They also helped us to arrange our Cuivid Test before we go to Cairo Airport . We used to stay at Paradise Boutique Hotel during our stay in Cairo . We really recommend it .

Good staff , Clean and wide bed rooms .They offer tasty breakfast everyday . The location of hotel is near everything with a walking distance you can go everywhere you want . They picked us from Cairo Airport and made us safe al times . Thank you for making our pleasant stay at Paradise Boutique Hotel .

This is a great place to stay. Location could be hard to find since it's in a back alley. Look for Sherif Basha Street & ask anyone.  Hospitality of the staff is unforgettable. They go beyond their capabilities to help you out..special thanks to Moni & other staff.  Thanks Paradise Boutique.

I used to stay at this hotel because it has always been good,  Their biggest asset is the staff, all of them extremely friendly and helpful. Always ready to help with a smile. The location is unbeatable which is near restaurants,markets,Sightseeing.  Perfect quality and price. Thank you for making my stay unforgettable as usual .

Don't judge the book by its cover. The hotel was a little difficult to find do to its location in the back of an alley which is a bit run down just like other parts of the city. Once you get to the lobby of the hotel you will be stepping into another world. The staff is super kind, hospitable and helpful. Not a five star hotel by the looks but a five star by the service. Very centralized to downtown and lots of shops and restaurants near it.

Both literally and figuratively. Very central location, walkable to almost everything in Cairo except the pyramids! Staff is incredibly kind and hospitable, offering language tips, advice for getting around the city. Wonderful hot, fresh breakfast with omelet. Able to leave bags to explore he city after checkout. Would return and recommend!   Tips to taxi/Uber:  Across from Gad on 26 July Or Across from Al Abd pastry shop Shareef Street  Uber 125LE from airport/ March 2020

Just about ok to stay but not as it's ad says. Very old building with not very nice access to it. Had issues with the room to start with but they moved us to a reasonable one after first night. Staff were good but the breakfast wasn't. It was name only. Can't give more than 3* I'm afraid.

A lovely hotel in a wonderful location. The rooms are big , convenient and very clean with a large comfortable beds. The staff were really kind and helpful. Breakfast was fresh and tasty. I loved the lobby where there was some books to read, . I got a room with a wonderful decoration.  I would certainly love to visit there again.Thank you so much for making my stay a pleasant with you.

I stayed there for business it was perfect, very close to the Airport, most key places in the city and with a direct connect to the Mall.  Thank you so much to all the team there; especially Mina at the reception and Mohamed at the Concierge.

Thx for team they are very helpful and friendly they gives me nice room with good views.   Thx all thx mr mostafa and michel for his hospitalslty i want to thank the team of house keeping   Love you all o will came again

The place is nice and clean, the staff are  very friendly and always help The room is clean and looking over the shopping mall which. Is directly next to the hotel and having all you need. Thank you for making me enjoy my stay

The hotel is very good for business travelers, the rooks are comfortable and quiet, the staff are friendly and the service is very good.  Thank you for making my business visit successful and definitely I will come back again.

I stayed in holiday inn for two nights and it was a wanderfull  stay , starting from security department , bill man , reception team ( mahmoud , belal, fady , michel, ) and house keeping team , thanks for great stay

I stayed at holiday inn city stars and our family enjoyed very much the hotel have a door to city stats shopping center the breakfast was amazing the hotel stuff was professional specially Akram & Riad from Concierge and mina from front desk hope to see you again

Great hotel.. great location.. next to citystar mall. Many selections of restaurants and dinning areas. I thank Mina for a great welcome and he understood our situation and allowed us for a late check out. Thank you Mina for your great service. Will come again for sure.

Thx mr Mostafa HANY and mr michel thay are very helpful and so kind I want to thank all of the team for front desk for his hospitality they gives me very good room with nice view üòÇ‚ù§Ô∏è Thanks all ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..

had so much fun with my friends as i enjoyed the stay at star corner cafe, they offer bbq and band which was so nice the mall located next to. the hotel which was so nice for us to buy some gifts to. our family

Last nice i enjoyed my stay at holidayinn citystars as it was a cozy ,friendly and nice stay, also i attended the party of the halloween at simply neon club and it was perfect and well organizied special thanks to maysa in the reception team

It was a family trip , stayed only one night here but the service was great  Location- around 2 km from Ramses station and near to metro around 600 m , great place for shopping freaks right down the hotel and restaurants all nearby, fruits and vegetables market in eyesight distance. Hotel located in the 6 th floor of an old building. Small lift available . Outside of building is old but , after you enter hotel lobby , it looks 3 star with good ambiance   We had a very warm welcome from the reception lady and was given rooms with in no time, I can say this is my fastest check in till now.kudos to reception lady in the morning. She was very helpful all through the stay and knows good English   Rooms are very spacious and the lobby is good with aquariums, study place , looks like home. Soap and shampoo provided. Has mini fridge and balcony.   Breakfast is served in a small dining area , but kept neat and clean . Limited breakfast ( not buffet) but sufficient and good.  Water not provided ( nowhere in Egypt you will be given free water) need to buy outside  Overall recommend to all travelers if you want to explore city  in budget, if you don‚Äôt want pyramids view hotels‚Ä¶

It was an amazing stay and experience. Staff was friendly. Rooms were nice and spacious.  Especially : Zidan and Zanaty.  Food was awesome and the staying overall was enjoyable. And the place is in the heart of cairo. So it's very close to everything you might need.

Cairo Paradise Hotel is one of the best hotels i have stayed during my travels. It‚Äôs so near the beautiful Cairo landmarks, easily accessible to transportations, best Egyptian food courts, the best staff headed by Hotel owner and manager Mr. Amr. They made my hotel stay one of my most memorable trips in my life. The tours they arranged for me where excellent (Giza pyramids, Old Cairo, Alexandria and with the current pandemic situations they provided PCR test convenience and right on time results). The prices were all reasonable for a budget minded traveler like me. The most important thing too was time-management to see everything according to my plans. Mr. Amr and his tour staff provided excellent timings to see the best that Egyptian tours available. Everything was done impeccably! Please pass these comments with 5 stars rating out of 5. SIMPLY THE BEST.‚Ä¶

Very good location Very good staff  Very good price Everything was good thank you so kuch for miss marwa it was very nice accomodation tge best hotel in Downtown  Rooms very nice and big and with good view Thanks for breakfast and Everything

Perfect location, clean rooms & very friendly staff specially Mrs marwa.. Very reasonable Price..  Highly recommended.. Big room and comfort space you feel like home It will not be the last time Thank you

Great Location , Helpful staff , Tasty breakfast , Excellent WI FI ,The most important thing is that they are caring so much for Covid-19 restrictions to make all guests safe during their stay at the hotel .

One of the worst hotel i have visited very old and dusty reception its written 5 stars hotel but it doesnt deserve even one star  I have been charged for one night but i didnt stay on it  Not recommended

I really recommend this place for many reasons: 1. It's close to Egyptian Museum and central places.  2. It's clean. 3. staff is very friendly and open, helps with lots of recommendations 4. Very safe for being lonely girl in a new country,  highly recommended) and they are always interested in feedback to ensure future good quality . You just can't do wrong booking the (Cairo Paradise Hotel). Thanks guys!

Awful. Dirty. Also don't book a tour through the manager Amr. Tour guide will rush you through everything in order to take you to shops to get commissions and then dump you at the pyramids, leave you there for only one hour on your own so that you can't see much. And after ruining the pyramid experience will at the end will ask for a tip.

The service is so good the staff is so helpful I like this place and i will come again at the next vacation About the location it's so nice everything is around and so close. The rooms was so clean. Breakfast was fresh and tasty. Wifi was fast and around the entire hotel. They offered an amazing tours at avery good prices. The value for money was ok regarding to thier services and facilities. Thank you for the nice time i spent at Cairo Paradise Hotel and i really recommend it for all solo girls as it is safe and secure.

Unbearable! A shame!! The place is an abandoned building...it looks like a project. It is totally dirty. We are a party of four, but when we arrived, we were given a room with three beds. They told us that the following day they would give us a room for four. That never happened! Then, when we got into the room, we discovered that there was hot water but the shower didn't work.
