There was neither toilet paper nor soap and just one towel four us all. A hairdryer? Impossible!! Two days after our arrival, we had a plumber working in our room for more than an hour till he could fix the shower. We didn't have WIFI in the room, only in the common areas. It seems that it is a building where people rent rooms permanently as we never met other tourists. The worst of all was that men were all day smoking in the common areas. The supposed "hotel" is on the 5th floor, but to use the lift you need someone from there to activate it with a card, so we had to go up and down the stairs a great many times. We went to Luxor for two days, and when we came back, we were given the same room, but this time there was no hot water. Please NEVER EVER RESERVE THIS NASTY PLACE!!‚Ä¶

We stayed there for 2 nights after coming back from Aswan the Jan 3rd , our first hostel last December was not good value , so decided to change when we come back to Cairo . the room was clean and comfortable , breakfast was simple but fair enough and always ready on time , WIFI strong signal with high speed connection Free . they gave us a key to use elevator all the time , highly recommended .

this hotel is a nice one to use in down town , very close to mussem & the nile . staff are helpful and speaks English they helped giving directions and advices for food and transport around the city I will stay here again .

it's the only one you have to  engineering you will happ please are great pleasure peopleare great too i advice all too see. it's home from home i will come again and again i do have the happy of my life time with them every one did he's bast to make me happy

The hotel has a good location, Egyptian museum is a stone's throw and many eating outlets and market is at walkable distance. The staff is very supportive and helpful. Breakfast with the view of nile and morning Cairo is very good. Rooms are clean, linen clean but ac in our room was working but in a bad condition,very old. The hotel also arranges Cairo tours mainly by Mr Ahmad Faris but if one takes your from hotel please bargain prices and first let the person know which places they would cover with entry fees. Sometimes they will say with entry but when you go they tell that some entries not covered under tour. If you take Alexandria tour must go inside Alexandria library because the tour permits visit to library from outside but one should definitely go inside this huge library and insist that the tour covers it's entry. Our guides for Cairo and Alexandria tour were not upto the level . We did tours through city view hotel. Rest about the hotel is all good.‚Ä¶

Price is reasonable for what you get. If you stay 3 nights or more, you get a free ride from the airport which is nice. Location is great. near Tahrir square. 5th floor with a nice view from the diner balcony.  Room is simple and clean. It has a small refrigerator. We had a dripping A/C but it worked well. The shower was broken and patched but it was clean, had hot water and flow was ok. Breakfast is simple ‚Äì boiled egg, falafel, few vegetables, bread and jam/butter/honey and coffee/tea. We booked a driver to Saqqara, Dahshur and Giza pyramids. Driver was on time, very friendly, English speaking, and guided us through the different places. Wifi signal was stable and work well. Hani at the reception is nice and helpful.

i stayed in this hotel a few years ago during a trip to egypt and i felt quite well in this hotel. I start by saying that the view from the room was wonderful with a view of the egyptian museum and tharir square, the breakfast was quite abundant and above all from this hotel you could go on excursions

Perfect stay, even though building is old the room was clean and tidy with very friendly staff. Location is good in Tahrir where most of the attraction is very close. They serve a good Egyptian breakfast.

Very sweet hotel, in the heart of cairo exceptional view of Egyptian museum, very friendly staff doing their best, breakfast is good,  very clean rooms, you can walk down town , I enjoyed my stay with great value for money.

We stayed as a family of 4 at this hotel in a room over the extreme noise of car honking all night long.  The room and furnishings were dated, the bathroom floor leaked water daily, the hot water ran out after 2 showers. The tap had 2 positions, over the sink and barely over the sink and shampoo was not enough for 4, given in small packets. The safe didn‚Äôt work so taping the batteries in became the answer by the staff, who although kind, really haven‚Äôt fixed any of the problems mentioned in reviews on this or other booking sites. Nonetheless, the taped batteries fell out and we had to call staff again.  The air conditioner was filthy and the window above the lower window didn‚Äôt close so all the noise came in. Breakfast was a measly smorgasbord of bread, boiled eggs and tea or coffee, the same daily.  Pickup from the airport is free if staying more than 2 nights. The no seatbelt dirty car will not necessarily fit all your luggage, we struggled with 4 suitcases. Return journey is US$15 again in a non seatbelt, not hotel run car. We were very disappointed with this hotel and would not recommend it.‚Ä¶

I had one night stay in this hotel in September 2019. The room was a little bit too small for two persons. Air conditioning was good and the single bed was a little bit too narrow judging from North American or European standard. Food was acceptable but the city noise was a bit disturbing at night.

This is a very nice budget hotel. It is a little noisy because it is in front of ther Egyptian museum but this was not a problem for us because we were exhausted from walking all day. The proximity to the museum and all of the streets in the area have shopping kept us moving all day. The staff were vey nice and breakfast was very good. For the price it was worth it. Thanks

Stayed there for 3Nights. Location of the hotel is unbeatable, esp at the price. You can enjoy breakfast or dinner overlooking National Museum & Nile view at a distance....Mr Marco ,the Manager was all help ,long before we landed in Egypt. He organised all the personalised tours..with exclusive guide..Food ,tho not of wide range, was good enough..& the elderly Chef was always obliging...Airport pick up was free; drop off, @USD15 was also ok...Overall, had a very pleasant experience of Cairo sojourn, with City View as base.

If you want to experience Cairo from the comfort of being located in central down town at the foot of the historic Egyptian museum & Tahrir square; to gain quick access to all the nearby attractions like Khan el-Khalili bazaar, then you've found the right place!!!.City View rooms have balcony views which will take your breath away! The staff here is the best in Egypt, they will stop at nothing to make your stay in Cario unforgettable!!! Whether its helping with your tour arrangements or even being served up authentic Egyptian cuisine by chef Mohammed one of the best chef's in Cario;the stars are the limit when it comes to making your stay a memorable experience, you will never forget and one that will have you return many times over.Thank you City View we love you guys & can't wait to come back!!!    Rana from Chicago, Illinois U.S.A.‚Ä¶

We  were guests at the Flamenco Cairo from May 11 through May 22 and it was a wonderful repeat experience as was our previous stay back in July 2021.  We especially commend the Hotel staff for their warmth and professionalism as follows  Mr. Ahmad at the front desk..always accommodating, pleasant and eager to help as much as possible  Mr. Ali, Mr. Khalid, and Mr. Mamdouh of the Front Service..always helpful, always professional,  cheerful  Mr. Abdul Gawad, restaurant Manager and his staff whom we enjoy seeing as cheerful and eager to please..these are some of them.....  Mr. Amgad , Mr Basam, Mr Waleed...only too few to mention as they all do their best   The security staff at the hotel entrance was always welcoming and helpful  As for your amazing housekeeping staff , they immediately responded to any snags we found after checking in...these issues were attended to immediately   Mrs. Zainab, Mr Waly(hope this is his correct name)  We would also like to make mention of a previous housekeeping staff member, Mrs.Reda, who last year gave us a good reason to come back for our first of many stays at the Flameco.   There is always more to add to the above but not enough pages to add...we enjoyed our stay.  Very sincerely,   Haytham and Mary Naga    ‚Ä¶

I had a few rooms over various days in sept 2022 during a tour I did of Egypt and this was starting base.   Located in Zamalek Cairo, this hotel is ok situated, about 1hr or so from airport.   Local area is good for restaurants, banks, pharmacies, and grocery store.   The foyer is not bad.  There is a restaurant on top floor, they have decent food, but very slow service.   The bar at ground level is dodgy, I ordered beer paid and the barman kept an extra 100LE.  I was adamant I paid correct amount and was expecting my money back, he denied I gave extra.  After he pulled money out of his pocket it was determined he owed me the 100LE, will not go there again.     The first room I had was a twin bed street facing.  Ok room, working AC, and bathroom ok.  Very noisy from street as no seals on windows, lots of honking.   Another room later, was river facing, and more upscale, but had smell of smoke.   All in all I had ok sleep, via putting in ear plugs. Elevators are tiny.   Breakfast is on mezz level, they have buffet and ok service.  Does trick to get going for day.     This place is not luxury, but is average, not bad for starting out in Cairo.‚Ä¶

I had the privilege of staying in this homely and welcoming hotel for an extended period of time (2+ months).  Classic interior, huge & clean rooms and cozy bar at ground floor. Amazing views to the Nile. It misses a gym, but there are a couple of choices walking distance. It's a legendary place with tons of day and night leisure destinations nearby.  In short, it‚Äôs a great hotel, in a great location with excellent value for money.  PS. Don‚Äôt miss out on the breakfast.

Hotel is very rusty and suffocating. It is near the Nile River but located very noisy place. You can hardly open your window. Air Conditioner was extremly noisy you can sleep. Two other guests with us also said this. The brealfast is poor and tasteless. I have to say that staff was nice and helpful. Keep away from this hotel.

Stayed for five days in August. Conveniently located on Zamalek. Bar and restaurant areas are welcoming. Excellent views from the top floor. Staff were all very helpful. Highly recommend the chicken burger!

We stayed here for a 24 hour stop over in Cairo to visit the pyramids.   I cannot fault the hotel in anyway, our stay was perfect. Staff were welcoming and helpful. We arrived way before check in at 11:30 and they had a room already ready for us which was perfect and allowed us to freshen up before visiting the pyramids.   The room itself was smart, bed comfy and bathroom was good size with a bath.   Hotel location is also great situated in a safe/good neighbourhood so your stay should be trouble free.   We didn‚Äôt get a chance to check out the bar or restaurant but good to know these are available.

We stopped here for one night and I honestly can‚Äôt fault it.  - Room was ready when we arrived at 11am - Room was very clean , modern for Egypt, great space, has everything you could need - WIFI worked great for Egypt and was free  - Staff were friendly  - Great location. Very safe  - Easy check in and out

I stayed for four nights ,it was a wonderful place everything was perfect starting from person who help me to get luggage and reception staff who mad check in through house keeping and staff in restaurant in breakfast all staff are very friendly and helpful,room were clean and breakfast buffet was very nice , really I enjoyed my stay so much and will make it again . I thank all staff who made my stay smooth and lovely,Thanks so much‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Very nice hotel in the center  of Cairo .Good location for exploring Cairo and Giza pyramids .Rooms good size and very clean .Good breakfast  included. There is restaurant on 10th with good food and gorges view of Cairo.

I visited the hotel for a couple of night's in a business trips booker room with side nile view   Surprised by the standard newly renovated one   Recommended rally form City center business trips   Please check also the restaurant 10th floor with fantastic view

I am sharing my experience so any future guests will be aware when booking at Tolip Golden Plaza. I stayed twice in less than a month, and the same issues were never fixed, and more rising issues justify the decline in their rating score. They are far from hospitality, lack experience, have low self-esteem at the front desk personnel, and have bad management. I stayed on 10/27/22 in room#10 by the pool. The reservation was made over the phone, we got there a little after 11 pm the check-in with the front desk guy named Ahmed was the longest check-in I have ever experienced. As I was at the front desk for the longest time guests who checked in before me were all coming to the front desk to address their issue with their room key card that wasn‚Äôt working some of them were very frustrated about going back and forth to the front desk for 2 or 3 times. Finally, he checked me in after almost 50 mins and warned me that my room key card might not work because they were having an issue with the key card programming machine and no IT person on duty in the morning it should be fixed but to let them know if I had any issues with it. Unfortunately walked to the pool area and got to my room and the key card didn‚Äôt work had to walk back and they kept me waiting for another 15 mins till Ahmed and another guy walked with me back to my room and kept trying the spare which also gave them hard time and after a while, it opened and they told us that most likely you will have the same issue if you leave again tonight and come back so they advise us to use the sliding doors for the balcony to exit and when we come back. The sliding doors weren‚Äôt even locking so anyone really can walk into your room. The bed closer to the closet was sliding on the room floor tile because the bed legs weren‚Äôt locking. The balcony is overseeing the pool area but the room door is overseeing the tennis court which they allow guests to use late after midnight and it gets pretty loud. The next morning went to sit on the balcony and found the plastic chairs have sticky stains on them and lots of ants. Called room service 4 times to get someone to iron my shirt because no iron in the room. Forgot sweatpants (Nautica navy blue) in the bathroom and when called they said they will check and get back to me no one did. I am a strong believer in second chances so I want to give them the benefit of the doubt I booked again on 11/18/22, I tried to book it over the phone but they said no rooms were available but online is showing that you do have availability so they asked me to book online on a 3rd party website. I originally booked a single room but later my dad decided to join me on the trip so I called them to change to a double room they said I can only do that when I check in but I was afraid they will be sold out so I asked the guy on the phone to put a note on my reservation to transfer to a double room which he said he did and told me it will $20 extra. I went to check in and it was the same front desk guy Ahmed from before. He asked us to be seated for 5 mins till he finishes the group check-in, we waited for 30 mins, and he also started helping other people who just came so I got up and got in the line too. The line wasn‚Äôt moving at all and another front desk was available so I asked him to check me in, his name was Omar he couldn‚Äôt locate my reservation I showed him the confirmation he called someone else who wasn‚Äôt wearing the same uniform looks like he already finished his shift. He wasn‚Äôt too happy he went to the back office and Omar asked me again to be seated for 5 mins I replied I already sat down for 30 mins and I have my dad who is 76 years old and I need to get him to the room, he told me I promise it will be 5 mins. Then he called me in and said that we don‚Äôt have any double rooms and that my booking was for a single room. I had to explain to him that I spoke to someone on the phone to upgrade and they suppose to be left a note on the account so he said let me see what I can do, then he was trying to use the staple but it was out and he said ‚Äúwhat an awful night‚Äù in his language (heya Leila Zarka) kept going back and forth for a staple then sat down the paper on the counter went to the back office again then came back saying it‚Äôs my lucky night we found you a double room. It was room 737, asked me for the $20 gave him the card, but the credit card terminal is out then asked if I have cash. He unplugged it and plugged it back in and it worked. I asked to have 3 key cards since we are 2 in the room and he said only 1. Finally checked in, five mins being in the room phone is ringing Nourhan from guest relations asked if everything was okay and I addressed the inconvenience of a lengthy check-in time that goes for almost an hr that I never experienced anywhere else, she said she will let the manager know and went out an hour later with my dad when we came back we noticed the bed closer to the window is caved in so I let my dad sleep on the other bed. I woke up at 4 am to use the bathroom and my back is sore from the metal springs in the mattress I had to fold my bedspread in 4 to make up enough layers to fill in the mattress bow. The next morning I left the key on the counter at the front desk and walked away but the guy was trying to ask me to wait while finishing another guest, I told him I don‚Äôt need a receipt. This place isn‚Äôt as good as it used to be and is managed by a bunch of inexperienced people who knew nothing about the hospitality business.‚Ä¶

We stayed 4 nights during a tour in Egypt and the hotel didn't disappoint us. The twin room was very comfortable and spacious with a view over the city.   The breakfast buffet was AMAZING! A huge spread. Loved the fava bean porridge and accompaniments and falafel!    There is a huge shopping mall 10min walk from the hotel.  I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to have a comfortable stay in Cairo.

Really one of the worst hotel I stayed in all over the world especially the front desk staff‚Ä¶ quality of food and restaurant Om service is absolutely low. I wouldn‚Äôt advise anyone to stay in such low level hotel. On top of that it doesn‚Äôt worth such value for 5 stars hotel

amazing service, and great cleaning in a short amount of time . and very kind hearted people and if i ever came to Egypt again i would for sure come back to this hotel . and a . special thanks for iman

Nice hotel allocation food was good and reception team was very helpful and have good attitude i will repate my accommodation again soon we will come back again and recommended for all my friends thanks tolip

Customer service is not as expected at all . Room is clean.  A call for slipper responded in 2 hours.   The receptionist was very polite but nothing is professional  ‚Äú‚Äù‚Äù@@@@@@@ am still staying for another 4 rooms will keep reporting good and bad in a way to enhance it

My family of six children, ny wife and myself arrived for the first time in Egypt and were looking forward to a pleasant stay at the five star hotel- Tolip golden plaza hotel  On our arrival we were told that we did not have a booking which was untrue and then we were told that our booking was for one room and not three . We got that sorted out ,which took some time , and they found our booking but then we found out that the rooms were all smoking  rooms. This was despite making sure we requested  three NON SMOKING rooms on our o line booking. On entering the rooms,  two of them were absolutely  disgusting . The stench of cigarette smoke was foul and overpowering  and my daughter, who suffers from allergies and has sensitive skin, was finding it hard to cope. We are not unreasonable and one room was adequate so we left our sons in there. When we spoke to the reception,  we were told that they would find us other rooms.  We said as long as two rooms were on the same floor that was fine so our daughters could be with us. They told us that that two rooms on the same floor were available. They gave us only one room .   My wife and myself took that upper floor and my daughters were waiting in the smoking room as we had been told they would be moved imminently.   They sat in their travelling clothes without relaxing waiting with their suitcases.   I then went down to sort it out.  At reception i was met with hostile and unhelpful staff members who avoided eye contact with me . Again i was assured someone was going to come and the new room was being prepared.  We were assured that it would be ready promptly within the hour .   An hour passed with nobody dealing with our issue. On phoning down to reception and asking again we were told five minutes and that passed too.   We phoned again and kept on hold until they said someone was coming.   Someone from housekeeping did indeed come then and took my daughters to a room which was ANOTHER smoking room and not only that but was the room that my wife and I had vacated!    Another call to reception and we were told someone was dealing with it and to be patient .  Another hour passed and then another Finally i fell asleep  with my wife and daughters still waiting for a room.   Imagine how tired we all were and how exhasted .   Finally at around 2 in the morning my wife had had enough and went down to reception almost in tears, fatigued and angry. There- one member who had just come on shift  finally gave her a clean non smoking room  but on another floor -with assurances that the following day we would be given another room hopefully on our floor once people had checked out.   Imagine our  surprise when we did not get that room and no one even asked us about it!  We gave up at that point and couldn‚Äôt wait to leave the place.   Three rooms on three different floors. I wasn‚Äôt able to keep an eye on my young children and my daughters . It is totally unacceptable and so unbecoming to a hotel that boasts five stars.   Cleaning staff and housekeeping were more friendly and helpful than front desk. They were the rudest and most unhelpful people I could have hoped to meet and for staff who were supposed to deal with clients in the hospitality business they were totally unsuited to their profession. I never want to go to that hotel again - the experience was terrible and gave such  a bad impression of Egypt. As a frequent flyer I have been around the world and it is not an exaggeration to say that this hotels front desk staff was the worst I have experienced in any of the countries I have been in terms of attitude and behaviour . Perhaps some retraining in the art of hospitality might be in order .‚Ä¶

Thank you for reception team the hotel very close from Citystars and the front office staff was very friendly all my clients will stay on Tolip golden plaza really it‚Äôs nice hotel thanks to Moustafa at reception

The place is difficult to reach. The entrance is obscure.  The reception is chaotic. Personnel are evasive and generally unhelpful. The staff are just too stiff! Toilets are sub-optimal regarding cleanliness. The meeting room and the parking are OK. The price is not cheap either.  Generally would not recommend except as a last resort.

Booked 2 rooms through Agoda for 3 adults and 1 child of 14y. At check in, we were told that the booking was for only 1 double and 1 single and that I had to pay for the child. We were not agreeable and contacted Agoda which sorted it out. Breakfast was good and filling. There are lots of restaurants nearby to eat. We didn't use any of the facilities.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights as part of a tour.  The hotel lobby, coffee shop, outdoor pool and location were great. The morning buffet breakfast was excellent and the staff friendly and helpful.  However, the rooms are extremely old and dated. Additionally, they have not been maintained. On the first night, water from the bathroom above our room leaked and flooded our bathroom. The room balcony which had a fantastic view of the Nile was unusable as it hadn't been maintained and dirty.  I would still stay at this hotel due to the location, amenities and staff.

I think this Hilton is the best one in Cairo at the moment. They take the Corona situation very serious (although quite some guests unfortunately don‚Äôt). The staff tries to enter the room as few times as possible. But if needed housekeeping can be requested.  Also because of Covid, guests that book a room with breakfast (or have it included) have a choice between room service or breakfast in the restaurant. There are no limitations on the breakfast options. The roomservice menu (dinner/ lunch) still has many options (more than other Hilton hotels worldwide during this pandemic). Rooms do have a classic interior, but all is really well maintained. The pool is located on the bank of the Nile, the only downside can be that it is sunny until around 1pm. I love the location in Zamalek, which is an area I like to wander around. The icing on the cake is the very friendly and helpful staff‚Ä¶. I can recommend this hotel fully and can‚Äôt wait to return here.‚Ä¶

Charming hotel located perfectly at the Nile. Amazing view and located in the heart of the vibrant neighborhood of zamalek. The rooms are nice and clean. The breakfast is very good with a great variety of food, international and Egyptian. The staff is friendly and helpful and attentive. The staff at the reception is very kind and professional, we were helped by Moustafa who is a great asset to this hotel! We will definitely come back, we already booked our next stay with the whole family for next February!

W·∫π have stayed 4 nights in Hilton zemalek Cairo, Hotel staffs ar·∫π Very polite and well beheaved.   Hotel food is Very good. Also rooms and room service.   This hotel is next to Nile river. W·∫π can see the rever view from the hotel balcony.  Over all good place to stay here.

Seriously had the best massage with Mariam. She has magic hands. I was in a car accident two weeks ago and was in so much pain and stiff and she was so gentle and worked through it all and is the first time I felt relief since it happened. My husband had his massage with Ramy and he felt soooo much better. He has back issues as well and Ramy was nice and strong working through it all. 10/10 Definitely book your massage you won‚Äôt regret it. We are booking another one in a couple days üôÇ

Great service and food quality and taste. Clean pleace with a great view to the Nile River and Hotel pool. The hotel haa an International Updated Environment. The Personel crew are profesional and very commited to attend their clients under the manager supervision.

The hotel is very comfortable, beautiful and in a excellent location. The food is excellent and the staff extremely helpful and kind. It was a pleasant experience. Safety is also a important aspect of this hotel.

The location is nice, but very very busy as it‚Äôs in the middle of diplomatic area. Lovely view over the Nile from the rooms and gym.  The rooms are huge! 2 bedrooms, kitchen and two bathrooms, ideal for families. This is a very old property so everything in the room is worn out, they try to maintain and clean but it‚Äôs old.  Great view from restaurant over the Nile

Excellent stay, the hotel staff couldn‚Äôt do enough for us and the breakfast is amazing (and thanks Mohammed for looking after us at breakfast ). Room was very clean and comfortable (thanks Fatima). View from our room of the Nike was great too. Pool is lovely too! We booked some private tours through the hotel, which were amazing; thanks Wagih (our guide), Ibrahim and Sayad for arranging everything, we had a fantastic time, saw incredible sights and learned a lot. And thanks Moustafa on the front desk for helping us with all our questions!

The property is located in a relatively quiet neighborhood and away from the hustle bustle of downtown Cairo. At the same time the access to places of interest is very convenient. The hotel by itself is very well managed with competent and friendly service. Overall a very good choice for staying in Cairo and would be staying in the same hotel anytime we visit Cairo again.
Review

excellent food and wonderful service.  The pane vino restaurant was delicious and our waiter Adel rahman was helpful, friendly and very efficient.  We found the price is very reasonable and the view was great. This is a must place to eat if you‚Äôre in this area

Hotel location is good. Walking distance to a couple of tourist spots in downtown Cairo. Breakfast is nice. House keeping guy Taha on 15th floor is very nice and helpful. Good place for long stay. Safe and comfortable.

GATE 1 arranged this luxurious hotel for our Cairo stay ! It was an amazing experience, very friendly, hospitable , comfortable, efficient! The breakfast was fantastic ; views from rooms of either the Nile or Tahrir square were simply magnificent!  The luggages , check ins, check outs of ALL 57 of us were handled seemlessly by GATE 1 ! The buses were new, with WIFI and charge ports in every seat ! The drivers were  friendly and professional too ..,  THREE CHEERS to GUDES RIHAM, NEHAL and our driver ZACHARIYA! üëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèº  The restaurants were fabulous too , especially the Indian  and Thai ones !

Great Hotel with Solid Service. Especially the receptionist Yasser helped me and my mom book a reservation at the Revolving Restaurant & we had an amazing date and ambience over there which we really enjoyed.   Highly recommend and especially letting our dear friend Yasser do all the bookings, tours and reservations for you !

‚Ä¶.. that there was a time, before retirement, when the Intercon group was my very favourite and I enjoyed their highest status of Royal Ambassador ‚Ä¶ but these days I travel using my own money but still choose this brand when I am able to. The receptionist smiled when he found my card had lapsed some 14 years ago but my smiling request for a Nile view room was ignored as he is clearly not able to use his discretion for ‚Äúold friends‚Äù!! He did however offer my a rate on the daily breakfast that my agent had not sort to include in my booking ‚Ä¶. a good guy who went the extra mile!  Breakfast is a Bun Fight in the In and Out Cafe!! The receptionist very organised and one of the staff named Omnia a service ‚Äústar‚Äù ‚Ä¶ the perfect staff member that we dearly loved to have in the days when I ran hotels myself  The breakfast restaurant clearly lacks organisation ‚Ä¶ in my four days here they have never ever managed to have sufficient fruit juices available to meet demand ‚Ä¶ it is a crying shame! The price charged for breakfast is substantial and the food offering and general service does not reflect that  We have also had a meal in the lobby cafe each evening of our stay ‚Ä¶ and here we see classic Egyptian management at work! When I opened restaurants in Egypt we found that one of the major hurdles was to teach managment to be proactive in quickly addressing guests needs and not expecting staff to do everything ‚Ä¶. I am easy on service because I understand but having to approach service staff and demand attention or serve myself my own drinks means that I have had enough!  I like this hotel and will return ‚Ä¶ it is so very easy to get to anywhere in Cairo and the Bell Captains help in securing me local taxi was everything as it should be. The front door service, reception desk and Omnia deserve full recognition!!!  Final Question? ‚Ä¶.. why is the same sandwich served three different ways in three days ‚Ä¶ the F&B director needs to question why standards are not being followed‚Ä¶

We stayed , I and my wife, in Semiramis intercontinental Cairo, for 16 nights from 19/10/2022 to 4/11/2022. It was , as always, a wonderful experience . The reception was very courteous , we were upgraded to a stunning suite, the ladies in the executive lounge looked after us very well. The food was of wonderful variety..this is my 11th year of staying in Semiramis , will never stay anywhere else, in fact we , already, booked our trip for next year. I would like to thank Karim Zereef who helped us enormously, thanks to Mena  in the front desk, the ladies in the lounge, Mena, Hidi, Reem, Nermin . Thanks to Amanny, Waleed, Mehmood, Muhammed, Abu Zaid and the rest. Thanks , once again, to all of you who made our stay so nice and pleasurable‚Ä¶ See you, all, next year!! Najim Ghulam and Hala Safari‚Ä¶

My wife and I stayed here two nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  Very good location and attentive staff.  Our room was large, bed very comfortable and we enjoyed sitting on little deck over looking the Nile and the city.  The dinner and breakfast buffet was extensive, food well prepared and there was room for people to move around without banging into each other.  All in all a very nice stay and we would recommend.

The worst reception and service I have ever had in a so-called 5-star hotel. No recognition of my Ambassador status. Disorganized check-in and check-out. They gave me a room that was not ready yet. The terrace bar of the hotel is simply dirty. The management of this hotel should be ashamed of the quality of the respect given to the customers. IHG should audit this hotel thoroughly.

I‚Äôve been to over thirty  intercontinentales, and as a royal ambassador I can say this was one of the top one or two. The hotel is remodeled, the staff (especially Haremos and Waleed in the club lounge) were very attentive and friendly.   The ambassador club is also one of the best I‚Äôve seen, out of all the intercontinentales I‚Äôve visited. Only the one in Seoul is of the same caliber.   The location is perfect, right on the Nile and next door to the museum.

Booking and staff are very good and friendly.  THE ROOMS ARE A BIT TIRED,  Doors does not close properly. They are very old and they have not been modernised.  The views are great overlooking the Nile and I could see the pyramids from my balcony.  Breakfast was good, but it was very busy and doesn't feel like a personal experience.  Some of the staff are stressed and some are pleasant.  Reception staff are good and helpful.  We had a room which was next to the lift shaft.  This room was very noisy all night and I had to fight to get it changed.  Overall, the experience is good but not excellent.

The InterContinental Citystars in Cairo truly offers top class hospitality in a location conveniently close to the airport and adjacent to a sophisticated shopping mall.  The hotel restaurants offer a selection of excellent and diverse cuisines, service is impeccable and the staff are friendly yet discreet. Our hotel stay was the perfect complement to an intense tour of Egypt's historical sites.

It was the worst stay of all services and unexpected,,  1 The reception is very bad  2 The staff is unhelpful and not friendly  3 The reception manager is not cooperative at all, and he does not have any solutions to the hotel's mistakes  4 The rooms are old and bad, their furniture is bad and their smell is bad, the bathrooms are old, their marble is broken, and they have sewage.  5 The reception of the breakfast employee is rude and unwelcoming to guests at all.  There are so many comments that I don't want to waste my time writing them Attached is a summary of my visit to the worst 5-star hotel in the history of my travels, where my stay was for one day, and thank God for that, it was an experience and will not be repeated, no matter how much the hotel offers me upgrades,,

The hotel staff was what made this stay special. We had multiple problems with the rooms during our stay but Mohamed Mustafa intervened directly and resolved everything to our satisfaction.  In addition, Executive Lounge staff Osama Yassin, Ahmed Saeed, Merna, and Ramy Nader were welcoming and attentive.  They were all extremely pleasant and great communicators.    I want to call out Bellman Ahmed (don't have his last name, sorry) who was especially helpful when our local tour guide did not show up.  He made multiple phone calls to the agency and made sure that the issue was resolved.  He was very pleasant and professional.

Just perfect and very helpfull n kind staff Everything was ultra clean Room service is superior Food and service at Esplanade restaurant was more than perfect Cocktail dinner at business lounge was very deliciousüòä

Excellent stay superb breakfast professional staff exquisite health club nice massage, room service was good and responsive to complaints the pool was nice and clean I would definitely recommend it to everyone, I am a regular visitor and always look up to staying there

Luxurious hotel connected to Citystars mall in Cairo.  The architecture, design and decorations in this hotel are gorgeous.  The employee are very friendly, and the room is very spacious.  It‚Äôs location is unbeatable since it‚Äôs 10 kilometers from Cairo International Airport.

This is a very nice property close to many attractive sites. Wonderful staff willing to extend help whenever you ask for. Very goods variety of restaurants and tasty food. I liked Fyruz and Alkhal. We enjoyed the entertainment program in Fyruz. Really enjoyed it.

Again, I am here in Intercontinental City Stars Cairo. A wonderful place to enjoy and stay in one of the most luxurious hotels in Egypt. I so grateful for their hospitality as all staff spare no efforts to make your stay as a part of heaven. Location is perfect.

I'm a frequent traveler and it's hard to find a hotel that I like. I really like the intercontinental in cairo, because of the great location. The hotel is within walking distance of every place and is very quiet in the evenings. When I stay there, I always stay in the same room because I love the feeling of a hotel room with a nice view.  My favorite little feature that I like about the hotel is pool, the staff was very nice specially mr. ahmed hassan from front office , i would like to revisit the hotel again.

I was looking for a new hotel room for my family and this was the best choice by far! When we got into the room, we were surprised by how nice it was. The room was well-appointed with a comfortable king-sized bed and a large flat screen TV. The bathroom was even nicer; we all love going to the pool  together and it was so much fun The best part of this hotel, though, was the location: it was close to many things, In the end i would like to thank Mr. Hatem Samir and Mr. Ahmed Hassan for welcoming me.

EVERYTHING & EVERYONE was awesome!! We were welcomed with complimentary Egyptian mezzeh and wine. The restaurant had delicious food & the breakfast selection was one of the best I‚Äôve ever had! Our room was so spacious and the staff made us feel like we were at home. They even had a great selection of excursions for us to choose from and gave us the best tour guide ever!! The hotel concierge, Abdul & Muhammad, treated us like royalty and gave us an awesome tour guide! Our tour guide was Medo and we can‚Äôt wait for another adventure with him! He was so charismatic and a great Egyptologist!!! Can‚Äôt rave about this place and hospitality enough!! MUST STAY when visiting Cairo!!

I would like to thank Geky ossama, Ahmed Nabil, Ebran, Andrew, Mahmoud abd el aziz, mohamed reda and the rest of the staff/waiters for being helpful and friendly.   They were punctual, keen on helping the tram and to provide an outstanding service for the business event.   And I loved the food, good quality and great taste.

the management team and the staff was very helpful and friendly. they were very supportive in organizing the event with us. won't be the last cooperation for sure. many thanks, and we look forward to cooperating with you again.

The hotel is absolutely fantastic. The gym is great and the staffs are very courteous and friendly. The breakfast area is large with a great variety and lots of stuff you can try.  Definitely a must visit

Restaurant Chinoix. Good chinese food, fresh vegetables and tasty. Excellent service. Delicious jasmine tea. Nice atmosphere. Good portions. Recommended for people who enjoys good quality. It is a restaurant inside the hotel. So, it is quite convenient.

Update*** management contacted me and expressed their concern and assured everything will be rectified. Amazing response by management staff....I will continue my stay here as management seem to truly care about the guests.

Stayed at this hotel and had a lovely dinner at the Chinese restaurant - Great food, great ambiance and great service!! Amir and the Youssef had excellent service. I would go to this restaurant again. Thank you very much!! And cheers to a great trip in Cairo.

Went to Triumph hotel and was amazed and surprised by the service everything was perfect, Stuff is absolutely professional especially Mohamed Sabry met him in different situations and restaurants and was always keen to make sure that the service food and quality is up to the standards without me even commenting, Thank you Triumph stuff Thank you Mohamed Sabry

Everything was perfect and smooth and the service was good, the staff were professional and the food is great. The room is clean and orgnized and the housekeeping was helpful. Nothing bad I face in the stay at all and the location is fantastic

Great hospitality and comfort, location is near of all entertainment visits, about restaurant diversity of all delicious foods, Great Pool view,gym is good, Staff are amazing, Really enjoyed and I will come again soon with my family

I had a great experience with my family; my accommodation was a mixed stay between work, tourism, and sightseeing for my family; I enjoyed the hotel atmosphere and welcoming staff for five days.  The hotel premises are fantastic; the food is more than excellent.

I always enjoyed my stay in Triumph new cairo , kindly staff , beautiful quite place to  stay, spaecial thanks to Mr.Ahmed Attrees and Mr.mohaned Shoukry for the great hospitality level and excellent services in breakfast .üëç

It is my first time for me here .I‚Äôm diamond elite member with IHG but really like this hotel .like the hospitality here from all the staff special Mr.Hamdy from reception and Mrs.Rasha the Guest Relations Manager for all their effort that they provided to me .Hopfully the hotel provides club lounge for IHG members as the hotel is different than other Holiday inn.Will come again in June .

Eman is really nice and polite, in general all the staff  from the Hotel  and the most amazing is the view that is direct to the Nile.  I really recommend to look the sunset at the pool area because it's amazing. this Hotel have many  amenities like Casino and bar  in the building. Neben the hotel are many pharmacies and supermarket if you need to buy  something for emergencies.

This hotel is clean, has many delicious meal options and friendly staff.  Marina, the Client Service Representative, was extremely helpful.  She scheduled tours for us, everything was easy and flawless.  Thank you!

As usual an excellent stay (ongoing for another 10 days) staying in the IHG Holiday Inn suites in Maadi Cairo.   Food is excellent, internet excellent, beds very comfy, all in a very nice place to be for work or personnel break.   Invited to the hotel weekly reception gathering and met the very professional and informative guest relations team.   Stayed here many times including all other IHG brands / hotels globally.   Excellent service, very friendly, and excellent IHG members program  My go to brand for hotels and myself and colleagues will continue to use IHG

Organized to spend an extra night here so we could have some time by the pool. They slipped a note under the door in the night saying the pool and gym would be closed all day for a private function. When asked if  they could shuttle us to the other holiday inn, they declined. The hotel itself was otherwise nice but we wouldn‚Äôt have stayed here if we had known earlier.

Food tasted very nice and the service of the waiters was more than perfect,very cosy place Thanks to amro and alaa eldin for the good welcoming Thanks for all the staff Will definetly visit again Perfectooooooüòçüòçüòç
Room service & housekeeping was helpful very clean & organised  Special thanks for  Remonda & iman organising resorption event  Place was great  It will not the last time isa  Stuff was kind and help

The hotel is located in a very beautiful place in Maadi, looking at the Nile. The staff were so kind and hospitable, they offered me a VIP room, and always takes care of my needs. Salut to the ladies of the guest relations they are more than kind!

I stayed at 6th floor at the hotel for 6 days . I came for a workshop . I wanna recommend waleed as room attendants . I lost my gold ring in the room. He found it in the room and left it to me in a visible place . That was amazing !

The hole staff is very friendly and very hospitable.  Rasha , The Guest relation manger is very friendly and caring.  She Called us to check on us and asking how the room is . The location of the hotel is very good and close to the center of Cairo I‚Äôm recommending this hotel to my all my friends

My girlfriend and I had a massage with Salma and Mohanad today at this place and we enjoyed our experience. They were both very professional and provided great service. Highly recommend if you are looking to relax! The massages were also very complete and for the full body.

I think this Hilton is the best one in Cairo at the moment. They take the Corona situation very serious (although quite some guests unfortunately don‚Äôt). The staff tries to enter the room as few times as possible. But if needed housekeeping can be requested.  Also because of Covid, guests that book a room with breakfast (or have it included) have a choice between room service or breakfast in the restaurant. There are no limitations on the breakfast options. The roomservice menu (dinner/ lunch) still has many options (more than other Hilton hotels worldwide during this pandemic). Rooms do have a classic interior, but all is really well maintained. The pool is located on the bank of the Nile, the only downside can be that it is sunny until around 1pm. I love the location in Zamalek, which is an area I like to wander around. The icing on the cake is the very friendly and helpful staff‚Ä¶. I can recommend this hotel fully and can‚Äôt wait to return here.‚Ä¶

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights as part of a tour.  The hotel lobby, coffee shop, outdoor pool and location were great. The morning buffet breakfast was excellent and the staff friendly and helpful.  However, the rooms are extremely old and dated. Additionally, they have not been maintained. On the first night, water from the bathroom above our room leaked and flooded our bathroom. The room balcony which had a fantastic view of the Nile was unusable as it hadn't been maintained and dirty.  I would still stay at this hotel due to the location, amenities and staff.

Charming hotel located perfectly at the Nile. Amazing view and located in the heart of the vibrant neighborhood of zamalek. The rooms are nice and clean. The breakfast is very good with a great variety of food, international and Egyptian. The staff is friendly and helpful and attentive. The staff at the reception is very kind and professional, we were helped by Moustafa who is a great asset to this hotel! We will definitely come back, we already booked our next stay with the whole family for next February!

W·∫π have stayed 4 nights in Hilton zemalek Cairo, Hotel staffs ar·∫π Very polite and well beheaved.   Hotel food is Very good. Also rooms and room service.   This hotel is next to Nile river. W·∫π can see the rever view from the hotel balcony.  Over all good place to stay here.

Seriously had the best massage with Mariam. She has magic hands. I was in a car accident two weeks ago and was in so much pain and stiff and she was so gentle and worked through it all and is the first time I felt relief since it happened. My husband had his massage with Ramy and he felt soooo much better. He has back issues as well and Ramy was nice and strong working through it all. 10/10 Definitely book your massage you won‚Äôt regret it. We are booking another one in a couple days üôÇ

Great service and food quality and taste. Clean pleace with a great view to the Nile River and Hotel pool. The hotel haa an International Updated Environment. The Personel crew are profesional and very commited to attend their clients under the manager supervision.

The hotel is very comfortable, beautiful and in a excellent location. The food is excellent and the staff extremely helpful and kind. It was a pleasant experience. Safety is also a important aspect of this hotel.

The location is nice, but very very busy as it‚Äôs in the middle of diplomatic area. Lovely view over the Nile from the rooms and gym.  The rooms are huge! 2 bedrooms, kitchen and two bathrooms, ideal for families. This is a very old property so everything in the room is worn out, they try to maintain and clean but it‚Äôs old.  Great view from restaurant over the Nile

Excellent stay, the hotel staff couldn‚Äôt do enough for us and the breakfast is amazing (and thanks Mohammed for looking after us at breakfast ). Room was very clean and comfortable (thanks Fatima). View from our room of the Nike was great too. Pool is lovely too! We booked some private tours through the hotel, which were amazing; thanks Wagih (our guide), Ibrahim and Sayad for arranging everything, we had a fantastic time, saw incredible sights and learned a lot. And thanks Moustafa on the front desk for helping us with all our questions!

first of all I would like to mention Mr Amir, the director of this hotel, because he is one of the nicest persons I ever met, he tries his best to help and make you feel welcome. All the people in general are extremely nice and helpful but he is much more. The hotel is not in the centre but it is only 20min far from the airport and it is in direct communication through the garage to the Citystars shopping centre, the biggest of Egypt. Thanks to this, you do not have to take a taxi to go to any restaurant, as inside the Citystars there is a wide choice of high level restaurants with very high ratings in Tripadvisor as well. Being the Staybridge the same family of Intercontinental, from the shopping centre you also have direct access to this other hotel where there are other excellent restaurants. Prices of restaurants are also much cheaper than staying anywhere else in the centre. In any tourist area prices are at least double. I did not give 5 stars because they need to improve breakfast service and quality. All the rest is really excellent, rooms are big, very confortable, very clean, they leave bottles of water every day, laundry is for free, beds are very confortable. Wifi works perfect. There is no swimming pool while the gym is very good. There is nothing outside the hotel and the area is not nice, but it is the standard in Cairo, as pollution and traffic are terrible, and quality of the buildings is extremely poor. The hotel is a gem in the area. The shopping centre closes at late night therefore in case of any need you find anything in there‚Ä¶

The hotel is very clean and quiet and have excellent location with direct access to the city stars mall which contains all sort of shopping, dinning and fun places. The food served in the included breakfast was very good as well with good variety and options to dine in the restaurant or the room.

Great experience thanks to a wonderful staff. Shady and Muhammad Abdullah at the front desk remember you and your room number throughout the stay. Very helpful. Rehab and Nagwa run the restaurant with caring and efficiency. Suites are as big as my first condo. Two caveats: 1, there is no pool. You can walk through the lovely Intercontinental pool area (sister hotel next door) but you can‚Äôt use it. 2, no dedicated tour desk. The front desk staff will help arrange anything you request, though!    The hotel is connected to an upscale mall with gourmet grocery store, theaters, and tons of restaurants.

I came to Egypt and found out about an event called Ramadan. Ramadan is a very important and sacred event for Egyptians. I am currently staying at Staybridge. The staff at Staybridge will give me great support as a foreigner. During Ramadan, the staff provided me with a comfortable room. I am deeply grateful to Miss.Asmaa and Mr.Amir. PS Staff Abdelrahman, Mina, Salah, Nagwa, Rehab, Adel, Tarek, Michael‚Ä¶ The staff are all wonderful people. Service is perfect.. the view from my room fantastic  thank you Staybridge and the   team is freindely and politely special Miss Asmaa Elhadary  and Mr. Amir Mahmoud   from the reception exceeded my expectations

We stayed at this hotel in October 2021 for 12 nights. From the first moment of our arrival ,we felt the exceptional customer service. Mr. Mohammed Abd Allah the front desk manager who met us did an excellent job trying to accommodate our need.  The room was excellent,  breakfast was great and lots of varieties and the location of the hotel was superb being in city star itself.   I would give 5 stars for all the friendly employees for their excellent customer service trying to do all they can so you can enjoy your stay . I really would stay there again whenever I visit Cairo.

Service is perfect.. the view from my room fantastic üòç thank you kempinski and the team is freindely and politely special Mariam from geust relation and ahmed from the reception and mohamed from conserige

I booked 2 rooms at the hotel last week, and I truly enjoyed a remarkable experience from checking-in till departure! The hotel exceeded my expectations. I highly recommend this hotel for: 1) Great, friendly staff. 2) Spacious, fully-equipped rooms. 3) Exceptional sense of security. 4) Location & direct access to city stars mall. It's the best choice for Families and travelers who appreciate the 'Home, away from home experience'

This is our third stay at this amazing hotel. We stayed in suite 1012 between 24/09/2021 - 08/10/2021. The hotel in general is beautiful and suites are specious, clean and beds are extremely comfy. I also loved the view from our room. The staff are friendly and I must say special thanks to (Michael) who works in the reservation department "thank you for your time and gracious hospitality. Thanks again for doing everything you could to make us feel at home and thank you for going the extra mile for us I really appreciate your efforts and can't thank you enough" .  I must also say special thanks to (Bahaa) (housekeeping manager) for being so generous and helpful. He looked after us very well during our stay :)  A Big thank you to (Rehab) for preparing a decent breakfast for us every morning, she was extremely generous, I can't thank her enough for looking after us during our stay as this made our stay unforgettable.  Thanks to everyone else for the warm welcome. Hotel facilities are superb.  I highly recommend this fantastic hotel.‚Ä¶

Nice place! Super super helpful staff even with my language limited to English only. I never made it to breakfast but it was nice to just pop over to the mall via the parking garage when I needed to. Bathroom a little small but there is the kitchen etc so that explains why. Overall good stay.

A very good experience and worth every day stay. The massage, fitness equipment and restaurants were great. A number of staff were very helpful. Among them is Alaa, Mostapha and Saber. I would recommend a stay in Conrad

I have stayed twice in July once before going to north cost and other after coming from north cost   For some reasons I made mistake in dates , they were so collaborative in fixing the date as per the right plan with no charge considering am diamond member   And as usual Conrad never turned me down in taking care of all the hygiene starting from the rooms, corridors and restaurants.  Breakfast is one of the things that i can‚Äôt missed during my staying in Conrad , the assortment is too good and always satisfying.  Mr.Gamal Yousry as his usual remembered me and my family members names , and welcome us back asking about our health status , also assure us that they are taking the highest precautions practices in all zones   Thanks again and always to Conrad hotel for making our first trip after the pandemic is so great   We always will come back and Conrad will always be out first choice‚Ä¶

A pleasant experience in Conrad. Excellent house keepers Saber & Alaa. Both folks would daily check on with me to ensure I am comfortable and have my room cleaned.   Another great folk is Mustafa. Walking into the hotel tired after a stressful trip. Mustapha lighten up my day with so much warmth, enthusiasm and interesting jokes. Such a good guy.

As a travel agent, I booked our group trip to Egypt and I'm glad we choose Conrad. Lucky for us, the hotel is almost complete with their renovations and as a result, our rooms were amazing.  The website does not do the hotel enough justice.   In addition to this, the hotel staff had great security around the clock, prompt room assistance, excellent restaurants with many different food options, and is overall reasonably priced.    I give them my best recommendation.

Our Road Scholar group ended our trip there.  It is a lovely hotel having  rooms with views of the Nile and a nice restaurant.  It is large so there is lots of room to wander and relax.  The management gave us a very late checkout without charge so we could catch a late flight to the US.  In the restaurant we were well taken care of by IMAN and the bell hop Ashfar made sure our Uber arrived on time and stayed with us until he arrived.

It was years ago that I visited the Conrad Hotel in Cairo and the recent visit was a very pleasent one. The Hotel was going to a major renovation and is surely making a very big uplift to the Hotel and the quality of the stay.  The staff are unusally friendly and accomedating and you get this special "I feel at home" vipe. It will surely be my preferred Hotel in Cairo when I plan to return shortly.

The best beds ever - didn't want to leave !  Great Food and Beverage and Moustafa at check ins as AMAZING !  Really appreciated the flowers in our room from Head of Housekeeping- Shereen and Nevine Albert made us so welcome on our arrival check in. THANK YOU !

Wonderful stay at conrad. Great location and lovely restaurants. Special thanks to Amr at Concierge, he was truly superb. Looked after us the whole stay. Arranged all our travel arrangements each morning and had our room upgraded when we had a small issue. He even went as far as calling the hotel we were booked at in sharm el sheikh to arrange for them to send a car to the airport to collect us as our transfer had failed. It seemed nothing was too much trouble. If you stay here please introduce yourselves to Amr as if there is anything that you need he will assist with a smile. You are a great ambassador for Conrad, thank you again Amr.

This was an amazing hotel. With amazing staff. The attention to detail throughout the hotel was fantastic. The housekeeping staff that was responsible for my room Saber and Laila were perfect and just a pleasure to see and talk to everyday. Very kind and helpful always asking if there was anything they could do for me. The hotel is in a great location and has amazing views. They have multiple restaurants, a bar/club, and a casino. I always felt welcomed and safe at the hotel. I will definitely stay here again if I should ever visit Cairo again in the future.

We have had a very enjoyable time here at the Conrad in Cairo a very comfortable place to spend our last few days here in Egypt  I would like to single out one person out of a whole lot of helpful and friendly staff. Ahmed Abdelhady was our breakfast waiter and could not have been more helpful. It felt as though we were the only people in the restaurant when in fact he was able to give everyone in the restaurant personal and excellent service. We certainly appreciated the friendly attention he gave us ensuring all our needs and more were met.

to the main resturant it was perfect as well as the cafe was good the staff was good also the pool was good indian resturant also was very good location malllVery nice hotel i spent my vacation there i went

The hotel is more than wonderful in Terms of cleanliness and other things. My experience in the main restaurant ‚Äúwindows‚Äù with breakfast is varied, delicious and fresh. The treatment of the staff is very hospitable and helpful. There is also a wonderful restaurant in the hotel devoted to Indian food ‚Äúindira‚Äù. This made me sensitive to the Indian dishes and their good flavor.  Spatial thanks to the front office team for the good reception and quick accommodations.

This hotel was very good in everything i liked the food it was delicious and amazing the buffet was perfect and the restaurant staff are smiling every time please keep on  rooms need some renovations  your perfect  job

One of the best hotels with the best hospitality, service and has one of the best locations in cairo.   I Loved my stay overthere and would definitely back in the near future. Room was so clean and food was really nice.

The hotel was perfect my stay was amazing i liked the hotel staff and the rooms were perfect swimming pool was clean and the staff was very helpful i will recommended this hotel to my friends and colleagues thank you for everything

Everything was good restaurant staff in the reception was good as well as the Indian restaurant staff was amazing the location near to mall also near to the airport the service was very good overall good üëç

the hotel is perfect for everything I liked the hotel staff specially the pool and gym and the front office team specially karim mohamed from concierge .the hotel location was perfect and very close to the mall and the Airport too ..

Have a lovely stay  Hotel stuff is very friendly Hotel is clean and rooms are big and clean The food in the restaurant is very tasty Great experience so i hope i came very soon  Great thankful for Mostafa and Micheal

I stayed there for business it was perfect, very close to the Airport, and the room it was very clean most key places in the city, and with a direct connection to the Mall. Thank you so much to all the team there; especially karim Mohamed AND Ramadan Youssif at the Concierge.  less

it was amazing i was very happy and the staff was very polite and smiley they help me in everything i needed, especially Karim Mohamed from front desk he was very helpful,and the room it was good and the restaurants too food is very testy

Amazing breakfast, the food is incredible and the buffet has a large variety of everything. The staff is so friendly and kind. Ask for Siham she‚Äôs super helpful and nice, she brought us everything we needed and even more.

I‚Äôve been staying at this hotel for years, so I know what to expect. This time I had multiple room bookings. Thanks to Ms. Marcelina, check-in was quick and flawless. IDs and special requests were sent one day before. Despite the hotel being very busy on the weekend, I got one room upgraded due to my Bonvoy status which is always welcome and a sign of appreciation from the Bonvoy group. Thanks Ms. Marcelina.   House keeping were always supporting and not late on our requests although they were many.   Thanks for Mr. Khalil from the swimming area for always setting up nice lounges in the shade close to each other as we were 10 people.   Room dining has improved significantly over the years. We ordered burger and chicken nuggets on multiple occasions. Always fresh with quality meat/ chicken. What you would expect from a 5 star hotel.   There was an evening wedding but due to the double glazed room windows, we couldn‚Äôt hear any sound inside the rooms.   Thank you for a great stay and looking forward to my next visit.‚Ä¶

My family and I had a wonderful stay at The Westin Cairo. The hotel has beautiful views overlooking a golf course as well as its own greenery. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The service in the hotel is first class; from the staff at breakfast (with special thanks to Aya, Seham and Amr), to the house keeping staff (special thanks to Mustafa and Muhammad), and everyone in reception (thank you Mark). I highly recommend this hotel.

I am a consistent guest to Westin Katameya dunes. I spend periods there for both family vacations and business events. It os a perfect place for both types of trips. Excellent Relaxing resort, very professional, friendly staff who thrives for guest satisfaction. Thanks to all Westin Katameya Dunes team with Special thanks to Marc and Abdelfattah

During my most recent business trip, I was impressed by the professionalism and amicability displayed by your staff members, as well as the quality of service provided, which convinced me that I can always rely on your hotel staff members. Mr. Amr Naguib and Mr. Mustafa deserve special thanks. Thank you very much!  Dr. Islam Nasralla

The place is great in terms of the green view, staff, and services, I like it very much and highly recommend it for relaxing breaks!! Kids also enjoyed too much and had a pleasant and funny stay.. The Westin Cairo Golf Resort is always our preferred choice in Cairo.

Fantastic stay at Westin hotel, loved the atmosphere and staff. Paloma was great, special thanks to Aya, welcoming lady. My daughter Alia promised to send her üíúüå∑. I strongly recommend it for honeymooners.

I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The views were amazing and the atmosphere made me feel at home. I was particularly impressed by how attentive the staff were. Special thanks go to Aya who greeted us with a wonderful smile when we went for breakfast. She made us feel special no matter how busy the restaurant want. I would like to thank her for her care and kindness. I can‚Äôt wait to visit her and her hotel again.

The space is very nice,  People are really kind. Mahmoud at restaurant presented me with very good sugestions, the last desert I've tried was amazing good. Every day the service was very good.  The lebanese grill is something you should definitely try.

Excellent service, quiet and tranquil atmosphere, good for a get away place.  Staff are all excellent, special thanks to Mark at the reception desk.  Rooms are comfortable and spacious. The design of the resort is appealing

Were helpful and welcoming even for brown skinned people.  Very Very big suite rooms. Bathrooms needs upgrade but everything was available as a full fledged apartment. Staff was excellent and support  in everything a guests needs. Location was great. Great views of Nile with balconies.

I would like to say huge thank you to everyone in Cairo Trade Centre Hotel üòä  Where can I start with out forgetting anything / Anyone!  The team in Cairo Trade Centre are there purely to give the best Service ever to their guests during their Stay, nothing too much. Restaurant ( Food and Beverage) Team always ready and happy to go the extra mile every day / everytime with out a fail üòäüëèüëè  House keeping team, well not just thorough, they are very polite, efficient, quality and always go the extra mile with out a doubt üòäüëèüëè  Swimming pool team. Fantastic experience. Keeping the place clean, tidy and safe for the swimming pool users also very friendly with everyone and caring for kids üòäüëèüëè  Front office team, well communicating and engaging team, again nothing too much. Quick response and reaction to any concern / quires. Well done team keep it up üòäüëèüëè  Also I don't want forget the very helpful And polite Security team and Luggage handling team üëèüëèüòä  So overall, well setup / family orientated environment and I strongly recommend this hotel for you especially if you're travelling with family and also to be in the heart of cairo.  Only one remark, that the rooms are bit old, especially Bathrooms. But well maintained and everything else compensate for that.  Once again many thanks and looking forward to seeing you soon.  S. The people in the hotel are just amazing.   The location is ideal for a calm afternoon walking next to the Nile after a long day.   Clean, spacious and comfortable.   Highly recommended for long or short visit to Cairo.

The people there are amazing from reception to restaurant. always making feel like home.   we moved there from another hotel and it saved our visit to Cairo. initially we were very disappointed but once we moved to the suite in this hotel, our mood changed. the price was right, a facility like this, you would expect more expensive.   breakfast had a nice buffet; the staff was just amazing. they were taking extra care of us (family of 4), offerring food beyong the expected.   the hotel is located in the old Cairo; all tourist attractions are in the old Cairo so staying in this hotel is the best choice.  the area around is the best for walking next to the Nile or enjoy an outdoor coffee/lunch/dinner.

The first night was horrible .. after long trip we rather to the hotel .. the staff was night and game has a room quickly .. but almost everything didn‚Äôt not work .. AC.. fridge .. lights .. bad smell ‚Ä¶  They sent maintenance and took care of our needs ..  but unfortunately AC quit working and it became hot .. next day .. the door won‚Äôt lock!  I complained to the management .. and they transferred us quickly to another room ..  Special thanks to Mrs Christina manager of reception and Mr Adel manage of housekeeping for taking care of us .. they were responsive and stayed on top of our claims till everything was resolved‚Ä¶ so give them 10/10 for their customer service

My family and I came in a visit from Amman, Jordan in Eid's holiday to enjoy the beauty of Egypt and its gorgeous Nile, we initially had a couple of concerns regarding various facilities in our stay in the Hotel, but gladly those concerns were met swiftly and professionally.  The staff were welcoming, responsive, attentive and carefully listening to our suggestions and acting upon them immediately, it left a good impression to us.  I have addressed minor services concerns found within the first few hours of my hotel check-In to the receptionist, who addressed my service concerns to the GM of hotel, who then called all hotel directors and asked them to speak to me in person individually and all apologized and offered me some perks i.e. the restaurants, coffee shop, swimming pool, refund on stay fees, town tours fees, room services...etc.  In addition to this they continued to follow up with me to ensure all my needs were met and if I needed anything further.  I would like to express my sincere gratitude and thanks for my treatment during my stay, my room was spectacular with a Nile View and very spacious. The hotel staff‚Äôs service and personal attention made a huge difference in the happiness and joy during my stay in Cairo, I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Cairo and would strongly recommend to all my friends and contacts to use the same.  I would like to make a special thanks to the lovely team who made this trip so memorable: 1. Dania, Rania and Asim on receptionist and their manager Christina 2. Redha Hamoda, Security officer 3. Amira, Guest Relation Manager 4. Ahmad, Restaurant Officer 5. Mahmoud, Restaurant Manager 6. Wasim Faraj, Food and Beverage Manager  Recommending this place for whoever wants to enjoy a delightful experience and a lovely stay in Cairo.  5 stars!  Nabil Dababseh.‚Ä¶

I really enjoyed my stay at world trade center hotel Cairo. Staff are friendly and helpful ..its my second home in Cairo ..lovely stay and amazing trace facing the Nile view ..I recommended for all my friends and family ..thank you so much

This place is by far THE worst ever. Everything was covered in dust in the room, we booked for a two week stay and unfortunately due to it being non refundable we had to live with the situation. Despite our daily complaints and reminders about how many guests are in the suite we never received the right amount of cutlery, the eggs were never cooked the way we asked which was simple ‚Äúwell done‚Äù it was always runny, the bathrooms were not clean at all, the balcony door would not shut completely, the window lock on one of the bedrooms would fall off as soon as we opened the window. These were not even the big issues.  We arrived on the 13th and today is the 22nd the water supply to the hotel was cut off. When we spoke to the staff/management they had claimed it was an issue with the main water supply of the area and not the hotels issue. We called a bunch of times to see if this was resolved and got no proper update.  We left the hotel to go out and before coming back we called in the afternoon to get an update and the status was that the water issue was not yet resolved and nobody went to clean the room yet. In the evening around 10:30 we called again and the hotel staff assured us the room was checked and cleaned and the water issue was resolved.   We got back to the hotel and went back to our suite, the whole apartment had water soaked into the fitted carpet. When we went down to speak to the  management they said they would change our suite for us which they did but  ended up being in an apartment suite  that was in worse condition in terms of cleanliness than the first one we stayed in!   There was dust everywhere the room looked like it was not used in a long time. There was dust on the toilet area, there was dirt and crumbs on the carpet, dust on shelves, the bedding in all three rooms had dust and hair on them. According to the staff the suite had been ‚Äúchecked‚Äù and ‚Äúcleaned‚Äù earlier in the day. We were surprised by how confident they were in claiming everything had been cleaned when clearly it was not!    It is now 1:30am and the staff are cleaning under our supervision! We are supposed to be on a relaxing holiday and instead this trip has been full of stress and irritation due to negligence by hotel staff and management. Their compensation to us was slippers and tissue boxes!!!   The attached photos speak for themselves even the hotel staff who came to move our luggage to the ‚Äúnewly prepared suite‚Äù were embarrassed to see such a dirty and disgusting apartment suite. All they could say is on ‚Äúbehalf of the hotel we are truly sorry tell us what we can do to make it better‚Äù.   Seriously???!!!!!!  This is supposed to be under ‚ÄúHilton‚Äù hotel chains and it was no where near the Hilton standard!  We are extremely shocked and frustrated and disappointed about everything we have been through and still have to stay until our. Checkout as  it is non refundable.‚Ä¶

This hotel should have not been rated a 4 star . It was a - 0000. The hotel pictures were falsely depicted online. I DO NOT recommend any international travelers to stay at this hotel. I PROMISE you will be VERY DISAPPOINTED. And it certainly does not meet Covid protocol. It was unsanitary and management  and overall customer service was the WORST. We rented a suite to accommodate my family. We checked in at 4am in the morning and the complaints began as soon as we walked in. We ended our stay there by 11am. Total of 6 hours of disgust and poor hospitality. My cousin was locked into one of the bedrooms and we had to call the front desk from our cell phones since our hotel room phone was not working. It took them an hour to break down the door and get him out. The couches and dinning room chairs were stained, the carpet was stained and had lifted from the floor. The kitchen was not cleaned the stove had not been cleaned from the previous stay and was rusted and old. A loud electrical noise was coming from the kitchen that they couldn‚Äôt resolve and it lasted the entire time. The bathrooms were SCUM. Not cleaned. Toilets were stained and we could see scum and mold forming in all three bathrooms. No toilet paper, no clean towels, no soap‚Ä¶. Complete mess. I had initially reserved 3 nights and that quickly changed to a few hours. The manger that was the least bit helpful. I kept talking to her in English and she would respond in Arabic. She said she would not give us a refund that we would need to call Hilton hotline to complain. Although Hilton had said that the hotel would need to directly refund me. The hotel mgr mentioned they will be closing their doors anyways for remodeling in the next coming months. And she also said that since I spent more than a few hours in the hotel that it wouldn‚Äôt be fair for them to refund me. RIDICULOUS. This hotel needs to be reported to the Tourism Authorities really. Egypt is a beautiful and wonderful country full of hospitality and history and the people are full of heart and kindness. The hotel and management did not represent this country in any form or way. Shame on your Hilton World Trade.‚Ä¶

Completely outdated rooms and bathrooms. Bathrooms very dirty and moulded. Health and safety issues regarding electric sockets as even got fused when try to plug in. Covered with metal covering which comes loose. Shower curtain torn. Carpets dirty and stained. Shame on Hilton name. Not worth the money let alone staying.

The room is neat and clean, the restaurant is good, staffs are cooperative. Good to stay.  The hotel is far from the city center, do shopping is not easy.  The travel services to visit tourist spots provided by the Taxi booth of the hotel (named Last Minute travel services) was not up to the mark. The driver dropped me on the Egyptian museum and he was supposed to stay  at the gate. But when I come back visiting the museum, I did not find him. Then I called him and he declined the call. I sent him message , he responded sending message after half an hour without giving any specific time of coming. I was puzzled, waiting and waiting. Then I was thinking to hire another Taxi. Finally he came after more than an hour.   The services provided was also costly. I could hire a Taxi using the APP less than half price.  On the way back, it was planned to take me a super store for buying dry fruits. But  he did not took me to a right store. It was felt to me that he did it intentionally.‚Ä¶

Stayed in that hotel 2 weeks only back 2days ago had extremely  pleasant  experience  staff very helpful  polite  and so willing  to help the management  in the person  of Mr habib salary and Mr Adam Abdullah  are the shining  example  of how excellent  professional  hoteliers  should  be I was totally  impressed  this is the 2nd time I stay in  the  hotel  I was there in June this year  definitely  recommende it  quite  frankly  I couldn't  find any complaints  at all thank  you tolip hotel and ALL  staff  for being  that  good  and kind   Mrs laila  Mustapha  from London

Had a solid month-long stay at this property! The front desk staff was really friendly, especially Lobna, as well as Reem, Mohamed, and Marina. Mahmoud from room service was really friendly as well, as was Youstina from guest relations. The bellman were also really helpful. The housekeeping team that was with us all month, Hanaa and Ghada, were exceptional in their customer service - the rooms were always super clean and they had such a friendly attitude every time we interacted with them!
