Thank you Tolip El Galaa team for a memorable stay!

The staff were very accommodating and extremely caring and kind to our special needs.  They went out of their way to make our stay a happy one.  I can honestly say all staff were polite,  professional and committed to give excellent service.  I highly recommend this hotel.

It‚Äôs not five star hotel but the staff makes it 10 stars for me they are all very helpful specially Lara she an amazing reception girl with smile face and she‚Äôs very helpful I do love her when she knew that I got an Operation she upgrade my room to an suite room which was amazing suite

Very bad hotel Bad room service  The door didn't lock and anyone can open it from outside  The receptionist is very rude And aggressive in dealing with guesty Not recommended for any visitor Low quality

It‚Äôs like they don‚Äôt care! Alot of noise through day and night i couldn‚Äôt sleep, tried to call alot of times no reply! And when someone called it was to remind me of the check out time (which i asked to change and they confrimed it) no hellos and no goodbyes even! Did not like at all, never booking there again

I was chocked to be honest, when I saw the rating on Booking and that the hotel is a 5 star I expected a five star service and amenities. first at check in I asked for a glass of water after my long trip and I was responded at with " there is free water in the room and that If I am busting I can buy water from the local shop. second I have requested a double bed when I booked but I was told at the reception that it is not available. reception staff at check in were not very friendly and lacked customer service satisfaction. The room was very basic, the floor carpet was worn out and full of staines. the toilet was very small and unclean. the room was looking over the main street and it was extremely noisy we barely could sleep. the wardrobe was very old and worn out. window curtains were broken and doesn't block the day light. The tea and coffee tray was dirty. The room main door had a gap underneath it I could hear people outside same like they are in the room with me. ALL IN ALL I don't believe that this hotel should have a 5 star rating and to be honest I wouldn't recommend it.‚Ä¶

the hotel is really good I enjoyed my weekend here the rooms are wide and clean and the animation team are friendly also the food is so delicious.we enjoyed the pool and had a lot of fun in the pool area

very clean and modern rooms with amazing service and tasty food.  beach and pool are very enjoyable.  the animation team are very friendly and extremely talented. precautions and health and safety measures are being taken seriously. very enjoyable stay.

An afternoon by the pool, surrounded by the best team at the Roof Top Bar; Waled, Mohy, Frahat and Esam.  Exclusive, top notch service, second to none. Actually considering staying there tomorrow, skipping the planned sightseeing program‚Ä¶.üòÇ  We‚Äôll definitely come back here next time visiting Cairo   Gitte Seidelin

This is a beautiful luxury hotel situated on the Nike River. My husband and I are here for a few days prior to our Nile river cruise. Staff is extremely helpful at the dining areas, rooftop pool or just in the lobby areas. If you look confused they jump Right in to ask how they can assist you.   Restaurants - Middle eastern restaurant on the BR level was excellent - we had chicken soup, pigeons stuffed with rice etc. pigeons were a nice surprised with very dark meat but nicely spiced. E had a couple of tajines - but was way too much food for even the four of us.  SUGGESTION - Disclosing the portion size at ordering would help prevent food wastage. We felt bad at how much food we couldn‚Äôt eat. The restaurant on the R level was good for breakfast with representation of varied cultures. Ample types of food for people to decide what to eat. Pool bar - we came later in the day. Rooftop was clean with comfy lounges and couches. We had a couple of cocktails and some nibbles to watch the sun set.  Room COMFORTABLE BED! Slept really well. Soaker tub was appreciated and it helped me to wind down so I could sleep. Spacious bathroom. They stopped by and asked if we needed water. Appreciated  Maybe we can try the spa tomorrow‚Ä¶ Definitely would recommend!‚Ä¶

Had an amazing experience made even more memorable because of hotel staff service . We were checked in at the club lounge which was an experience in itself and the suite was one of the best ones I  had stayed at.  Food in the club lounge was always good and the room service always on time . Mr. Tamar took special care of us and made us feel at home. At front desk n Conceirage Ms. Christen was super kind and helpful and gave insight as to what we must visit and made arrangements for us for our trip to the Pyramids with guide and hotel car. At the pool bar , Mr.Walid Salim took good care of us. All in all from room cleanliness to staff service to club lounge experience, everything was spot on . Also the hotel is right on the nile so great views.

Wonderful experience at the fairmont. Beyond our thoughts expectations. Great attention to details. We also enjoyed the heated sky pool at the fairmont. People are so thoughtful. Thank you Walid, Mahmoud and all other whose names i forgot.

Celebrating my birthday in Cairo. The treatment provided by the rooftop pool bar staff was second to none. The surprise with cake and song was overwhelming,   The hotel standard and service level in general is higher than one could expect   Just a fantastic place to stay and the best choice celebrating the day

Fairmont is the Best hotel to stay in. Outstanding friendly staff. They get you what you need before you even ask. Ola and Ashrakat in the restaurant were amazing and super friendly. We would definitely stay in Fairmont Corniche el Nile on our next visit to Egypt.

Beautiful property. Went swimming on the top floor and had amazing service - especially from Walid. Thank you for making our stay so comfortable! Would come back to stay again the only the future anytime.

The Fairmont Nile city is the best hotel I‚Äôve ever been in!!!!!! The hotel rooms are amazing, the view is good, and the pool is amazingüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄ!!! The buffet has excellent quality!!! and the server, Sunrise, was very very nice! I would highly recommend this hotel!!üòçüëçüëç  Aidan 9 yrs

Sky pool has the best view of Cairo that I‚Äôve seen. Good music, food and helpful staff. Walid Selem, Moustofa and the DJ made our afternoon at the pool very enjoyable. I‚Äôll be back next time I‚Äôm in town.

Wow- what an experience! Came for day-use of the Pool and Sauna and will definitely be staying here when I come back. Wonderful service and incredible gratitude staff. Monica at the spa is so sweet and helpful. Moustafa at the Sky Bar was amazing and shared stories and recommendations with us. Also he makes delicious drinks! Very grateful for the whole experience and will definitely be back. Also not to miss, the best shower of my life in the Cool Mist Experience Shower after hanging by the pool all day.

If you live old world charm, this is the place. The bones are beautiful - a cage elevator, grand front doors,  worn marble steps, balconies, floor to ceiling windows. Lively,and very nicely decorated. Beds are good, great wifi and air con, and conveniently above shops that sell snack and cheap water. Also a great, walkable location (and easy to grab an Uber).  The glassed in bathrooms are a creative solution and quite lovely. But they are really only ideal for people who are okay seeing each other on the toilet. Maybe not for besties, or work colleagues, or your dad.  The arranged driver was lovely and waited when we were delayed at airport. And staff Wafaa deserves to be rewarded for her courtesy, attentiveness, and competence.    The only real downside, and the reason we only enjoyed 1 included breakfast, was being cornered for the hard-sell by owner Mustafa. He wanted to change our current plans and pressed us to go to his other property so he could redesign our whole trip. PUSHY. This was so annoying and rude that we have cancelled our plans to return to this hotel at the end of our trip. Just to avoid this dude. Really too bad.‚Ä¶

The hotel is located very close to Tahrir Square, the Egyptian Museum, and a few other old downtown highlights. While the outside of the building looks slightly dilapidated--clearly beyond the control of the hotel--the entrance to the hotel and the interior is nicely done and inviting. Staff are very kind, helpful, and welcoming. The rooms are spacious and have the essentials. In the dining area, complementary tea and water are on offer throughout the day.  A few drawbacks: the street noise is very clearly heard from within the rooms (windows are not double paned), and Cairenes LOVE to honk for any and all reasons so you'll still feel very in touch with street life even within the hotel. Breakfast is rather mediocre: expect toast, hard boiled eggs, some jam, and a small cup of yoghurt, accompanied by tea or nescafe. The bedsheets are in serious need of updating (they are extremely rough and scratchy, making sleeping difficult). The bathrooms are an afterthought - just a corner in the room cordoned off by half-frosted glass, so it is recommended that you are very comfortable sharing all bodily functions with whomever you share the room. Despite a clear 'no smoking' sign at the front desk, staff still smoke in common areas (entry, dining area). We stayed in the room at the far end of the hallway (there are only six rooms) and could smell the smoke very clearly from inside our room with the door shut. When I went to pay for our room at checkout, one staff member sat directly in front of me smoking. I called him out on it, pointing at the 'no smoking' sign right in front of us, and he apologised profusely and moved away with his cigarette. I am 100% confident he resumed smoking inside as soon as we left.  Some of the basics aren't looked after: the room we were given had no pillowcases on three of our four pillows, and only one towel. The rest of the linens were out at the cleaners, and since there was only one person on staff, we had to stand in for the staff at the front desk so they could run out and pick up the clean linen. Rooms don't come with soap, but we were given a bottle of liquid soap when we asked. Early checkin is USD 25 on top of the regular room charge. The staff offered to arrange a car back to the airport on our departure, quoting a price double of what we paid to get from the airport to the hotel in the first place. It is recommended to just take an Uber instead (EGP 100-125, depending on traffic and time of day). Overall, it's not a bad hotel, and the staff's kindness goes a long way to compensate for the weaknesses noted above.‚Ä¶

As a solo female I loved the location and friendly staff. They quickly made me feel welcome and went above and beyond to help me with any questions I had. This was by far the nicest hotel I stayed at in Egypt. It is a little tricky to locate it but that is the only downside. I hope to return to Cairo and would book here again!

Hotel staff is very friendly. I requested for Airport pick-up, they arranged it. Also I requested before for early morning breakfast and Ms Wafa prepared breakfast on time. Ms Wafa, Mr. Farag and Mr. Elsoky are very good people at Hotel. They also guided me about the city. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Wonderful authentic hotel right in the city center.  Spaceous and very clean.  The owner is a very experianced tourguide himself and very helpful in arranging your tours.  The staff is very friendly and make you feel welcome every minute of your stay.

The Grand Agor was a perfect place for a few days in Cairo.  The staff, although small, is attuned to make your stay enjoyable.  The price is one class up from many of the small hotels downtown, but I found it to be secure and well situated.  You will be a $1 taxi ride from the current Egyptian Museum. Lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. My room was large with a great bathroom and shower, well lit.

We arrived at the hotel around 10.30 am, too early for check-in. Luckily, our room-to-be had been vacated and the bathroom cleaned, so we could use it and head out for a walk. Thanks to Achmed and Mustafa for that.  But I do not understand why they needed another two hours to get the room ready, when they did not even join the beds as we had requested a double bed at the time of booking or keep any towels when we returned close to 13:00. There were only hand/face towels kept, and even on the second day when we asked for bath towels, we got one, and were reluctantly asked, 'Do you need one more, I'll have to get it from the laundry.' Not being sure if he meant washed or unwashed laundry, we let it pass, lol. The shower fluctuates between scalding hot and freezing cold, and the staff tried their best to get it to work but it didn't, even on the second day. Add to it the tiny glass enclosure which they call a bathroom, there's no room to escape the hot and cold water, I almost got burnt! The glass cubicle idea is very weird, the frosting on the glass could have been complete near the toilet area at least! We stayed two nights, and were given two small bottles of water on the first day. When we asked on the second day, we were told it would be charged! When you check-in to a room, the least you expect is a hot shower, towels and water to drink. Sadly these were missing. The Wifi didn't work either. A special shout out to the lady in-charge of the cafe (I think her name is Ms. Wafa), she was very sweet and very efficient. The room itself was furnished well, with a nice wardrobe ideal for long stays. The two-rating is purely for the location and staff, and well the elevator! Grand Agor probably needs to decide if they want to be a hotel or a hostel. They are right now priced like a hotel with amenities like a hostel. There are much better cheaper places to stay in the downtown area, for once the Tripadvisor reviews did not match my experience, and I regret staying here.‚Ä¶

With the relentless chaos in Cairo, it‚Äôs important that you have a peaceful place to rest your head after a long day of exploring the city.   The hotel itself is quite new, which is great as the staff are always looking for feedback. The double room was very spacious with a lovely looking bathroom - unfortunately the hot water wasn‚Äôt too consistent so the showers could have been better. The bed was very comfortable, and there was a TV bracket on the wall but no TV. Unfortunately the WiFi was experiencing some issues during our stay so we didn‚Äôt have a great connection.   The hotel staff are just lovely; breakfast each morning was (as others have said) made with love, and the lovely lady would always offer us a tea or coffee when we were around. She really couldn‚Äôt do enough to take care of the guests and was one of our favourite parts of the hotel.   The location is also great, and central enough that you can pop back to use the toilet/have a coffee/take a breather from the Cairo madness, at any point during the day.   We arranged hotel pick up with the hotel after struggling to get in touch with them. If you do the same, make sure you go outside to meet your driver as only police are allowed inside the airport. Price was 25USD return which is very reasonable.   If we visit Cairo again we would stay at the Grand Agor - definitely recommend it.   The hotel also arranges tours for guests - we took one to the pyramids which was 20USD for both of us. Definitely do this. Avoid he public transport. Giza is hectic and stressful enough without waiting around for a bus! ‚Ä¶

I stayed at Grand Agor with my fiancee for 4 days at Grand Agor and it was the best experience we could have asked for during our whole trip. First off, do not let the entrance to the building where the hotel is distract you, it looks rough at best, but once you are inside the hotel, it is very nice. The staff is the friendliest you can find anywhere in the world, the rooms are wide and comfortable and  you get a feeling like you are staying at your friends house, and not actually at a hotel. Plus its location is very very good, right in downtown, near the museum, metro station, stores, etc. Last but not least the lift is very peculiar, not only is it very peculiar on the way it operates, but has its own theme music when moving, I know this sounds very odd, and it is, but for us it added a very special touch.‚Ä¶

Hotel Grand Agor is like a breath of fresh air from the buzzing city of Cairo. Its prime location in downtown allowed us to move freely in the area by foot or by public transport. Local restaurants were 5 minutes away, so is the Egyptian museum. The staff is super welcoming, professional and helpful. Every morning, our breakfast was made with love, by the lovely caretaker- Mrs Ouafa. Also, our room was spacious and very comfortable. Overall, it was a very nice hotel where price and comfort meets on the same level. We would highly recommend to those who wish to stay abit local and avoid the massive hotel chains.   **the hotel is actually located on the 2nd floor, so don‚Äôt be afraid to use the old lift! It is part of the egyptian experience!**

We were a bit nervous first time in Cairo a new city and new country how is everything going to be? But Ritz Carlton was amazing and gave us a great start to our holiday. I had corresponded with the hotel and requested for connecting rooms. On checkin due to my platinum elite status we were upgraded to connecting rooms facing the Nile, and free breakfast. The rooms were great, location was amazing and breakfast was great. My kids were really happy with all of it. We also got breakfast boxes packed for us. Starting our trip here kicked off our Egypt explorations to a great start. The forums have been so great and we used the Cairo airport shuttle which was seamless to be dropped off at the airport.  The front office staff was always great, especially Mahmoud who checked us in and  the location is really great.‚Ä¶

We spent three amazing nights in the Ritz Carlton. We originally booked city executive suite and were upgraded to Superb Nile view. From the moment you step in you feel welcomed and the service was up to bar. The outstanding staff at the lounge did not reserve a minute to offer help and a very friendly atmosphere. It was so touching that when they realised our love for Mango they prepared a surprising Mango feast for us. It was very touching to us. Noise were not as bad as highlighted in many reviews after all we understand that we are living in the hustle and bustle of cairo city. Ritz Carlton Cairo is among the best I ever stayed in, in terms of pleasant smile and friendliness. I am afraid I might miss some names but every staff we met were top notch. Especially would like to thank Ossama and Asmaa from the lounge, the waiters team in the lounge and cleaning team in 12 floors who kept the room spotless. Thank you all.‚Ä¶

One of the best hotels in Egypt. Love the room, we got upgraded to Junior Suite and it was stunning room with 2 bathrooms and all the modern amenities.   Dinner at pool side restaurant was great! They had good small plates and vegetarian choices. Drinks were also well made.   Best thing was the breakfast. There executive chef came and talked to us personally. Overall I would recommend, little steep price for Egypt but worth it.

Undertrained staff some of which will stop to chat with coworkers while customer waits for spoon, ice, coffee ‚Ä¶ Some that just disappear leaving customer to request another to help. Example - told iced-tea is a special order.  While it is expected that people at local venues may not speak English, it is reasonable to expect staff at the concierge, reception and restaurant should be able to communicate in English.  COVID has left many businesses understaffed,  Ritz-Carlton should be able to procure more experienced employees or at least provide them with better training.

From the reception at check in with Matthew who upgraded us (because we are Marriot Bonvoy Gold elite members) to a perfect room with a view of the Nile where we got to a stunning sunset every night, it was magical. All services from the restaurant and chamber maids, to the chic lounge with delicious desserts, we absolutely loved our stay. Down to the beds and bedding sheets, it was perfect. Thank you The Nile Ritz Carlton for a brilliant stay!! I highly recommended it!!

The hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Cairo direct on the Nile River and a stone throw away from the Egyptian National museum. Many great restaurants and bars are close by and easy reachable within a 5 minute taxi ride. The hotel, rooms and staff were exactly what we expected from a Ritz Carlton Hotel, just perfect.

We stayed here for five nights as part of a larger and longer Egypt trip. We'd certainly start off by saying what a perfect location this property is, right at Tahrir Square and the Egyptian Museum. It's so close as well to many of the hip restaurants around this side of the Nile. The hotel itself is well secured, and the moment you pass through the metal detectors into the lobby, you are greeted by a fantastic Guest Relations team and a wonderful public space on the ground floor. In fact, all of the public areas seem current, well maintained and appointed with everything you would need. However, once we got to the room the story was a little different: we had a junior-suite, overlooking Tahrir Square, and off the bat our A/C was not working properly (specifically, the thermostat was not functioning, no matter what we changed the temperature to there was no change). The room also had an older smell, maybe even a smokey smell that was apparent each time you would walk in. The bathroom were huge and very clean, but had older fixtures with discoloration. Much of the room had this, in fact, with some parts of the ceiling having dry wall cracking and leaving little white crumbs around. Did any of this inhibit our experience? Not really, as the service makes up for it. But it's not exactly what I'd expect from The Ritz-Carlton. I'd like to give a final shout-out to Mina Aziz from Guest Relations: he made sure every request we had was fulfilled and even helped make some special cases work for us. Any future visits to Cairo would still have us staying here over any other option.‚Ä¶

Great location, very secure, wonderful people, the pool is lovely. The gym is large with treadmills, ellipticals, and a plethora of weights and machines. We love a large gym and I will add extra time in the morning for this one. The breakfast is a huge display of every option you could imagine. The lobby piano is a nice way to enjoy their treats. Having a bank on sight helps when getting out cash and change. Enjoy your stay

** POSITIVE ** Firstly the staff were almost excellent, majority of the time were very attentive and assisted with my needs.  Food was a decent spread of international/ local cuisine and promptly served     **NEGATIVE** Now the bad  - ROOM ALLOCATION  Despite me asking around 2/3 times at check-in to have a room away from noise and any events they put me in a room right beneath the top bar.  Consequently every night at around 2AM loud music would reverberate into my room to the sounds of Despacito.  As you can imagine I asked if I could be moved again 2/3 times where they would answer let me get back to you and nothing happened.  For a work trip this is really not acceptable.  Did I also mention as well we saw a mouse run across the lobby!  - THIRD PARTY CHAUFFER On Wednesday last week we hired a car from the hotel from the ‚ÄòMUSTANG COMPANY‚Äô.  I had forgot my wallet in the car getting out which I realised 2 min entering my room.  Upon receiving it back from the driver I noticed all the money had been taken out (USD/AED).  I spoke to the managers Mr Hossam/ Ahmed right away who informed me they would investigate to no avail.    Their rationale it‚Äôs a third party company where there is nothing they can do.  Whilst I understand it would be very hard to prove, this is the RITZ not a 2 star BNB and they should use reputable providers.  In my 14 years travelling for work I‚Äôve never had anything like this which is a real shame.  Its important to highlight the facts above in case there are any other travellers who have experienced the same.‚Ä¶

Great view of the Nile and wonderful staff.  Nighttime view is amazing.  Rooms are spacious and clean.  Go see Ahmed at Bar‚ÄôOro his attention to detail and service was the highlight of our day!!  And, Mixologist Shenouda was excellent with the custom craft cocktails

I was there for 2 weeks. I am a black African man, I was with my black African female and white female colleague. The treatment me and my black female colleague was terrible. During breakfast, the staff in the cafeteria gave us mean glimpse, and did not serve us well. There is a waiter called Osman who was very mean. The hotel is nice but the staff are not nice to black people, our white colleague was treated well most of the time. For that reason, one star from me.

Very good palce & decorations but they have the worst staff and Mistreatment starting from the receptionist to the waiters  They treated us in a very bad way that makes us leave the place at once  We will never go there again its not our first experience in this place

We ended our Egyptian tour in this hotel. It is in a green area with plenty of villas, quiet and peaceful, a relief to busy and dusty Cairo. It is fournished Laura Ashley style, and makes you realy nostalgic. We hoped to enjoy one of the two swimming pools and take a last sunbeam, but in this time of the year the pools are both in the shadow. We took diner in the evening in the beautiful garden near the pool. The food was delicious, but they don't have a wine card. They don't serve alcoholic drinks, but customers are allowed to bring bottles from outside the hotel, we saw several regulars with their own bottle at the table. Minus was the next morning, as we had to take an early flight and our breakfast was included in the price, I agreed with the staff in the lobby that they would bring it in the room before our departure. Only they brought us to bags to take in the taxi, not very comfortable. We left the bags untouched for the taxi driver.‚Ä¶

Most beautiful place! Attention to detail in the design is matched by the attention to great customer service and delicious food. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there and will definitely stay there again in the future.

We came here as a group of 7 on Christmas day and had a wonderful time. We all selected from the Christmas menu and made our choices a few days before coming. The food was excellent and service really attentive without being obtrusive. I can highly recommend.

We had our wonderful breakfast here. Everything is delicious, professionally served, you‚Äôre surrounded with greens and nice people ) I saw some nice vegan and vegetarian options at the menu, so definitely we‚Äôll return here again for dinner

I chose the hotel for the convenience to where I was going to be working. The hotel is in a very nice part of Cairo, hard to reconcile the lushness here with the normal Egyptian scenery of sand dunes and camels. There are various embassies and institutes nearby and a big police presence which was reassuring The hotel itself is a colonial residence and quaint. Certainly, very different from the chains. The ambience within is that of a boutique hotel with friendly and helpful staff. I was very happy with my room and the amenities. My only quibble was the wi-fi and not particularly comfortable work conditions The outside seating area is lovely to sit out the sunset. The pool is small but nice, but is in the dining area, and so you have limited access if you are working, so I had to make sure to return early to make use of it. Many of the reviews mention the food.  Out of necessity I are there all 3 nights I stayed. I found the food to be mediocre. I later stayed in other hotels nearby and found some brilliant places to eat and regret I was not more adventurous when I stayed at the Belle Epoque If I was being a tourist and not working, I would certainly recommend this hotel‚Ä¶

I seldom write reviews. But I saw the mix bag of reviews for Belle Epoque, I felt the need to chime in.  I am not a big hotel kind of a traveler. So, when I booked the flights to Cairo, I started looking. This was the only (or the only nice looking) boutique hotel I found. Some friends warned me Egypt doesn't do boutique hotels well, and yes, the reviews freaked me out a bit. But I couldn't bring myself to book one of those chain hotels... so I took a gamble.  It paid off. Really paid of!  The neighborhood is tree-filled, lush green, relaxed and quiet residential area loved by embassies and posh locals. Lots of nice restaurants, cafes, shops within walking distance. Locals told me they walk everywhere in this neighborhood. Many also told me they often come to Belle Epoque  for the pool, or for lunch.  You may spend your day in the hustle bustle of busy chaotic Cairo doing tourists stuff, so why not pick the most laid back beautiful villa to go back to relax at night? I loved Cairo, and I am definitely coming back. And when I am coming back, I will definitely stay here again.  PS: beautifully decorated spacious rooms, nice and friendly staff. ‚Ä¶

Must visit excellent service super delicious food authentic historic ambiance. An experience not to be missed i would definitely go again. I Would mostly recommend it for breakfast or brunch. Very good coffee as well.

I am always researching where fo stay in Egypt as I offer tours in this beautiful country- this is the best in Cairo! A perfect colonial, nostalgic experience with dining to match!  The decor, swimming pool, gardens, sitting rooms and balconies all remind us of times gone by! This is a place to relax in style. The area is also high class so local Egyptians will dine here. Possibly the best food I have eaten in Egypt!

You can get 4 start above service from this place with lower price than others. The front desk receptionist and waiter to bring my breakfast(Awesome Egypt style) are very kind and helpful. Mine is a very clean room with black curtain so that I can sleep well. There is a socket converter for international traveler as well thought it‚Äòs a bit ropey.  As for cons, it locates at a construction zone so it can be dusty and noisy. Wifi sometimes can be slow and unstable. Power also went outage occasionally but it seems to be a problem for other hotels in this area too.

Service is very good, Staff very co operative, Mohammad Salim good nature person and all staff very friendly. Very clean, Highely recommended. Breakfast is gery good, Mohammed usama Hossam Sameh Assam

I had to stay a week in Cairo due to side tasks I had to fulfill at the GUC. This hotel offered everything I needed, it's close to GUC, the room was clean and it's reasonable priced. Due to my tasks at GUC i had to carry the breakfast time several times and also adjusted the breakfast itself several times. My sister's were always fulfilled as fast and accurate as possible. Thank you for the pleasant stay.

It was a pleasant stay here at Arabella residence. The Staff here are very friendly and present all the time. The morning bfast is much refreshing. Overall it was a wonderful time and I would recommend those prefer to visit Egypt to stay at Arabella residence.

The worst place to stay in Tagamo3 in worth of price and cleanness. I will never visit again. The furniture was broken, the bed not comfortable. The toilet not cleaned and you should ask for the amenities. The electric not stable.

The rooms are clean and the bathroom is clean and everything is good and I love it and my family loves the place too and the service is good and the beds make me sleep in like 5 mins and I thing it‚Äôs sooo worth trying

Fantastic say and staff, extended my stay from 2 days to 8. Staff are all welcoming and supportive throughout my whole stay. Extremely professional. Hotel is clean and very well equipped. I‚Äôve stayed in numerous amounts of hotel in Egypt, and this is by far the best, I am not from this country came god holiday from London. All speak very well English, and very accommodating. Definitely a place to recommend locals and tourists.

The team was great and also the value for money, Mohammad Osama, husam and Bader they were very professional and I will refer this hotel to all my friends who need a reasonable stay that is near all facilities including the airport

it was amazing to stay here  it was my marriage and we spend a very comfortable couple of nights  every time we will visit cairo we will stay here  thanks for the staff thanks for every one  Khaled jad  best wishes

I stayed in single bedroom for two weeks and the room was nice and service was good. The room was large enough. I had good Wi-Fi connection too. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The place is in the middle of new cairo and it was near from restaurants and malls.

This 3 star hotel we stayed in was for a night because our other hotel that we had booked in was not available for one night only dueing our trip, to cut it short the day of check out we had gone out in the morning to have breakfast and when we came back to check out we came to know that both of us friends who were in two different rooms had some money missing from our saftey box as we randomly counted them before leaving. Anyways the duty manager there did nothing to help he said that he checked the cameras in corridors and no one had entered our rooms. To cut it short my rooms safe box at my arrival was not working and when i asked the receptionist to get it fix he came with a box full of keys and had reset it and left and the sexond day this happened.  Even the taxi we had asked to pick us took us directly to the way to airport while we hadn‚Äôt told them too so when we asked him he is going to the wrong way he said that the guy at the hotel said you are going to the airport as i think they thought we are going back home to our country.  This is just a bad experience but definitely true as we both friends in different rooms got some money missing from our saftey box.  Please be careful thats is my message.‚Ä¶

Excellent value for money. The hotel is located in the Zamalek district, in an area well connected to the points of interest of the city and at the same time a quiet area. the breakfast was good and with excellent pastries

The hotel is in a good location and the room was clean, the bed comfortable. If you ask, you can get eggs cooked fresh for breakfast.  However, I requested a superior room because the room details stated that superior rooms have a balcony, and mine did not. This was very disappointing since this was the only reason I requested a superior room. Instead, it had a kitchenette which is strange and made it feel like a self contained apartment rather than a superior room in a hotel. I would have been better off with a regular room. Not long after I arrived, after waiting almost an hour past checkin time as the room was not ready, foul smelling water poured from an outlet under the sink, although I had not turned on the tap. The maintenance man did not listen when I explained where the water was coming from and that I had not turned on the tap, and instead fixed what would have been another problem had I done so, the broken pipe leading from the sink to the outlet above where the water came from. He also fixed a blockage which may have temporarily solved the mystery water issue. A young man came and carefully mopped the floor with antiseptic and clean water, but the smell lingered in the kitchenette for the duration of my stay, which fortunately was only one night.  When I went to have a shower I found the hot water was barely lukewarm, not matter how long I let the tap run for. There was no hot water in this room the entire stay.  Overall, it was overpriced for what I got, even for Zamalek.‚Ä¶

Compared to the general offer in the region it was quite good. Very well located, useful help desk and attentive staff. They offer private driver service, useful for tours and transfer to airport. I walked around Zamalek and the location of it really helps. Rooms are clean and comfortable.

gd for business, just to sleep and take a shower. take some business calls.  nice restaurants and hangout slots around. centrally located in zamalek area where lot of activities can be done, nt value for money.

Stayed here for 5 nights and absolutely loved this hotel. The room was clean and spacious and the bathroom was also really clean. The staff were so friendly and kind and went out of their way to help us with everything. The location of the hotel was perfect - there is a Starbucks and McDonald‚Äôs in walking distance. There is a bank to exchange money nearby and lots of cute little cafes too. The area is really safe and we would often go out late in the evening and had no issues. Would definitely recommend staying here.

There are more pros than cons about this little hotel. The location is fantastic and in the heart of Egypt‚Äôs finest neighborhood, Zamalek. Within a walking distance, you will find countless shops, restaurants, coffeeshops, supermarkets and pharmacies. Literally everything you will ever need.  The hotel has some nice bars and restaurants. For a hotel this size, I was surprised they have some good options for a drink or a meal.  The room is small but very clean and you wouldn‚Äôt need it much if you are planning to move around.   Staff are generally very helpful and polite which is again something you might not find in 5-star hotels around Cairo.  Now when it comes to the cons of this hotel. It will be the elevator which is very slow and tiny so if the hotel is busy, you will suffer a bit.  Also, there‚Äôs no soundproofing system so you can hear everything happening next door but the managers were very supportive to control this.  I will definitely be staying here again.‚Ä¶

180$ per night for a very small normal room !!  No breakfast included!  Booked at this hotel for 3 nights, when I reached the hotel and saw how small and normal the room is for such fee, I went directly to the reception and told them I wanna cancel the reservation cz It‚Äôs not what I expected. They said okay no prob but there is a cancellation fee which is 122$, so If you want you can stay the night and pay the fee so you won‚Äôt lose it.  We stayed me and my friend, the second day they come and say we need 67$ more !!!  So basically the room is for 190$ (more than its own price) !!!!!!!!

We stayed for one month back in May, and honestly wish we will return soon. President Hotel is so great! The rooms are spotless, modern, clean.  All the porters and cleaning staff are really nice people. Not to mention the hotel has such good bars also Monkey abar and grill and Cairo cellar, busy every night!  The terrace restaurant on the 11th floor is amazing with great views. We tried almost everything on the menu, and it's all fresh and tasty. Staff attentive and nice too.  Would highly recommend this hotel. Located in a nice area of zamalek and 5min walk to yamama shopping centre and pub 28

The staff are so friendly and attentive. Very well priced Delux Studio (including a kitchenette) which is great for short and longer trips. Super comfy bed, lots of work and desk space plus a little dining table in the room. The WiFi works well enough for online work and is great considering it is free. Nice location with coffee shops and supermarkets within walking distance. Would definitely stay again and just extended my stay as it's so lovely!

to the main resturant it was perfect as well as the cafe was good the staff was good also the pool was good indian resturant also was very good location malllVery nice hotel i spent my vacation there i went

The hotel is more than wonderful in Terms of cleanliness and other things. My experience in the main restaurant ‚Äúwindows‚Äù with breakfast is varied, delicious and fresh. The treatment of the staff is very hospitable and helpful. There is also a wonderful restaurant in the hotel devoted to Indian food ‚Äúindira‚Äù. This made me sensitive to the Indian dishes and their good flavor.  Spatial thanks to the front office team for the good reception and quick accommodations.

This hotel was very good in everything i liked the food it was delicious and amazing the buffet was perfect and the restaurant staff are smiling every time please keep on  rooms need some renovations  your perfect  job

One of the best hotels with the best hospitality, service and has one of the best locations in cairo.   I Loved my stay overthere and would definitely back in the near future. Room was so clean and food was really nice.

The hotel was perfect my stay was amazing i liked the hotel staff and the rooms were perfect swimming pool was clean and the staff was very helpful i will recommended this hotel to my friends and colleagues thank you for everything

Everything was good restaurant staff in the reception was good as well as the Indian restaurant staff was amazing the location near to mall also near to the airport the service was very good overall good üëç

the hotel is perfect for everything I liked the hotel staff specially the pool and gym and the front office team specially karim mohamed from concierge .the hotel location was perfect and very close to the mall and the Airport too ..

Have a lovely stay  Hotel stuff is very friendly Hotel is clean and rooms are big and clean The food in the restaurant is very tasty Great experience so i hope i came very soon  Great thankful for Mostafa and Micheal

I stayed there for business it was perfect, very close to the Airport, and the room it was very clean most key places in the city, and with a direct connection to the Mall. Thank you so much to all the team there; especially karim Mohamed AND Ramadan Youssif at the Concierge.  less

it was amazing i was very happy and the staff was very polite and smiley they help me in everything i needed, especially Karim Mohamed from front desk he was very helpful,and the room it was good and the restaurants too food is very testy

Stayed there for one night and need to overnight due to an early morning flight. Hotel is just 10 mins drive to airport in a nice and quite area.  Next to hotel is a mall but is kind of miserly now  as it almost close with a  couple of shops still open...  Room was nice, clean, big and very nice decorates.  had dinner and breakfast there and both were ok.

Great hotel service! Very clean rooms and the staff were very friendly. The place is quite. I recommend this hotel for family staying. Personally I did not enjoy the breakfast but it wasn‚Äôt very bad. I would definitely go back to Gabriel hotel if I visit Cairo again :)

This review is regarding day use at the Gabriel hotel pool.  I have been here more than 20 times for day use and ive spent the night 4 times and used to be a big fan. But since Andrew left its gone down the toilet. First of all we booked through the whatsapp booking. They asked for photo i.d of all my friends that wanted to come. Kind of ridiculous. Then they wanted all our facebook accounts. Presumably to check we dont look ugly or poor. Again ridiculous, this is a swimming pool not Studio 54. We are two couples in our 30s40s. We should not have to show a stupid social media presence to enter a pool. On arrival they told us that the reservation was to reserve attendance not to reserve sunbeds. That's not what a reservation is. So there were no umbrellas left and not enough sunbeds for our group (3 present and 2 joining later). There was one double bed left right next to the showers and speakers - least desirable spot. We asked for a spare sunbed to be bought over and put beside our bed as we are a group of 5. They refused. Said it was too difficult and just kept repeating "no way" because according to the obnoxious attendance the beds fit 7 people. The bed was the width of 3 pillows meaning if three people laid side by side like sardines they could fit, but not comfortably. I can guarantee no egyptian woman would be expected to be 7 to a sunbed but screw the white chicks they can suck it up? After an extended argument they put a sunbed next to the double bed which was no difficulty at all. We then asked for the spare umbrella but they refused saying the umbrellas that were ironically on wheels could not be moved. We had driven a long way so chose to stay, but without any shade we left after 3 hours. We would have liked to spend the day - the hottest day of the year so far. Its also important to mention that the dj blasts annoying house music too loud. They wont turn it down. This has been a problem on another visit when we were the only family at the pool and they still wouldnt turn it down a fraction. We couldn't talk  side by side without shouting.  Also on another visit when we had to be vetted on our facebook to make sure we were not scumbags there were people so ridiculously drunk they vomitted in the pool. We reported it to the waiter who went over to have a word and walked away with their drinks order! Its gotten gradually worse, but this visit really was the limit. Wouldnt recommend to anyone.‚Ä¶

First of all, this isn‚Äôt a 5 stars hotel!!!! It‚Äôs just a small hotel (arround 25 rooms) without buffet breakfast, broken cheap-fancy furniture, and minimum cleaning.   The hotel itself is a party for Egiptian people: starting in the pool (where you can‚Äôt simply relax because of the noise of ‚Äúthe music‚Äù - arabian reggeton‚Ä¶ later on the party continues in the ‚Äúrestaurant area‚Äù which is exactly in the middle of the hotel, so you can easily hear the excesively loud music from your room till very after the midnigth‚Ä¶  The breakfast is poor, and defficient quality. People attending the tables don‚Äôt speak english, and what you get isn‚Äôt frequently what you really ordered.  We choosed this hotel because of it‚Äôs nearby the airport, and it‚Äôs side by side to a big shopping mall (SunCity) which is mostly dead (5 floors and only very very few shops open).  Deffinetly I do not recommend this property unless you are looking for bad rest, egiptian partys all the time, bad food and a barely dead surrounding.  FAR, VERY FAR FROM A 5 STARS‚Ä¶ run away!‚Ä¶

Loved the Gabriel Miami!! Let me first start by saying customer service is superb! The minute We pulled up  to the property We were greeted at the car with the bell man waiting to collect our bags and guide us to the front desk. Izzy who works at the front desk, had everything ready and waiting for our arrival, she was 10 steps ahead lol and I can appreciate that. Thank you Izzy!! They try their best to accommodate your requests. 5/5 for customer service and staff. Cleanliness of the room 5/5 and comfort 5/5. Did not like that the bar was close for the nights we stayed there so that really was our only con about our stay. I definitely recommend the Gabriel, two thumbs up!

Myself and family stayed at this hotel before returning home from the airport. It was fabulous, rooms clean and a great size. Check-in seamless. Staff really helpful. Would have liked to have stayed for a couple of days really. Sadly didn't manage to try the restaurant.

Oh my God! How to start!? First of all this hotel is definitely not a 5 star hotel. It is in a very bad location, the view of the rooms are just not finished construction sites, it is beside a decadent shopping mall, far far away from the city. The room itself with stained bed linen, all the water from the faucets were dark brown, hairs in the pillows, stains in the carpet.  There was also a party in the main restaurant with loud music that we could listen in our rooms. Horrible!

Came to Miami with my family for the first time ever! The rooms were very spacious and accommodating. Our check in was very smooth we didn't even have to wait Gaston was very nice and gave us our room even if we were a bit early. I would like to thank Jane the concierge in specifically she was very sweet and went above and beyond with arranging transportation and setting us up for a boat ride.  Overall satisfied with the amenities! The pool is awesome.

The staff was great and welcoming since I first arrived. I had to stay an extra nights in Cairo to wait for my PCR test so this was a great last minute find. The front desk help me set up my PCR test and were very helpful overall. Mohamed Salama gets a personal shout out because he took the time to show me around the mall that is connected to the hotel and even bought me some coffee! I appreciate the hospitality from all here! Thank you!

We had an overnight in Cairo with an early departure. This excellent hotel is part of a Supermall in the up n coming section of ‚ÄúNew Cairo‚Äù. It allows some window shopping, as many stores are empty, where the affluent Egyptians partake and has an interesting food court if the two restaurants remain closed as during our stay.  15 minutes taxi from airport and an interesting location for those not interested in venturing into Cairo, it combines top notch service with an eclectic and curious ambiance. All the comforts and conveniences you have likely missed during your Egypt tour, await you here. We missed out on the restaurant review as it was closed for a private event (unusual) but the room service was excellent and delicious.

Wonderful place in the very center of the City. In a nice 1900 Italian style building, a soulful "pensione" furnished with taste with vintage furniture and kept with a lot of care by the same owner for 50 years and her staff, always available. Spacious rooms with high ceiling and hardwood floor, each one has its own decoration and spirit, some with balconies with columns. Many different configurations available, just ask: with AC or ceiling fan (we tried both, fan was enough even in summer), with or without shower and toilets in the the room (but the communal bathrooms are also very clean), all with at least a sink, single, double, double + single bed for families, on the street (vibrant city vibe) or on the back lane (very quiet). Very clean, comfortable and functional. Same for the communal spaces, large TV salon and dining room. Possible to order lunch and dinner too. Great vintage atmosphere, a lot of charm, an experience out of time‚Ä¶

I've been here for a couple of weeks in February 2021 with the Covid-19 pandemic still ongoing. I stayed here previously in 2006. The place has not changed much except for it now has WiFi. The Internet was quite fast. One of the reasons I chose the Roma was because it has rooms with balconies or windows you can open. Ventilation is critical during pandemics so that is not to be sneezed at. (Pun intended.)   The other great thing is the staff here are very helpful but they are not trying to sell you tours. They helped me with getting my pre-flight PCR test and getting a reliable early morning driver for my BJJ lessons.   A few tips.   Mosquitoes are a fact of life in budget hotels in Cairo. There is a pharmacy/chemist nearby where you can get spray on repellent. Once I did that I had a better night sleep.   Traffic noise and the Mosques are loud. If you are a light sleeper get earplugs.  Uber and Careem drivers are difficult to find in before 0700. If you have to go somewhere early ask the staff to recommend a cab driver.   This probably doesn't apply for most. If you want Brazilian Jiu Jitsu lessons Google "Anubis Martial Arts Cairo". üòÄ  I'll be back again.‚Ä¶

Very loud neighborhood, had to wear ear plugs and play white noise on my phone in order to sleep. Mosquitos inside. But friendly and helpful staff, good price, high ceilings, adequate space in room and decent bed.

This central Cairo hotel is  very comfortable with old world charm. The lovely staff are all professional and friendly, very happy to take the time to help with any requset. The exterior of the building belies the clean calm comfort within. I met and mixed with fellow guests in the dining room at breakfast and in the lounge room at night. A twenty minute walk to the museum.

Pension Roma is our favourite hotel in Cairo and the place we always go back to when in the city. I almost feel bad not wanting to try any other hotel in Cairo. From the first day we fell in love with the hotel, it's perfectly preserved in time, from the moment you step into the old building, the elevator, a gem of the old days. I think there is a recently remodelled area which is also great but I just fell in love with the original, more 'vintage' area.  We always choose the same room which is very big, clean, and comfy with a sink and closet. The bathroom is always kept squeaky clean. The common areas-- dining room and living room-- are just mesmerizing;  you feel in early XX century Cairo. The breakfast is always a joy, such a nice atmosphere to plan your day or write some notes.  The price is very good, honestly one of the best price-quality in the world. The staff  is truly 5 stars. Always helpful and very nice. They even do their best and give us the room we like! We also met the owner and she is such a nice lady.   The location is just great as  it is sooo central you can walk to Tahrir and the museum, Islamic Cairo, Jezirah... pretty much anywhere in central Cairo is no more than 15 minutes walking distance. There is a metro station about 4 minutes walking where you can go to Giza for a couple EP and  then take a local bus straight to the pyramids. Lots of yummy options to eat around, you are in the heart of downtown Cairo.‚Ä¶

This hotel is very nice, the guy in the reception is very friendly.  I love the cleanliness, I couldnt find a room with a bathroom, I was worried from the shared toilet but they surprised me as it is very clean.  Youssef also is a friendly, helpful and let u feel like home

We stayed once again at Pension Roma, with a group of friends and family members. It was great as ever. I don't know how many times I have stayed there during the past 20 years - quite often. Nothing ever changes. The staff is lovely, all is clean, all works efficient.Maybe they could change some matresses or pillows every up and then but that is all. We stayed for a week and really liked it. Also my friends who traveled to Cairo for the first time with us.  We will be back later during the year.. Looking already forward to.

Not all old is gold. The Windsor hotel for instance is a mummified relic of the past. But here at Pension Roma there's friendly service, huge rooms, spotless cleanliness, and real service. (For instance, my bed was made up every day - *with* the extra blanket I needed, as requested.)  The pension is perhaps a little faded. One of the toilets is temperamental when it comes to refilling the cistern, mosquitoes get everywhere (though that may be true of the whole of Cairo), and breakfast is basic (request Turkish coffee if you need a kickstart). The lift has its little tantrums, too. And the downside of a location close to Ataba station and downtown Cairo is that it can be pretty noisy.   But Madame is elegant and keeps her staff honest and hard working. The TV room is a good place to meet other guests and the TV provides CNN, BBC and al-Jazeera in English. Wifi is free and works 90% of the time (staff are always happy to reboot the router). The laundry is impeccable; my linen shirts came back pressed, spotless, and most important, with all their buttons :- ) And tea at 15 Egyptian pounds for a big pot is available all hours.   This is just my kind of place; not so posh I feel I need to dress up, not so down at heel I feel grimy, and good value for money.‚Ä¶

We stayed there for six nights and couldn't be happier with the place. The staff and owner are sweet, welcoming and very efficient. With high ceilings, well chosen vintage furniture, the pension is full of timeless charm. It's ideally located in downtown Cairo, yet it's very quiet during the night.  Wholeheartedly recommended!

Ezzat, Yassin, A‚Äôid, Ahmet are still working at the pension. It is still as welcoming as ever. It‚Äôs lost a wee bit of charm over the years.  We had a problem with mosquitos in our room. My 4yo had 15 bite marks on his face alone, 25-30 more on his arms and legs. Nearly the same for my wife and our 5yo boy.   The building is also under construction and there is a LOT of jackhammering starting at 7am going on until evening time.   The water is still as difficult as ever to adjust and water pressure stinks. If they could fix the showers it would be soooo much better.   It‚Äôs sadly fallen off our radar as we have kids who love to bathe. That and the mosquito issue.   If you‚Äôre a seasoned traveler without kids, then give it a try. It‚Äôs gotten a bit pricey, $20-38USD, but still better than some other options in the area.‚Ä¶

Mixed feelings with this place. Good location with comfortable bed and a convenient airport pick up. That said the floor blackened our feet, the curtains had a strange smell and without a shower curtain or mat the small bathroom always had a wet floor. The pictures I think are very dated as the common seating area has seen a lot of traffic, is dusty, uncomfortable and not a pleasant place to have the breakfast of bread, jam and cheese.  Thanks for the vote if you found this review helpful.

Perfect location in the middle of the city centre. People are very friendly and helpful with kind hospitality. The rooms are simple but all clean. Very nice place to find your way in the chaotic cairo city centre.

Right in the heart of the chaos of Cairo.  Good accommodation provided for the price that was paid.  The room and shared bathroom were clean and everything worked as it should.  There are heaps of great places to eat close by the hotel and the staff can offer suggestions on where to try.  The included breakfast was basic but adequate.  The included wi-fi was a bit hit and miss but this was the same all over Egypt.  The staff were professional and friendly.  They had offered us free pick up from the airport but unfortunately when we arrived there was no one there to meet us.  Apparently they organised it for the wrong time.  We booked a tour of Giza through them for a reasonable price.  All in all we were happy with the service provided and would stay here again.

We had a 3-day stay at this hostel after reading many great reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel staff were knowledgeable about the area and were able to recommend some favourite local restaurants. I wasn't too keen on having a shared bathroom, but the rooms with a private bathroom were sold out when we booked.  The room was clean and simple when we arrived. There was an armoire for us to store our clothing. The A/C had a bucket to collect drips underneath, but this was never a problem. There were two shared bathrooms to use and they were kept clean and stocked with toilet paper. During our stay, we never had issues with the bathrooms being occupied when we needed them. The common room has books to borrow, and satellite TV, but no A/C. Despite our room overlooking a busy street (during Ramadan), we didn't find the noise to be too loud. Unlimited fresh towels were provided, and Wifi is free (and signal strength good) in all rooms.  You can't beat the hotel location. It is so central that you don't need a taxi to visit the shopping district (July 26th street and Ataba Market), many restaurants, and several attractions (Tahrir Square, Museum, Nile Corniche). The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Ramses Train Station which was very convenient for us.‚Ä¶

For the low budget, this hostel is very good. Their rooms and bathrooms are basic and also clean.  The owner and his staffs are all good people to talk to. And they are willing to help and give advice on anything relating to having a good time in Cairo or Egypt.  They can arrange airport transfers and if you book atleast a certain number of nights, you will get a free transfer.   Location wise is in downtown, busy area and don't have to worry about safety late at night as the area is always filled with people. You can hear traffic from the room, so prepare earplugs if you are a light sleeper.  There are lots of restaurants to eat at and there is a confectionery right opposite the hostel.  I got a free upgrade to a room with 4 beds and attached bathroom despite booking for single bed shared bathroom.  In all, I recommend this hostel for budget travellers.‚Ä¶

As titled, I spent 3 separated nights in travelers house, it just made me be like at home. The host Adel and the staff Jasmine are super kind and helpful.  Jasmine is not just a worker there but becomes one of my best foreign friends, she took me to the famous traditional Koshary restaurant and even cooked for me the night before I left.    This is not a high-class hotel, but definitely a warm place if you want to make some friends and take rest.  The location is also very nice, you can easily grab the best dessert downstairs because the best El Abd is just across the street from travelers house.  It only takes around 10-15 mins by walk to the museum as well.  The only thing I would expect more is that they can refinish the room if they plan to make something different.  Some of the furnitures and facilities are not quite new.  But for a backpacker like me, this is still a nice place to stay.‚Ä¶

I booked this hostel based on reviews, and for once i was disappointed I have stayed in hostels before and have had better experiences  Pros Free wifi Great staff Centrally located Great communication via email Free airport pick up one way Price  Cons You enter the hostel via an old run down building in downtown The hostel has to be accessed by an old lift We had an ensuite room, there was a depression in the floor of the room, which was a hint of structural issues Peeling plaster off walls The bedsheets had holes in them The room was unclean, carpets dirty Bathroom unclean, no toilet paper either  We spent a few hours and rebooked another hotel. We explained to the staff that it was not personal and they said the cleaning lady had not been for a few days and they could sort out the cleaning for us. This hostel has great potential if they can sort out these issues‚Ä¶

One of my favorite spots of the city is this hostel !  The staff treats their guests not only like guests but also like friends. They speak good English and can help you with everything (sightseeing tips, tours ...) You can always have a seat in the  "living room" and share your interests with other people. The hostel is in the center of down town and you can reach everything easily by taxi or metro.  Don't hesitate to ask for what ever you need, they will help you in any case. Adel, Yasmin, Maghed, Sam ... Thank you for everything, I'll definitely come back !

We just loved everything about it... The staff , the room and their hospitality . You cant ask for more with such a value deal.  These guys are so friendly that you really feel like you are in home rather than hostel or hotel. Adel n we chatted till late hours and i have to admit he is a really nice guy and a good friend to me. will definitely visit this place whenever i get a chance to come to cairo again.

Travelers house hotel always has central located and good price for sure. I think I don't have to repeat it again. But the most important thing is Maged, he is a super friendly guy, you will find a lot of fun with him after say hi when you check in. This hotel and Maged is a great reason to force me come back Cairo next time. Why not book it now?

Nice hotel  for the price we paid, and with good location, close to shopping, the Nile river and  food , the  room was clean , and service was good, only bad thing , the most important one, - the sa.. didn"t work,

Price is reasonable for what you get. Location is great. near Tahrir square.  Room is large and clean with a refrigerator and well cool A/C. shower and toilet room was clean and maintained. Towels felt a bit overused.  Breakfast is large and includes bread, vegetables, cheese, deserts, drinks, eggs and more. We enjoyed it. Stuff is English speaking and ready to help. Wifi signal was stable and work well at the lobby but in our room (9th  floor) the signal was weak and not stable.

¬†I had to get to room number three before I could say it was habitable for a human being. The first room had major water damage, the second room had mold and fungus all over the bathroom (see attached pics). A staff member told me "we are aware of the issues with the upper floors" yet they try to pass them off to customers anyway. Also, the hotel may accept foreigners but it doesn't cater to them - forget about getting a drink of anything with alcohol in it, and forget about even getting a glass to your room if you plan to self-cater. The hotel only has plastic and paper disposable dixie cups ! They have no ice buckets and the best I could get was a plastic bag full - the place has no class of any kind. I'd suggest the nearby Sheraton or a chain hotel that would not be thinking so regionally. I wouldn't stay there again, sorry.‚Ä¶

I will make it simple and put the pros and cons of staying in this 3 star hotel.  Pros: Perfect location in the middle of Midan Tahrir with a magnificent view of the square from my room window  Friendly staff from the reception to the restaurant and housekeeping. Large room and electric kettle and bottled water supplied daily. The hotel is connected to La Poire one of Cairo's better known cafes.  Cons: Rooms are tired and in desperate need of renovation with stained carpets. The bathroom leaked from both the sink and the shower. The drain in the shower didn't work and flooded the bathroom everytime I took a shower. Breakfast was basic and tasteless.  This hotel is not  cheap for the mediocre quality it offers  and  needs renovation soon. Just to add that the clientele was mainly Arab from various Arab countries with some Westerners and Africans.‚Ä¶

Staff needs urgent training. Aside from one person in the reception, the others were terrible. The one who greeted me in was unwelcoming. After taking my passport information and charging my card, he got a personal phone call and he stepped away leaving me there standing for several minutes without any information from the room or other. When he came back, he rudely said that the bellman would guide me to the room. Staff definitely needs urgent training on manners, politeness and being welcoming in general. Breakfast was terrible. Don't bother to book this hotel with breakfast (they offer a pre-packaged version that is not fresh at all). It is better to go to the small cafe place on the corner that provides excellent options.

Loved staying in this hotel, great location, next to Egyptian museum, Tahrir square, Nile and downtown, big reception area, security@scanning at the entrance, friendly staff, spacious rooms, nice bathrooms,comfy beds, plenty of storage, clean, AC (heater in winter), couldn't have breakfast because of early departure, got our breakfast packed in nice silver boxes to take away, that was a nice touch:) I think it's generally hard to find quiet room in city like Cairo, so yes, always more or less noise from streets, but we got used to that during our stay there.

This hotel is wonderful! Situated downtown near the Tahrir Square. Walking distance to markets, places to eat, museum, the Nile, etc. The hotel has 24 hour security and scanning at the entrance. Reception is very helpful. Complimentary breakfast is a large buffet of options. Rooms are clean, bathrooms are nice, and the AC works well. Fully recommend staying here.

Worse hotel i have ever seen very dirty rooms, not ready water leakage, very dirty wimdows very dirty refrigerator (with pictures) tv was not working i cleaned and prepared my room with the staff that some of them dont put mask very noisy very bad service employee very rood specially the kid in the reception he shouted on me as if he gave me the room for free!!! In addition they didnt let my friend enter to my roon although he is in the same hotel Worst hotel ever!!!

This hotel is in the heart of Cairo city, and therefore comes with very noisy rooms DAY AND NIGHT as main streets and traffic are around.   Friendly staff, who - I have to say- do not expect tips every time they serve you (which is very rare in Egypt)   Mediocre hotel: -Breakfast is very good -Rooms are ok if you don‚Äôt mind to sleep on firm mattresses -Pillows are not the best -Towels are very rough and scratchy  -I found a hair on one of a shampoo bottles from a previous customer - No hair conditioner - No slippers - Spacious dated rooms - Clean, but not spotless - Bathroom has mold  - Room keys have to be replaced every time you close your room and go out. And every time I get to the hotel at night, I go first to the reception to make sure I have access to my room. It‚Äôs not only me who had this issue! The entire group I‚Äôm with suffered from not working keys. - taxis and Uber know the hotel well.. so no hassle getting back to the hotel -Internet not good if you plan to work or make video calls. It‚Äôs only ok for sending messages or requesting an Uber   Luckily, I can sleep in noise, but for those of you who need quietness to sleep, stay away  ‚Ä¶

The hotel is located in down town near the Egyptian museum, so it is easy to walk to many places, and the price of the hotel is good enough for the budget travelers, but I had a very bad experience when I booked a tour to the pyramids with them, because the guide Husam, who made my dream to visit Egypt a nightmare, he is very pushy and very greedy, and when he finally figured out that I am a budget traveler he ignored me and didn't give me enough information about the history and the culture of the country,and he started talking to the driver instead of talking to me,  after we finished the tour he asked me for tip, but I didn't  because I didn't enjoy the tour,and the funny thing is that he told me that the hotel charge so much for the tours and he gave me his contact information,  he told me that if I come back to Egypt he will give me a cheaper price, so I think he is not a loyal person, overall I recommend the hotel for the budget travelers, but I don't recommend to book any tours with them.‚Ä¶

From the day of check in, we were treated like a VIP. Ibrahim came everyday to clean and replenish. The nightly entertainment was included in our stay and well worth the experience. Food was very good and breakfast buffet, also included, was amazing. Nabeih was very polite and informative, took care of our every need and made our morning a dining experience. Room service was very prompt on bringing food. Every part of the hotel was clean and always smelled nice. I would definitely book a stay here again. And recommend to my friends.

- Room: nice and comfortable  - Breakfast : excellent and includes most of Egyptian foods like Fool, falafel , koskosy , feeteer etc. - view : direct on the nile side , better to ask for nile view  - sky resturant : good menu with different kinds of vegetarian and non Veg. - staff : very good and doing their best to make you happy specially the breakfast Resturant , reception, room service. - Room prices : little higher in compare to nearest type of hotel . - Night Show: very good and includes songs , belly dance an tanora traditional dance .

ÿ≥ÿπÿ±Ÿá ŸÖŸÜÿßÿ≥ÿ® ÿå ŸÖŸàŸÇÿπŸá ÿ¨ÿ®ÿßÿ± ŸàŸÖÿ∑ŸÑ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑŸÜŸäŸÑ ÿ≠ÿ™Ÿâ ÿßŸÑÿ∫ÿ±ŸÅ ÿßŸÑÿ∫Ÿäÿ± ŸÖÿ∑ŸÑÿ© ÿ±ÿßÿ¶ÿπÿ© ŸÑŸàÿ¨ŸàÿØ ÿ≠ŸÅŸÑÿßÿ™ ÿ≤Ÿàÿßÿ¨ ŸäŸàŸÖŸäÿßŸã ÿ£ŸÖÿßŸÖŸÉÿå ÿÆÿØŸÖÿßÿ™Ÿáÿå ŸÜÿ∏ÿßŸÅÿ™Ÿáÿå ÿÆÿØŸÖÿ™Ÿáÿå ŸÅÿ∑Ÿàÿ± ŸÖÿπÿ™ÿØŸÑÿå ŸÖŸàÿ∏ŸÅŸäŸÜ ŸÖÿ≠ÿ™ÿ±ŸÖŸäŸÜ Ÿà ÿÆÿØŸàŸÖŸäŸÜ, ÿ¥ÿßÿ¥ÿ© ÿ®ÿ±Ÿàÿ¨ŸäŸÉÿ™ÿ±ÿπÿ±ÿ∂ ÿ∂ÿÆŸÖÿ© ŸÑŸÖÿ¥ÿßŸáÿØÿ© ŸÇŸÜŸàÿßÿ™ ÿ®Ÿä ÿ•ŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ∂Ÿäÿ© good price, amay location,services,clean, breakfast, staff are helpful and nightly live music plus sports live show through large screen for full enjoyments. w

The correct way to advertise Nile View hotel would be. Stay in a -5 star old rundown boat watching toxic waste dumping in the river. With an old rustic black mold infested carpet and mold in sink and shower and for entertainment staff entering your room late at night. And for a bonus get sick from the food and stay on the toilet looking at the Mold in the sink and shower. And for your safety in the event of an emergency there is a dirty old mattress in the hallway that you can hide under to keep you safe from predators. This is an experience of a lifetime. You can book this exciting holiday on Nile View deceptive website. Nile View hotels advertising is very misleading. It‚Äôs not a 5 star hotel it's a nothing star disgusting filthy old rundown boat that was so bad we both got very sick from the deplorable conditions. There is black mold everywhere in the carpet on the walls in the sink on the floors this was the most disgusting rundown hotel we have ever stayed at. And even the ceiling was falling apart. We witnessed hotel employees dumping toxic waste in the Nile. This hotel should not be allowed to be open as it is a health hazard. Our stay on the dirty old boat was a nightmare. Just read the numerous negative reviews and look at actual pictures posted by myself and others that stayed at Nile View they tell the truth. And no matter what lies Nile View post it does not change this fact ‚Ä¶

Very bad experience. They canceled my reservation on Nile view side without any notice or warning, and give it to foreign guests instead of me, then tried to convince me to accept port view instead of Nile view. The duty manager was very rude person, he gives me his back while talking, and left me with no options rather than leaving the place. Not recommended at all.

Who can imagine that this fine boat hotel  is still not open!! I enjoyed very much my stay with German group of 20 who nearly cancelled their booking from Feb, 28 till Mar. 02, 2020 only because we discovered that this great boat relocated in Maddi and still not open.  Instead, boat management was thoughtful enough to arrange for an A/C brand new shuttle bus dialy! First we thought this is only to & from the museum only. But we were mostly pleased to discover that this thoughtfulness extents to every where, any time and any numbers of time! Thoughtfulness is reflected in staff attitude as well! We and the owner are really lucky to have this staff who LOVE the boat, love their work and care soooooo much for customer satisfaction. I barely had the chance to order anything! They care enough to fullfil every need and any remark before you even say it!!  Nile view Zamalek (now Maadi): you made me proud, you made all the guests happy, you gave us such a wonderful experience that I want really to thank each and every one of you. I can't believe how caring, clean and kind every one of you are! It's not just hospitality it's true kindness & care coming from professional people who received us befoooooore getting readying and finishing innovations! But they really made a "hard to please group" ; feel home. Can't thank you enough, we will sure be back to see you after renovations After special entrance gate is finished. After sundeck and covered pool are ready  Food there is unforgettable! I had the most wonderful kabsa, the best hawawshy and an amaaaazing mixed grill. Breakfast buffet is memorable! Oh my God! What great bakery do they have!!! Best omlette in town! Tameya is fried before you. All kinds of hot drinks! Real fresh orange juice. Real care and morning smile. Even if you are in a hurry, they would notice and make you the best snacks to go! O my God after 2 days I'm still overwhelmed with your kindness people! I remember each and every name of you: Reception: Ahmed, Sheriff Mostafa & Adel. Room service: Refaat Food and beverage: Nabieh Omlette stand: Hamad (very caring) Chief at the kitchen is the best (not sure about the name) Even room cleaning: Maha Bill man. Security men who would help you park your car. Everyone .. I'm sorry I haven't met you all. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Can't wait till I'm back.‚Ä¶

Wanted to stay on the Nile whilst in Cairo but most of the 4 and 5 star places were not within our budget and found Nile View was.It was not too bad,very small rooms as you would expect as it is a retired cruise ship.The pool was terrific to have a dip in after a long hot day site seeing.The only problem we encountered was music from upstairs which went to the wee small hours.

Please note that this hotel would not keep any rooms for you even after they confirm you that a room (or rooms) is reserved for you. They just look at the rooms available when you check in and assign one of the available rooms to you. They just don‚Äôt care if the available room is not of the type you requested.  We reserved two rooms for 3 nights and requested that they should be next to each other. The hotel staff acknowledged and sent me an email with confirmation numbers. This happened 4 months before our stay. But still, when we checked in, they gave us rooms in two different sections of the hotel. Essam (not sure how it is spelt) was at the front desk and he was extremely uncooperative. He was adamant that those were the only rooms available even though our reservation was confirmed 4 months in advance. He finally told us that he would give us two adjacent rooms the next day.  But the next day, Essam did the same thing again. He reassigned rooms to us but in two different sections again. We argued with him again but it was of no use. This man would try strongly NOT to help customers. Fortunately for us, there was one more person at the front desk and he tried to help us. His name was Ahmed. After listening to our request, he found out that there were two adjacent rooms available on a different floor and he assigned them to us. Our request was finally accommodated. Our first positive experience at this hotel was with Ahmed.   I had another weird experience at this hotel. I went to the restaurant on the roof top one day. Instead of directing me to a table, the waiter asked me, ‚ÄúHow can I help you?‚Äù. I then asked him, ‚ÄúDo you have vegetarian food?‚Äù He replied, ‚ÄúWhat is vegetarian food?‚Äù I was stunned! He was a waiter at a restaurant and he didn‚Äôt even know what vegetarian food was. This place is obviously run by weird guys.  The only other positive experience was with the staff at the breakfast. They were all nice and friendly.‚Ä¶

After reading some very bad recent reviews i was about to cancel our reservation but a positive review from a fellow South African and a reassurance from the hotel that we would wouldn't experience the any of the problems mentioned in other reviews. Well I am glad that we stuck with our plan, the location is perfect, views of the Nile in the evening are stunning we ate all our meals for the two days we were there in the restaurant and we couldn't fault anything. The breakfast were really good as well with a large selection of fruits meats pastries etc. Yes the "rooms" are not big but they are cabins not rooms, this is a Nile Boat not a hotel! The rooms were clean and everything worked.The staff were all amazing and tried their best, there were a few language issues as this is not a tourist establishment but frequented mostly by local people. We were always made to feel most welcome by the other guests and even joined in the festivities of a birthday party and an engagement party. the only complain was yes there is a smell of cigarette smoke in corridors etc but the is Egypt there is no such thing as a non smoking area.Would go back there again.‚Ä¶
