Service is perfect.. the view from my room fantastic  thank you Staybridge and the   team is freindely and politely special Miss Asmaa Elhadary  and Mr. Amir Mahmoud   from the reception exceeded my expectations

We stayed at this hotel in October 2021 for 12 nights. From the first moment of our arrival ,we felt the exceptional customer service. Mr. Mohammed Abd Allah the front desk manager who met us did an excellent job trying to accommodate our need.  The room was excellent,  breakfast was great and lots of varieties and the location of the hotel was superb being in city star itself.   I would give 5 stars for all the friendly employees for their excellent customer service trying to do all they can so you can enjoy your stay . I really would stay there again whenever I visit Cairo.

Service is perfect.. the view from my room fantastic üòç thank you kempinski and the team is freindely and politely special Mariam from geust relation and ahmed from the reception and mohamed from conserige

I booked 2 rooms at the hotel last week, and I truly enjoyed a remarkable experience from checking-in till departure! The hotel exceeded my expectations. I highly recommend this hotel for: 1) Great, friendly staff. 2) Spacious, fully-equipped rooms. 3) Exceptional sense of security. 4) Location & direct access to city stars mall. It's the best choice for Families and travelers who appreciate the 'Home, away from home experience'

This is our third stay at this amazing hotel. We stayed in suite 1012 between 24/09/2021 - 08/10/2021. The hotel in general is beautiful and suites are specious, clean and beds are extremely comfy. I also loved the view from our room. The staff are friendly and I must say special thanks to (Michael) who works in the reservation department "thank you for your time and gracious hospitality. Thanks again for doing everything you could to make us feel at home and thank you for going the extra mile for us I really appreciate your efforts and can't thank you enough" .  I must also say special thanks to (Bahaa) (housekeeping manager) for being so generous and helpful. He looked after us very well during our stay :)  A Big thank you to (Rehab) for preparing a decent breakfast for us every morning, she was extremely generous, I can't thank her enough for looking after us during our stay as this made our stay unforgettable.  Thanks to everyone else for the warm welcome. Hotel facilities are superb.  I highly recommend this fantastic hotel.‚Ä¶

Nice place! Super super helpful staff even with my language limited to English only. I never made it to breakfast but it was nice to just pop over to the mall via the parking garage when I needed to. Bathroom a little small but there is the kitchen etc so that explains why. Overall good stay.

It is my first time for me here .I‚Äôm diamond elite member with IHG but really like this hotel .like the hospitality here from all the staff special Mr.Hamdy from reception and Mrs.Rasha the Guest Relations Manager for all their effort that they provided to me .Hopfully the hotel provides club lounge for IHG members as the hotel is different than other Holiday inn.Will come again in June .

Eman is really nice and polite, in general all the staff  from the Hotel  and the most amazing is the view that is direct to the Nile.  I really recommend to look the sunset at the pool area because it's amazing. this Hotel have many  amenities like Casino and bar  in the building. Neben the hotel are many pharmacies and supermarket if you need to buy  something for emergencies.

This hotel is clean, has many delicious meal options and friendly staff.  Marina, the Client Service Representative, was extremely helpful.  She scheduled tours for us, everything was easy and flawless.  Thank you!

As usual an excellent stay (ongoing for another 10 days) staying in the IHG Holiday Inn suites in Maadi Cairo.   Food is excellent, internet excellent, beds very comfy, all in a very nice place to be for work or personnel break.   Invited to the hotel weekly reception gathering and met the very professional and informative guest relations team.   Stayed here many times including all other IHG brands / hotels globally.   Excellent service, very friendly, and excellent IHG members program  My go to brand for hotels and myself and colleagues will continue to use IHG

Organized to spend an extra night here so we could have some time by the pool. They slipped a note under the door in the night saying the pool and gym would be closed all day for a private function. When asked if  they could shuttle us to the other holiday inn, they declined. The hotel itself was otherwise nice but we wouldn‚Äôt have stayed here if we had known earlier.

Food tasted very nice and the service of the waiters was more than perfect,very cosy place Thanks to amro and alaa eldin for the good welcoming Thanks for all the staff Will definetly visit again Perfectooooooüòçüòçüòç
Room service & housekeeping was helpful very clean & organised  Special thanks for  Remonda & iman organising resorption event  Place was great  It will not the last time isa  Stuff was kind and help

The hotel is located in a very beautiful place in Maadi, looking at the Nile. The staff were so kind and hospitable, they offered me a VIP room, and always takes care of my needs. Salut to the ladies of the guest relations they are more than kind!

I stayed at 6th floor at the hotel for 6 days . I came for a workshop . I wanna recommend waleed as room attendants . I lost my gold ring in the room. He found it in the room and left it to me in a visible place . That was amazing !

The hole staff is very friendly and very hospitable.  Rasha , The Guest relation manger is very friendly and caring.  She Called us to check on us and asking how the room is . The location of the hotel is very good and close to the center of Cairo I‚Äôm recommending this hotel to my all my friends

My girlfriend and I had a massage with Salma and Mohanad today at this place and we enjoyed our experience. They were both very professional and provided great service. Highly recommend if you are looking to relax! The massages were also very complete and for the full body.

I think this Hilton is the best one in Cairo at the moment. They take the Corona situation very serious (although quite some guests unfortunately don‚Äôt). The staff tries to enter the room as few times as possible. But if needed housekeeping can be requested.  Also because of Covid, guests that book a room with breakfast (or have it included) have a choice between room service or breakfast in the restaurant. There are no limitations on the breakfast options. The roomservice menu (dinner/ lunch) still has many options (more than other Hilton hotels worldwide during this pandemic). Rooms do have a classic interior, but all is really well maintained. The pool is located on the bank of the Nile, the only downside can be that it is sunny until around 1pm. I love the location in Zamalek, which is an area I like to wander around. The icing on the cake is the very friendly and helpful staff‚Ä¶. I can recommend this hotel fully and can‚Äôt wait to return here.‚Ä¶

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights as part of a tour.  The hotel lobby, coffee shop, outdoor pool and location were great. The morning buffet breakfast was excellent and the staff friendly and helpful.  However, the rooms are extremely old and dated. Additionally, they have not been maintained. On the first night, water from the bathroom above our room leaked and flooded our bathroom. The room balcony which had a fantastic view of the Nile was unusable as it hadn't been maintained and dirty.  I would still stay at this hotel due to the location, amenities and staff.

Charming hotel located perfectly at the Nile. Amazing view and located in the heart of the vibrant neighborhood of zamalek. The rooms are nice and clean. The breakfast is very good with a great variety of food, international and Egyptian. The staff is friendly and helpful and attentive. The staff at the reception is very kind and professional, we were helped by Moustafa who is a great asset to this hotel! We will definitely come back, we already booked our next stay with the whole family for next February!

W·∫π have stayed 4 nights in Hilton zemalek Cairo, Hotel staffs ar·∫π Very polite and well beheaved.   Hotel food is Very good. Also rooms and room service.   This hotel is next to Nile river. W·∫π can see the rever view from the hotel balcony.  Over all good place to stay here.

Seriously had the best massage with Mariam. She has magic hands. I was in a car accident two weeks ago and was in so much pain and stiff and she was so gentle and worked through it all and is the first time I felt relief since it happened. My husband had his massage with Ramy and he felt soooo much better. He has back issues as well and Ramy was nice and strong working through it all. 10/10 Definitely book your massage you won‚Äôt regret it. We are booking another one in a couple days üôÇ

Great service and food quality and taste. Clean pleace with a great view to the Nile River and Hotel pool. The hotel haa an International Updated Environment. The Personel crew are profesional and very commited to attend their clients under the manager supervision.

The hotel is very comfortable, beautiful and in a excellent location. The food is excellent and the staff extremely helpful and kind. It was a pleasant experience. Safety is also a important aspect of this hotel.

The location is nice, but very very busy as it‚Äôs in the middle of diplomatic area. Lovely view over the Nile from the rooms and gym.  The rooms are huge! 2 bedrooms, kitchen and two bathrooms, ideal for families. This is a very old property so everything in the room is worn out, they try to maintain and clean but it‚Äôs old.  Great view from restaurant over the Nile

Excellent stay, the hotel staff couldn‚Äôt do enough for us and the breakfast is amazing (and thanks Mohammed for looking after us at breakfast ). Room was very clean and comfortable (thanks Fatima). View from our room of the Nike was great too. Pool is lovely too! We booked some private tours through the hotel, which were amazing; thanks Wagih (our guide), Ibrahim and Sayad for arranging everything, we had a fantastic time, saw incredible sights and learned a lot. And thanks Moustafa on the front desk for helping us with all our questions!

A very good experience and worth every day stay. The massage, fitness equipment and restaurants were great. A number of staff were very helpful. Among them is Alaa, Mostapha and Saber. I would recommend a stay in Conrad

I have stayed twice in July once before going to north cost and other after coming from north cost   For some reasons I made mistake in dates , they were so collaborative in fixing the date as per the right plan with no charge considering am diamond member   And as usual Conrad never turned me down in taking care of all the hygiene starting from the rooms, corridors and restaurants.  Breakfast is one of the things that i can‚Äôt missed during my staying in Conrad , the assortment is too good and always satisfying.  Mr.Gamal Yousry as his usual remembered me and my family members names , and welcome us back asking about our health status , also assure us that they are taking the highest precautions practices in all zones   Thanks again and always to Conrad hotel for making our first trip after the pandemic is so great   We always will come back and Conrad will always be out first choice‚Ä¶

A pleasant experience in Conrad. Excellent house keepers Saber & Alaa. Both folks would daily check on with me to ensure I am comfortable and have my room cleaned.   Another great folk is Mustafa. Walking into the hotel tired after a stressful trip. Mustapha lighten up my day with so much warmth, enthusiasm and interesting jokes. Such a good guy.

As a travel agent, I booked our group trip to Egypt and I'm glad we choose Conrad. Lucky for us, the hotel is almost complete with their renovations and as a result, our rooms were amazing.  The website does not do the hotel enough justice.   In addition to this, the hotel staff had great security around the clock, prompt room assistance, excellent restaurants with many different food options, and is overall reasonably priced.    I give them my best recommendation.

Our Road Scholar group ended our trip there.  It is a lovely hotel having  rooms with views of the Nile and a nice restaurant.  It is large so there is lots of room to wander and relax.  The management gave us a very late checkout without charge so we could catch a late flight to the US.  In the restaurant we were well taken care of by IMAN and the bell hop Ashfar made sure our Uber arrived on time and stayed with us until he arrived.

It was years ago that I visited the Conrad Hotel in Cairo and the recent visit was a very pleasent one. The Hotel was going to a major renovation and is surely making a very big uplift to the Hotel and the quality of the stay.  The staff are unusally friendly and accomedating and you get this special "I feel at home" vipe. It will surely be my preferred Hotel in Cairo when I plan to return shortly.

The best beds ever - didn't want to leave !  Great Food and Beverage and Moustafa at check ins as AMAZING !  Really appreciated the flowers in our room from Head of Housekeeping- Shereen and Nevine Albert made us so welcome on our arrival check in. THANK YOU !

Wonderful stay at conrad. Great location and lovely restaurants. Special thanks to Amr at Concierge, he was truly superb. Looked after us the whole stay. Arranged all our travel arrangements each morning and had our room upgraded when we had a small issue. He even went as far as calling the hotel we were booked at in sharm el sheikh to arrange for them to send a car to the airport to collect us as our transfer had failed. It seemed nothing was too much trouble. If you stay here please introduce yourselves to Amr as if there is anything that you need he will assist with a smile. You are a great ambassador for Conrad, thank you again Amr.

This was an amazing hotel. With amazing staff. The attention to detail throughout the hotel was fantastic. The housekeeping staff that was responsible for my room Saber and Laila were perfect and just a pleasure to see and talk to everyday. Very kind and helpful always asking if there was anything they could do for me. The hotel is in a great location and has amazing views. They have multiple restaurants, a bar/club, and a casino. I always felt welcomed and safe at the hotel. I will definitely stay here again if I should ever visit Cairo again in the future.

We have had a very enjoyable time here at the Conrad in Cairo a very comfortable place to spend our last few days here in Egypt  I would like to single out one person out of a whole lot of helpful and friendly staff. Ahmed Abdelhady was our breakfast waiter and could not have been more helpful. It felt as though we were the only people in the restaurant when in fact he was able to give everyone in the restaurant personal and excellent service. We certainly appreciated the friendly attention he gave us ensuring all our needs and more were met.

I have stayed at this hotel before It was so comfortable hotel and teamwork really really really helpful team . I loved this hotel so much so excellent front office, excellent restaurant,and excellent rooms Finally i would like to thank mr. Ramadan Youssef.

to the main resturant it was perfect as well as the cafe was good the staff was good also the pool was good indian resturant also was very good location malllVery nice hotel i spent my vacation there i went

The hotel is more than wonderful in Terms of cleanliness and other things. My experience in the main restaurant ‚Äúwindows‚Äù with breakfast is varied, delicious and fresh. The treatment of the staff is very hospitable and helpful. There is also a wonderful restaurant in the hotel devoted to Indian food ‚Äúindira‚Äù. This made me sensitive to the Indian dishes and their good flavor.  Spatial thanks to the front office team for the good reception and quick accommodations.

This hotel was very good in everything i liked the food it was delicious and amazing the buffet was perfect and the restaurant staff are smiling every time please keep on  rooms need some renovations  your perfect  job

One of the best hotels with the best hospitality, service and has one of the best locations in cairo.   I Loved my stay overthere and would definitely back in the near future. Room was so clean and food was really nice.

The hotel was perfect my stay was amazing i liked the hotel staff and the rooms were perfect swimming pool was clean and the staff was very helpful i will recommended this hotel to my friends and colleagues thank you for everything

Everything was good restaurant staff in the reception was good as well as the Indian restaurant staff was amazing the location near to mall also near to the airport the service was very good overall good üëç

the hotel is perfect for everything I liked the hotel staff specially the pool and gym and the front office team specially karim mohamed from concierge .the hotel location was perfect and very close to the mall and the Airport too ..

Have a lovely stay  Hotel stuff is very friendly Hotel is clean and rooms are big and clean The food in the restaurant is very tasty Great experience so i hope i came very soon  Great thankful for Mostafa and Micheal

I stayed there for business it was perfect, very close to the Airport, and the room it was very clean most key places in the city, and with a direct connection to the Mall. Thank you so much to all the team there; especially karim Mohamed AND Ramadan Youssif at the Concierge.  less

Amazing breakfast, the food is incredible and the buffet has a large variety of everything. The staff is so friendly and kind. Ask for Siham she‚Äôs super helpful and nice, she brought us everything we needed and even more.

I‚Äôve been staying at this hotel for years, so I know what to expect. This time I had multiple room bookings. Thanks to Ms. Marcelina, check-in was quick and flawless. IDs and special requests were sent one day before. Despite the hotel being very busy on the weekend, I got one room upgraded due to my Bonvoy status which is always welcome and a sign of appreciation from the Bonvoy group. Thanks Ms. Marcelina.   House keeping were always supporting and not late on our requests although they were many.   Thanks for Mr. Khalil from the swimming area for always setting up nice lounges in the shade close to each other as we were 10 people.   Room dining has improved significantly over the years. We ordered burger and chicken nuggets on multiple occasions. Always fresh with quality meat/ chicken. What you would expect from a 5 star hotel.   There was an evening wedding but due to the double glazed room windows, we couldn‚Äôt hear any sound inside the rooms.   Thank you for a great stay and looking forward to my next visit.‚Ä¶

My family and I had a wonderful stay at The Westin Cairo. The hotel has beautiful views overlooking a golf course as well as its own greenery. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The service in the hotel is first class; from the staff at breakfast (with special thanks to Aya, Seham and Amr), to the house keeping staff (special thanks to Mustafa and Muhammad), and everyone in reception (thank you Mark). I highly recommend this hotel.

I am a consistent guest to Westin Katameya dunes. I spend periods there for both family vacations and business events. It os a perfect place for both types of trips. Excellent Relaxing resort, very professional, friendly staff who thrives for guest satisfaction. Thanks to all Westin Katameya Dunes team with Special thanks to Marc and Abdelfattah

During my most recent business trip, I was impressed by the professionalism and amicability displayed by your staff members, as well as the quality of service provided, which convinced me that I can always rely on your hotel staff members. Mr. Amr Naguib and Mr. Mustafa deserve special thanks. Thank you very much!  Dr. Islam Nasralla

The place is great in terms of the green view, staff, and services, I like it very much and highly recommend it for relaxing breaks!! Kids also enjoyed too much and had a pleasant and funny stay.. The Westin Cairo Golf Resort is always our preferred choice in Cairo.

Fantastic stay at Westin hotel, loved the atmosphere and staff. Paloma was great, special thanks to Aya, welcoming lady. My daughter Alia promised to send her üíúüå∑. I strongly recommend it for honeymooners.

I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The views were amazing and the atmosphere made me feel at home. I was particularly impressed by how attentive the staff were. Special thanks go to Aya who greeted us with a wonderful smile when we went for breakfast. She made us feel special no matter how busy the restaurant want. I would like to thank her for her care and kindness. I can‚Äôt wait to visit her and her hotel again.

The space is very nice,  People are really kind. Mahmoud at restaurant presented me with very good sugestions, the last desert I've tried was amazing good. Every day the service was very good.  The lebanese grill is something you should definitely try.

Excellent service, quiet and tranquil atmosphere, good for a get away place.  Staff are all excellent, special thanks to Mark at the reception desk.  Rooms are comfortable and spacious. The design of the resort is appealing

An afternoon by the pool, surrounded by the best team at the Roof Top Bar; Waled, Mohy, Frahat and Esam.  Exclusive, top notch service, second to none. Actually considering staying there tomorrow, skipping the planned sightseeing program‚Ä¶.üòÇ  We‚Äôll definitely come back here next time visiting Cairo   Gitte Seidelin

This is a beautiful luxury hotel situated on the Nike River. My husband and I are here for a few days prior to our Nile river cruise. Staff is extremely helpful at the dining areas, rooftop pool or just in the lobby areas. If you look confused they jump Right in to ask how they can assist you.   Restaurants - Middle eastern restaurant on the BR level was excellent - we had chicken soup, pigeons stuffed with rice etc. pigeons were a nice surprised with very dark meat but nicely spiced. E had a couple of tajines - but was way too much food for even the four of us.  SUGGESTION - Disclosing the portion size at ordering would help prevent food wastage. We felt bad at how much food we couldn‚Äôt eat. The restaurant on the R level was good for breakfast with representation of varied cultures. Ample types of food for people to decide what to eat. Pool bar - we came later in the day. Rooftop was clean with comfy lounges and couches. We had a couple of cocktails and some nibbles to watch the sun set.  Room COMFORTABLE BED! Slept really well. Soaker tub was appreciated and it helped me to wind down so I could sleep. Spacious bathroom. They stopped by and asked if we needed water. Appreciated  Maybe we can try the spa tomorrow‚Ä¶ Definitely would recommend!‚Ä¶

Had an amazing experience made even more memorable because of hotel staff service . We were checked in at the club lounge which was an experience in itself and the suite was one of the best ones I  had stayed at.  Food in the club lounge was always good and the room service always on time . Mr. Tamar took special care of us and made us feel at home. At front desk n Conceirage Ms. Christen was super kind and helpful and gave insight as to what we must visit and made arrangements for us for our trip to the Pyramids with guide and hotel car. At the pool bar , Mr.Walid Salim took good care of us. All in all from room cleanliness to staff service to club lounge experience, everything was spot on . Also the hotel is right on the nile so great views.

Wonderful experience at the fairmont. Beyond our thoughts expectations. Great attention to details. We also enjoyed the heated sky pool at the fairmont. People are so thoughtful. Thank you Walid, Mahmoud and all other whose names i forgot.

Celebrating my birthday in Cairo. The treatment provided by the rooftop pool bar staff was second to none. The surprise with cake and song was overwhelming,   The hotel standard and service level in general is higher than one could expect   Just a fantastic place to stay and the best choice celebrating the day

Fairmont is the Best hotel to stay in. Outstanding friendly staff. They get you what you need before you even ask. Ola and Ashrakat in the restaurant were amazing and super friendly. We would definitely stay in Fairmont Corniche el Nile on our next visit to Egypt.

Beautiful property. Went swimming on the top floor and had amazing service - especially from Walid. Thank you for making our stay so comfortable! Would come back to stay again the only the future anytime.

The Fairmont Nile city is the best hotel I‚Äôve ever been in!!!!!! The hotel rooms are amazing, the view is good, and the pool is amazingüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄ!!! The buffet has excellent quality!!! and the server, Sunrise, was very very nice! I would highly recommend this hotel!!üòçüëçüëç  Aidan 9 yrs

Sky pool has the best view of Cairo that I‚Äôve seen. Good music, food and helpful staff. Walid Selem, Moustofa and the DJ made our afternoon at the pool very enjoyable. I‚Äôll be back next time I‚Äôm in town.

Wow- what an experience! Came for day-use of the Pool and Sauna and will definitely be staying here when I come back. Wonderful service and incredible gratitude staff. Monica at the spa is so sweet and helpful. Moustafa at the Sky Bar was amazing and shared stories and recommendations with us. Also he makes delicious drinks! Very grateful for the whole experience and will definitely be back. Also not to miss, the best shower of my life in the Cool Mist Experience Shower after hanging by the pool all day.

Were helpful and welcoming even for brown skinned people.  Very Very big suite rooms. Bathrooms needs upgrade but everything was available as a full fledged apartment. Staff was excellent and support  in everything a guests needs. Location was great. Great views of Nile with balconies.

I would like to say huge thank you to everyone in Cairo Trade Centre Hotel üòä  Where can I start with out forgetting anything / Anyone!  The team in Cairo Trade Centre are there purely to give the best Service ever to their guests during their Stay, nothing too much. Restaurant ( Food and Beverage) Team always ready and happy to go the extra mile every day / everytime with out a fail üòäüëèüëè  House keeping team, well not just thorough, they are very polite, efficient, quality and always go the extra mile with out a doubt üòäüëèüëè  Swimming pool team. Fantastic experience. Keeping the place clean, tidy and safe for the swimming pool users also very friendly with everyone and caring for kids üòäüëèüëè  Front office team, well communicating and engaging team, again nothing too much. Quick response and reaction to any concern / quires. Well done team keep it up üòäüëèüëè  Also I don't want forget the very helpful And polite Security team and Luggage handling team üëèüëèüòä  So overall, well setup / family orientated environment and I strongly recommend this hotel for you especially if you're travelling with family and also to be in the heart of cairo.  Only one remark, that the rooms are bit old, especially Bathrooms. But well maintained and everything else compensate for that.  Once again many thanks and looking forward to seeing you soon.  S. BARBARY‚Ä¶

The people in the hotel are just amazing.   The location is ideal for a calm afternoon walking next to the Nile after a long day.   Clean, spacious and comfortable.   Highly recommended for long or short visit to Cairo.

The people there are amazing from reception to restaurant. always making feel like home.   we moved there from another hotel and it saved our visit to Cairo. initially we were very disappointed but once we moved to the suite in this hotel, our mood changed. the price was right, a facility like this, you would expect more expensive.   breakfast had a nice buffet; the staff was just amazing. they were taking extra care of us (family of 4), offerring food beyong the expected.   the hotel is located in the old Cairo; all tourist attractions are in the old Cairo so staying in this hotel is the best choice.  the area around is the best for walking next to the Nile or enjoy an outdoor coffee/lunch/dinner.

The first night was horrible .. after long trip we rather to the hotel .. the staff was night and game has a room quickly .. but almost everything didn‚Äôt not work .. AC.. fridge .. lights .. bad smell ‚Ä¶  They sent maintenance and took care of our needs ..  but unfortunately AC quit working and it became hot .. next day .. the door won‚Äôt lock!  I complained to the management .. and they transferred us quickly to another room ..  Special thanks to Mrs Christina manager of reception and Mr Adel manage of housekeeping for taking care of us .. they were responsive and stayed on top of our claims till everything was resolved‚Ä¶ so give them 10/10 for their customer service

My family and I came in a visit from Amman, Jordan in Eid's holiday to enjoy the beauty of Egypt and its gorgeous Nile, we initially had a couple of concerns regarding various facilities in our stay in the Hotel, but gladly those concerns were met swiftly and professionally.  The staff were welcoming, responsive, attentive and carefully listening to our suggestions and acting upon them immediately, it left a good impression to us.  I have addressed minor services concerns found within the first few hours of my hotel check-In to the receptionist, who addressed my service concerns to the GM of hotel, who then called all hotel directors and asked them to speak to me in person individually and all apologized and offered me some perks i.e. the restaurants, coffee shop, swimming pool, refund on stay fees, town tours fees, room services...etc.  In addition to this they continued to follow up with me to ensure all my needs were met and if I needed anything further.  I would like to express my sincere gratitude and thanks for my treatment during my stay, my room was spectacular with a Nile View and very spacious. The hotel staff‚Äôs service and personal attention made a huge difference in the happiness and joy during my stay in Cairo, I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Cairo and would strongly recommend to all my friends and contacts to use the same.  I would like to make a special thanks to the lovely team who made this trip so memorable: 1. Dania, Rania and Asim on receptionist and their manager Christina 2. Redha Hamoda, Security officer 3. Amira, Guest Relation Manager 4. Ahmad, Restaurant Officer 5. Mahmoud, Restaurant Manager 6. Wasim Faraj, Food and Beverage Manager  Recommending this place for whoever wants to enjoy a delightful experience and a lovely stay in Cairo.  5 stars!  Nabil Dababseh.‚Ä¶

I really enjoyed my stay at world trade center hotel Cairo. Staff are friendly and helpful ..its my second home in Cairo ..lovely stay and amazing trace facing the Nile view ..I recommended for all my friends and family ..thank you so much

This place is by far THE worst ever. Everything was covered in dust in the room, we booked for a two week stay and unfortunately due to it being non refundable we had to live with the situation. Despite our daily complaints and reminders about how many guests are in the suite we never received the right amount of cutlery, the eggs were never cooked the way we asked which was simple ‚Äúwell done‚Äù it was always runny, the bathrooms were not clean at all, the balcony door would not shut completely, the window lock on one of the bedrooms would fall off as soon as we opened the window. These were not even the big issues.  We arrived on the 13th and today is the 22nd the water supply to the hotel was cut off. When we spoke to the staff/management they had claimed it was an issue with the main water supply of the area and not the hotels issue. We called a bunch of times to see if this was resolved and got no proper update.  We left the hotel to go out and before coming back we called in the afternoon to get an update and the status was that the water issue was not yet resolved and nobody went to clean the room yet. In the evening around 10:30 we called again and the hotel staff assured us the room was checked and cleaned and the water issue was resolved.   We got back to the hotel and went back to our suite, the whole apartment had water soaked into the fitted carpet. When we went down to speak to the  management they said they would change our suite for us which they did but  ended up being in an apartment suite  that was in worse condition in terms of cleanliness than the first one we stayed in!   There was dust everywhere the room looked like it was not used in a long time. There was dust on the toilet area, there was dirt and crumbs on the carpet, dust on shelves, the bedding in all three rooms had dust and hair on them. According to the staff the suite had been ‚Äúchecked‚Äù and ‚Äúcleaned‚Äù earlier in the day. We were surprised by how confident they were in claiming everything had been cleaned when clearly it was not!    It is now 1:30am and the staff are cleaning under our supervision! We are supposed to be on a relaxing holiday and instead this trip has been full of stress and irritation due to negligence by hotel staff and management. Their compensation to us was slippers and tissue boxes!!!   The attached photos speak for themselves even the hotel staff who came to move our luggage to the ‚Äúnewly prepared suite‚Äù were embarrassed to see such a dirty and disgusting apartment suite. All they could say is on ‚Äúbehalf of the hotel we are truly sorry tell us what we can do to make it better‚Äù.   Seriously???!!!!!!  This is supposed to be under ‚ÄúHilton‚Äù hotel chains and it was no where near the Hilton standard!  We are extremely shocked and frustrated and disappointed about everything we have been through and still have to stay until our. Checkout as  it is non refundable.‚Ä¶

This hotel should have not been rated a 4 star . It was a - 0000. The hotel pictures were falsely depicted online. I DO NOT recommend any international travelers to stay at this hotel. I PROMISE you will be VERY DISAPPOINTED. And it certainly does not meet Covid protocol. It was unsanitary and management  and overall customer service was the WORST. We rented a suite to accommodate my family. We checked in at 4am in the morning and the complaints began as soon as we walked in. We ended our stay there by 11am. Total of 6 hours of disgust and poor hospitality. My cousin was locked into one of the bedrooms and we had to call the front desk from our cell phones since our hotel room phone was not working. It took them an hour to break down the door and get him out. The couches and dinning room chairs were stained, the carpet was stained and had lifted from the floor. The kitchen was not cleaned the stove had not been cleaned from the previous stay and was rusted and old. A loud electrical noise was coming from the kitchen that they couldn‚Äôt resolve and it lasted the entire time. The bathrooms were SCUM. Not cleaned. Toilets were stained and we could see scum and mold forming in all three bathrooms. No toilet paper, no clean towels, no soap‚Ä¶. Complete mess. I had initially reserved 3 nights and that quickly changed to a few hours. The manger that was the least bit helpful. I kept talking to her in English and she would respond in Arabic. She said she would not give us a refund that we would need to call Hilton hotline to complain. Although Hilton had said that the hotel would need to directly refund me. The hotel mgr mentioned they will be closing their doors anyways for remodeling in the next coming months. And she also said that since I spent more than a few hours in the hotel that it wouldn‚Äôt be fair for them to refund me. RIDICULOUS. This hotel needs to be reported to the Tourism Authorities really. Egypt is a beautiful and wonderful country full of hospitality and history and the people are full of heart and kindness. The hotel and management did not represent this country in any form or way. Shame on your Hilton World Trade.‚Ä¶

Completely outdated rooms and bathrooms. Bathrooms very dirty and moulded. Health and safety issues regarding electric sockets as even got fused when try to plug in. Covered with metal covering which comes loose. Shower curtain torn. Carpets dirty and stained. Shame on Hilton name. Not worth the money let alone staying.

EXCELLENT customer service upon check in.   GREAT Front  Desk reception,KEEP IT UP.   There is a particular name at the reception that i will not forget to mention here,RADY.  That man is well trained to serve and i believe he is in the right place because he gives his job his best.  Great Energy RADY.  BRAVO for your EXCEPTIONAL customer  care.   I will surely consider next visit Inshallah

I booked this hotel for 4 nights hoping to take advantage of the amenities described. But, the Wifi never worked, the Fitness Center, Rooftop Pool, and Terrace are out of operation, the Free Breakfast isn't international, and is the same every day. I suggest improving the cleanliness of the lobby & breakfast area, as well as the tobacco smell in the room (despite my room being for non-smoking people).  I highlight the room's cleanliness & comfort and the staff's friendliness.

It was a good experience, the staff are more than friendly! Always ask for Rady! He‚Äôs the one! For any comments or any questions, he will be available. Loved the welcoming and they have nice staff!!!!

Phonebook in my ID management alphabet Elmo Buddha philosophy if we must one of those busy cruises that I'm at mustafa I'll let you come up with stuck volley well the coma vista goalie where either shop sale Motorola magidden volfondo fimova Mumbai's fimon talk to Mayadi vocabulary ba minga Mel had a mwe'll call you when I'm in gaming I'm headed home and saw Bella's Dakota feel a coma vihezel fondu  Mr. Ahmad mustafa is good man in your hotel he is very friendly man Mr. Ahmad mustafa is a good man.

Mr. Rady at reception is very kind and welcoming. He‚Äôs always smiling and ready to help. Always takes care of me.The location of the hotel is very good. He is very fluent in English too which is very nice. His presence at hotel makes one feel comfortable.

Mr. Ahmad Moustafa is very polite, and welcoming. He always helps me, gave me very nice room. Always takes care of me.The location of the hotel is very good. The staff is very kind, and at reception they are fluent is English too.

I am staying in the hotel many times The hotel staff is friendly The reception staff is helpful The rooms are always ready on time I would like to thank Mr. rady salim for his continuous cooperation The rooms are always clean The food is varied and I would like to thank all

The hotel is very nice and great even i feel very comfortable towards the stay here  , its covering my needs and at any time the reception is very helpful specially Mr Rady at least his smile and welcoming make my stay so    nice , i feel really very thankful to the hotel and the managment

Currently I‚Äôm staying in this hotel for past 1 week. First of all the room is neat and tidy.  Housekeeping team is doing a good job. And the receptionists are friendly and polite especially Mr. Rady.   The reason I rated this hotel 3/5 because, 1. The complimentary breakfast is same everyday and it‚Äôs not in international standard. The breakfast is not recommended for non-Egyptians.  2. There are 16 floors in this hotel and there is only one lift. You can imagine the wait time for the lift to come. Lift is always busy and we have to wait long to get the lift.  It‚Äôs better to stay in lower floor..  The lobby is not so clean as you can find lots of bees.

This hotel is one of the best hotels I visited during my visit to Egypt,It has a great view , good quailty in food and my room was so clean , housekepping did their jobs perfectly, All employees work professionly .i have to thank all the staff in the hotel , they were so helpuful for us , and they do their job perfectly and actually , i have to thank Mr Gamal for his helpful and his respect to me all the time , he is really a gentle man. Of course I will visit this hotel once again

If you live old world charm, this is the place. The bones are beautiful - a cage elevator, grand front doors,  worn marble steps, balconies, floor to ceiling windows. Lively,and very nicely decorated. Beds are good, great wifi and air con, and conveniently above shops that sell snack and cheap water. Also a great, walkable location (and easy to grab an Uber).  The glassed in bathrooms are a creative solution and quite lovely. But they are really only ideal for people who are okay seeing each other on the toilet. Maybe not for besties, or work colleagues, or your dad.  The arranged driver was lovely and waited when we were delayed at airport. And staff Wafaa deserves to be rewarded for her courtesy, attentiveness, and competence.    The only real downside, and the reason we only enjoyed 1 included breakfast, was being cornered for the hard-sell by owner Mustafa. He wanted to change our current plans and pressed us to go to his other property so he could redesign our whole trip. PUSHY. This was so annoying and rude that we have cancelled our plans to return to this hotel at the end of our trip. Just to avoid this dude. Really too bad.‚Ä¶

The hotel is located very close to Tahrir Square, the Egyptian Museum, and a few other old downtown highlights. While the outside of the building looks slightly dilapidated--clearly beyond the control of the hotel--the entrance to the hotel and the interior is nicely done and inviting. Staff are very kind, helpful, and welcoming. The rooms are spacious and have the essentials. In the dining area, complementary tea and water are on offer throughout the day.  A few drawbacks: the street noise is very clearly heard from within the rooms (windows are not double paned), and Cairenes LOVE to honk for any and all reasons so you'll still feel very in touch with street life even within the hotel. Breakfast is rather mediocre: expect toast, hard boiled eggs, some jam, and a small cup of yoghurt, accompanied by tea or nescafe. The bedsheets are in serious need of updating (they are extremely rough and scratchy, making sleeping difficult). The bathrooms are an afterthought - just a corner in the room cordoned off by half-frosted glass, so it is recommended that you are very comfortable sharing all bodily functions with whomever you share the room. Despite a clear 'no smoking' sign at the front desk, staff still smoke in common areas (entry, dining area). We stayed in the room at the far end of the hallway (there are only six rooms) and could smell the smoke very clearly from inside our room with the door shut. When I went to pay for our room at checkout, one staff member sat directly in front of me smoking. I called him out on it, pointing at the 'no smoking' sign right in front of us, and he apologised profusely and moved away with his cigarette. I am 100% confident he resumed smoking inside as soon as we left.  Some of the basics aren't looked after: the room we were given had no pillowcases on three of our four pillows, and only one towel. The rest of the linens were out at the cleaners, and since there was only one person on staff, we had to stand in for the staff at the front desk so they could run out and pick up the clean linen. Rooms don't come with soap, but we were given a bottle of liquid soap when we asked. Early checkin is USD 25 on top of the regular room charge. The staff offered to arrange a car back to the airport on our departure, quoting a price double of what we paid to get from the airport to the hotel in the first place. It is recommended to just take an Uber instead (EGP 100-125, depending on traffic and time of day). Overall, it's not a bad hotel, and the staff's kindness goes a long way to compensate for the weaknesses noted above.‚Ä¶

As a solo female I loved the location and friendly staff. They quickly made me feel welcome and went above and beyond to help me with any questions I had. This was by far the nicest hotel I stayed at in Egypt. It is a little tricky to locate it but that is the only downside. I hope to return to Cairo and would book here again!

Hotel staff is very friendly. I requested for Airport pick-up, they arranged it. Also I requested before for early morning breakfast and Ms Wafa prepared breakfast on time. Ms Wafa, Mr. Farag and Mr. Elsoky are very good people at Hotel. They also guided me about the city. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Wonderful authentic hotel right in the city center.  Spaceous and very clean.  The owner is a very experianced tourguide himself and very helpful in arranging your tours.  The staff is very friendly and make you feel welcome every minute of your stay.

The Grand Agor was a perfect place for a few days in Cairo.  The staff, although small, is attuned to make your stay enjoyable.  The price is one class up from many of the small hotels downtown, but I found it to be secure and well situated.  You will be a $1 taxi ride from the current Egyptian Museum. Lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. My room was large with a great bathroom and shower, well lit.

We arrived at the hotel around 10.30 am, too early for check-in. Luckily, our room-to-be had been vacated and the bathroom cleaned, so we could use it and head out for a walk. Thanks to Achmed and Mustafa for that.  But I do not understand why they needed another two hours to get the room ready, when they did not even join the beds as we had requested a double bed at the time of booking or keep any towels when we returned close to 13:00. There were only hand/face towels kept, and even on the second day when we asked for bath towels, we got one, and were reluctantly asked, 'Do you need one more, I'll have to get it from the laundry.' Not being sure if he meant washed or unwashed laundry, we let it pass, lol. The shower fluctuates between scalding hot and freezing cold, and the staff tried their best to get it to work but it didn't, even on the second day. Add to it the tiny glass enclosure which they call a bathroom, there's no room to escape the hot and cold water, I almost got burnt! The glass cubicle idea is very weird, the frosting on the glass could have been complete near the toilet area at least! We stayed two nights, and were given two small bottles of water on the first day. When we asked on the second day, we were told it would be charged! When you check-in to a room, the least you expect is a hot shower, towels and water to drink. Sadly these were missing. The Wifi didn't work either. A special shout out to the lady in-charge of the cafe (I think her name is Ms. Wafa), she was very sweet and very efficient. The room itself was furnished well, with a nice wardrobe ideal for long stays. The two-rating is purely for the location and staff, and well the elevator! Grand Agor probably needs to decide if they want to be a hotel or a hostel. They are right now priced like a hotel with amenities like a hostel. There are much better cheaper places to stay in the downtown area, for once the Tripadvisor reviews did not match my experience, and I regret staying here.‚Ä¶

With the relentless chaos in Cairo, it‚Äôs important that you have a peaceful place to rest your head after a long day of exploring the city.   The hotel itself is quite new, which is great as the staff are always looking for feedback. The double room was very spacious with a lovely looking bathroom - unfortunately the hot water wasn‚Äôt too consistent so the showers could have been better. The bed was very comfortable, and there was a TV bracket on the wall but no TV. Unfortunately the WiFi was experiencing some issues during our stay so we didn‚Äôt have a great connection.   The hotel staff are just lovely; breakfast each morning was (as others have said) made with love, and the lovely lady would always offer us a tea or coffee when we were around. She really couldn‚Äôt do enough to take care of the guests and was one of our favourite parts of the hotel.   The location is also great, and central enough that you can pop back to use the toilet/have a coffee/take a breather from the Cairo madness, at any point during the day.   We arranged hotel pick up with the hotel after struggling to get in touch with them. If you do the same, make sure you go outside to meet your driver as only police are allowed inside the airport. Price was 25USD return which is very reasonable.   If we visit Cairo again we would stay at the Grand Agor - definitely recommend it.   The hotel also arranges tours for guests - we took one to the pyramids which was 20USD for both of us. Definitely do this. Avoid he public transport. Giza is hectic and stressful enough without waiting around for a bus! ‚Ä¶

I stayed at Grand Agor with my fiancee for 4 days at Grand Agor and it was the best experience we could have asked for during our whole trip. First off, do not let the entrance to the building where the hotel is distract you, it looks rough at best, but once you are inside the hotel, it is very nice. The staff is the friendliest you can find anywhere in the world, the rooms are wide and comfortable and  you get a feeling like you are staying at your friends house, and not actually at a hotel. Plus its location is very very good, right in downtown, near the museum, metro station, stores, etc. Last but not least the lift is very peculiar, not only is it very peculiar on the way it operates, but has its own theme music when moving, I know this sounds very odd, and it is, but for us it added a very special touch.‚Ä¶

Hotel Grand Agor is like a breath of fresh air from the buzzing city of Cairo. Its prime location in downtown allowed us to move freely in the area by foot or by public transport. Local restaurants were 5 minutes away, so is the Egyptian museum. The staff is super welcoming, professional and helpful. Every morning, our breakfast was made with love, by the lovely caretaker- Mrs Ouafa. Also, our room was spacious and very comfortable. Overall, it was a very nice hotel where price and comfort meets on the same level. We would highly recommend to those who wish to stay abit local and avoid the massive hotel chains.   **the hotel is actually located on the 2nd floor, so don‚Äôt be afraid to use the old lift! It is part of the egyptian experience!**

The room is neat and clean, the restaurant is good, staffs are cooperative. Good to stay.  The hotel is far from the city center, do shopping is not easy.  The travel services to visit tourist spots provided by the Taxi booth of the hotel (named Last Minute travel services) was not up to the mark. The driver dropped me on the Egyptian museum and he was supposed to stay  at the gate. But when I come back visiting the museum, I did not find him. Then I called him and he declined the call. I sent him message , he responded sending message after half an hour without giving any specific time of coming. I was puzzled, waiting and waiting. Then I was thinking to hire another Taxi. Finally he came after more than an hour.   The services provided was also costly. I could hire a Taxi using the APP less than half price.  On the way back, it was planned to take me a super store for buying dry fruits. But  he did not took me to a right store. It was felt to me that he did it intentionally.‚Ä¶

Stayed in that hotel 2 weeks only back 2days ago had extremely  pleasant  experience  staff very helpful  polite  and so willing  to help the management  in the person  of Mr habib salary and Mr Adam Abdullah  are the shining  example  of how excellent  professional  hoteliers  should  be I was totally  impressed  this is the 2nd time I stay in  the  hotel  I was there in June this year  definitely  recommende it  quite  frankly  I couldn't  find any complaints  at all thank  you tolip hotel and ALL  staff  for being  that  good  and kind   Mrs laila  Mustapha  from London

Had a solid month-long stay at this property! The front desk staff was really friendly, especially Lobna, as well as Reem, Mohamed, and Marina. Mahmoud from room service was really friendly as well, as was Youstina from guest relations. The bellman were also really helpful. The housekeeping team that was with us all month, Hanaa and Ghada, were exceptional in their customer service - the rooms were always super clean and they had such a friendly attitude every time we interacted with them!   Thank you Tolip El Galaa team for a memorable stay!

The staff were very accommodating and extremely caring and kind to our special needs.  They went out of their way to make our stay a happy one.  I can honestly say all staff were polite,  professional and committed to give excellent service.  I highly recommend this hotel.

It‚Äôs not five star hotel but the staff makes it 10 stars for me they are all very helpful specially Lara she an amazing reception girl with smile face and she‚Äôs very helpful I do love her when she knew that I got an Operation she upgrade my room to an suite room which was amazing suite

Very bad hotel Bad room service  The door didn't lock and anyone can open it from outside  The receptionist is very rude And aggressive in dealing with guesty Not recommended for any visitor Low quality

It‚Äôs like they don‚Äôt care! Alot of noise through day and night i couldn‚Äôt sleep, tried to call alot of times no reply! And when someone called it was to remind me of the check out time (which i asked to change and they confrimed it) no hellos and no goodbyes even! Did not like at all, never booking there again

I was chocked to be honest, when I saw the rating on Booking and that the hotel is a 5 star I expected a five star service and amenities. first at check in I asked for a glass of water after my long trip and I was responded at with " there is free water in the room and that If I am busting I can buy water from the local shop. second I have requested a double bed when I booked but I was told at the reception that it is not available. reception staff at check in were not very friendly and lacked customer service satisfaction. The room was very basic, the floor carpet was worn out and full of staines. the toilet was very small and unclean. the room was looking over the main street and it was extremely noisy we barely could sleep. the wardrobe was very old and worn out. window curtains were broken and doesn't block the day light. The tea and coffee tray was dirty. The room main door had a gap underneath it I could hear people outside same like they are in the room with me. ALL IN ALL I don't believe that this hotel should have a 5 star rating and to be honest I wouldn't recommend it.‚Ä¶

the hotel is really good I enjoyed my weekend here the rooms are wide and clean and the animation team are friendly also the food is so delicious.we enjoyed the pool and had a lot of fun in the pool area

very clean and modern rooms with amazing service and tasty food.  beach and pool are very enjoyable.  the animation team are very friendly and extremely talented. precautions and health and safety measures are being taken seriously. very enjoyable stay.

We were a bit nervous first time in Cairo a new city and new country how is everything going to be? But Ritz Carlton was amazing and gave us a great start to our holiday. I had corresponded with the hotel and requested for connecting rooms. On checkin due to my platinum elite status we were upgraded to connecting rooms facing the Nile, and free breakfast. The rooms were great, location was amazing and breakfast was great. My kids were really happy with all of it. We also got breakfast boxes packed for us. Starting our trip here kicked off our Egypt explorations to a great start. The forums have been so great and we used the Cairo airport shuttle which was seamless to be dropped off at the airport.  The front office staff was always great, especially Mahmoud who checked us in and  the location is really great.‚Ä¶

We spent three amazing nights in the Ritz Carlton. We originally booked city executive suite and were upgraded to Superb Nile view. From the moment you step in you feel welcomed and the service was up to bar. The outstanding staff at the lounge did not reserve a minute to offer help and a very friendly atmosphere. It was so touching that when they realised our love for Mango they prepared a surprising Mango feast for us. It was very touching to us. Noise were not as bad as highlighted in many reviews after all we understand that we are living in the hustle and bustle of cairo city. Ritz Carlton Cairo is among the best I ever stayed in, in terms of pleasant smile and friendliness. I am afraid I might miss some names but every staff we met were top notch. Especially would like to thank Ossama and Asmaa from the lounge, the waiters team in the lounge and cleaning team in 12 floors who kept the room spotless. Thank you all.‚Ä¶

One of the best hotels in Egypt. Love the room, we got upgraded to Junior Suite and it was stunning room with 2 bathrooms and all the modern amenities.   Dinner at pool side restaurant was great! They had good small plates and vegetarian choices. Drinks were also well made.   Best thing was the breakfast. There executive chef came and talked to us personally. Overall I would recommend, little steep price for Egypt but worth it.

Undertrained staff some of which will stop to chat with coworkers while customer waits for spoon, ice, coffee ‚Ä¶ Some that just disappear leaving customer to request another to help. Example - told iced-tea is a special order.  While it is expected that people at local venues may not speak English, it is reasonable to expect staff at the concierge, reception and restaurant should be able to communicate in English.  COVID has left many businesses understaffed,  Ritz-Carlton should be able to procure more experienced employees or at least provide them with better training.

From the reception at check in with Matthew who upgraded us (because we are Marriot Bonvoy Gold elite members) to a perfect room with a view of the Nile where we got to a stunning sunset every night, it was magical. All services from the restaurant and chamber maids, to the chic lounge with delicious desserts, we absolutely loved our stay. Down to the beds and bedding sheets, it was perfect. Thank you The Nile Ritz Carlton for a brilliant stay!! I highly recommended it!!

The hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Cairo direct on the Nile River and a stone throw away from the Egyptian National museum. Many great restaurants and bars are close by and easy reachable within a 5 minute taxi ride. The hotel, rooms and staff were exactly what we expected from a Ritz Carlton Hotel, just perfect.

We stayed here for five nights as part of a larger and longer Egypt trip. We'd certainly start off by saying what a perfect location this property is, right at Tahrir Square and the Egyptian Museum. It's so close as well to many of the hip restaurants around this side of the Nile. The hotel itself is well secured, and the moment you pass through the metal detectors into the lobby, you are greeted by a fantastic Guest Relations team and a wonderful public space on the ground floor. In fact, all of the public areas seem current, well maintained and appointed with everything you would need. However, once we got to the room the story was a little different: we had a junior-suite, overlooking Tahrir Square, and off the bat our A/C was not working properly (specifically, the thermostat was not functioning, no matter what we changed the temperature to there was no change). The room also had an older smell, maybe even a smokey smell that was apparent each time you would walk in. The bathroom were huge and very clean, but had older fixtures with discoloration. Much of the room had this, in fact, with some parts of the ceiling having dry wall cracking and leaving little white crumbs around. Did any of this inhibit our experience? Not really, as the service makes up for it. But it's not exactly what I'd expect from The Ritz-Carlton. I'd like to give a final shout-out to Mina Aziz from Guest Relations: he made sure every request we had was fulfilled and even helped make some special cases work for us. Any future visits to Cairo would still have us staying here over any other option.‚Ä¶

Great location, very secure, wonderful people, the pool is lovely. The gym is large with treadmills, ellipticals, and a plethora of weights and machines. We love a large gym and I will add extra time in the morning for this one. The breakfast is a huge display of every option you could imagine. The lobby piano is a nice way to enjoy their treats. Having a bank on sight helps when getting out cash and change. Enjoy your stay

** POSITIVE ** Firstly the staff were almost excellent, majority of the time were very attentive and assisted with my needs.  Food was a decent spread of international/ local cuisine and promptly served     **NEGATIVE** Now the bad  - ROOM ALLOCATION  Despite me asking around 2/3 times at check-in to have a room away from noise and any events they put me in a room right beneath the top bar.  Consequently every night at around 2AM loud music would reverberate into my room to the sounds of Despacito.  As you can imagine I asked if I could be moved again 2/3 times where they would answer let me get back to you and nothing happened.  For a work trip this is really not acceptable.  Did I also mention as well we saw a mouse run across the lobby!  - THIRD PARTY CHAUFFER On Wednesday last week we hired a car from the hotel from the ‚ÄòMUSTANG COMPANY‚Äô.  I had forgot my wallet in the car getting out which I realised 2 min entering my room.  Upon receiving it back from the driver I noticed all the money had been taken out (USD/AED).  I spoke to the managers Mr Hossam/ Ahmed right away who informed me they would investigate to no avail.    Their rationale it‚Äôs a third party company where there is nothing they can do.  Whilst I understand it would be very hard to prove, this is the RITZ not a 2 star BNB and they should use reputable providers.  In my 14 years travelling for work I‚Äôve never had anything like this which is a real shame.  Its important to highlight the facts above in case there are any other travellers who have experienced the same.‚Ä¶

Great view of the Nile and wonderful staff.  Nighttime view is amazing.  Rooms are spacious and clean.  Go see Ahmed at Bar‚ÄôOro his attention to detail and service was the highlight of our day!!  And, Mixologist Shenouda was excellent with the custom craft cocktails

I have stayed at this hotel before It was so comfortable hotel and teamwork really really really helpful team . I loved this hotel so much so excellent front office, excellent restaurant,and excellent rooms Finally i would like to thank mr. Ramadan Youssef.

to the main resturant it was perfect as well as the cafe was good the staff was good also the pool was good indian resturant also was very good location malllVery nice hotel i spent my vacation there i went

The hotel is more than wonderful in Terms of cleanliness and other things. My experience in the main restaurant ‚Äúwindows‚Äù with breakfast is varied, delicious and fresh. The treatment of the staff is very hospitable and helpful. There is also a wonderful restaurant in the hotel devoted to Indian food ‚Äúindira‚Äù. This made me sensitive to the Indian dishes and their good flavor.  Spatial thanks to the front office team for the good reception and quick accommodations.

This hotel was very good in everything i liked the food it was delicious and amazing the buffet was perfect and the restaurant staff are smiling every time please keep on  rooms need some renovations  your perfect  job

One of the best hotels with the best hospitality, service and has one of the best locations in cairo.   I Loved my stay overthere and would definitely back in the near future. Room was so clean and food was really nice.

The hotel was perfect my stay was amazing i liked the hotel staff and the rooms were perfect swimming pool was clean and the staff was very helpful i will recommended this hotel to my friends and colleagues thank you for everything

Everything was good restaurant staff in the reception was good as well as the Indian restaurant staff was amazing the location near to mall also near to the airport the service was very good overall good üëç

the hotel is perfect for everything I liked the hotel staff specially the pool and gym and the front office team specially karim mohamed from concierge .the hotel location was perfect and very close to the mall and the Airport too ..

Have a lovely stay  Hotel stuff is very friendly Hotel is clean and rooms are big and clean The food in the restaurant is very tasty Great experience so i hope i came very soon  Great thankful for Mostafa and Micheal

I stayed there for business it was perfect, very close to the Airport, and the room it was very clean most key places in the city, and with a direct connection to the Mall. Thank you so much to all the team there; especially karim Mohamed AND Ramadan Youssif at the Concierge.  less

They have party in the hotel almost everyday. You will not sleep before 23:00 o clock. The sound is so high that seems the party is in your room. No body told me about that. Such a disrespectful with the clients. And the party is from people outside the hotel!

Very old, dirty and smelly hotel in questionable location. Very busy traffic outside, lots of garbage, people loitering, unsafe to walk around. The hallway going to our room was full of cigarette smoke, it was disgusting! There was ash next to our bed. The shower was broken with most of the water coming from the shower spraying onto the wall. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

By far one of the worst hotels I've been to in my life. There is a problem with the rooms and service staff. We had to change rooms twice, the first room was dirty, a peice of the sink fell off in the middle of the night scaring us, and some furniture was missing.   The second room was a nightmare, the bathroom stunk of sewer and rotten egg and the AC leaked like a waterfall. We complained about the AC the night it started leaking, then again the next morning, then again during the afternoon. In the afternoon, housekeeping came and put a bucket under the AC to fix the problem. After complaining for the 4th time, the maintenance guy came and hit the AC with a broom as it was his way of repairing it. Of course this strategy did not work and the AC started leaking again at 11PM. We called the reception and maintenance and they only showed up to our room at 11:35 PM after 4 phone calls. The maintenance guy requested the reception to change our room as fixing the AC would take a lot of time, they refused. The maintenance workers started using machinery to fix the AC as we were in the room.  Finally they changed our rooms to a better one at almost 1AM because I was crying hysterically in the reception from exhaustion because I had a morning flight the next day.   Oh and they left a full trash bag (that was not ours) in front of the room for an entire night.  Please save yourselves the trouble a book another hotel.‚Ä¶

primitive service , old furniture , staff is inexperienced .  nothing really special beside the location .  not recommended unless the location is very important.  we came off- season and still the service and the room where not up to the expectations - some electrical issues ( wall sockets stoped working ) , Cleanliness, no cattle in the room for tea, old towels , no drinking water in the rooms  - basically premitive .  Our motive behind the stay was only the location .

Very good!  Great location, Great service, attentive and polite people, comfortable and well cleaned room, comfortable bed and good bath.  As for the value of the stay has good price.  I recommend it as it has the best cost benefit.

Excellent breakfast Excellent location Excellent reception Excellent room  Excellent staff This is the second time to visit this hotel  This time better than before Very comfortable beds  Very cleaned and different in everything

I have stayed in swiss in Cairo hotel.  It was very good experience.   Nice facility.  Mr.Ahmed Ismail was very co operative.  The location is very good  Room service is very good.  The front office people were very co operative.   I am suggesting this hotel for stay

This my first time in this hotel its so great experience staff and great prices and the quality of service outstanding and great breakfast in the restaurant we had great coffee and great food with thanks so much really great place

swiss inn hotel is my second home First time i visit on 2016 From this date it like my home and when i came back on august2019 i visit it again staff was friendly especially reception they provide my with all information that i need because they have knowledge Also they helped me to bring taxi to the airport

Amazing people & amazing place to be, so respectful, nice environment, so clean, their hospitality is unbelievable.. All my friends are willing to always be there whenever they visit Egypt. Is just few minutes drive to great pyramid of Giza.

I was there for 2 weeks. I am a black African man, I was with my black African female and white female colleague. The treatment me and my black female colleague was terrible. During breakfast, the staff in the cafeteria gave us mean glimpse, and did not serve us well. There is a waiter called Osman who was very mean. The hotel is nice but the staff are not nice to black people, our white colleague was treated well most of the time. For that reason, one star from me.

Very good palce & decorations but they have the worst staff and Mistreatment starting from the receptionist to the waiters  They treated us in a very bad way that makes us leave the place at once  We will never go there again its not our first experience in this place

We ended our Egyptian tour in this hotel. It is in a green area with plenty of villas, quiet and peaceful, a relief to busy and dusty Cairo. It is fournished Laura Ashley style, and makes you realy nostalgic. We hoped to enjoy one of the two swimming pools and take a last sunbeam, but in this time of the year the pools are both in the shadow. We took diner in the evening in the beautiful garden near the pool. The food was delicious, but they don't have a wine card. They don't serve alcoholic drinks, but customers are allowed to bring bottles from outside the hotel, we saw several regulars with their own bottle at the table. Minus was the next morning, as we had to take an early flight and our breakfast was included in the price, I agreed with the staff in the lobby that they would bring it in the room before our departure. Only they brought us to bags to take in the taxi, not very comfortable. We left the bags untouched for the taxi driver.‚Ä¶

Most beautiful place! Attention to detail in the design is matched by the attention to great customer service and delicious food. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there and will definitely stay there again in the future.

We came here as a group of 7 on Christmas day and had a wonderful time. We all selected from the Christmas menu and made our choices a few days before coming. The food was excellent and service really attentive without being obtrusive. I can highly recommend.

We had our wonderful breakfast here. Everything is delicious, professionally served, you‚Äôre surrounded with greens and nice people ) I saw some nice vegan and vegetarian options at the menu, so definitely we‚Äôll return here again for dinner

I chose the hotel for the convenience to where I was going to be working. The hotel is in a very nice part of Cairo, hard to reconcile the lushness here with the normal Egyptian scenery of sand dunes and camels. There are various embassies and institutes nearby and a big police presence which was reassuring The hotel itself is a colonial residence and quaint. Certainly, very different from the chains. The ambience within is that of a boutique hotel with friendly and helpful staff. I was very happy with my room and the amenities. My only quibble was the wi-fi and not particularly comfortable work conditions The outside seating area is lovely to sit out the sunset. The pool is small but nice, but is in the dining area, and so you have limited access if you are working, so I had to make sure to return early to make use of it. Many of the reviews mention the food.  Out of necessity I are there all 3 nights I stayed. I found the food to be mediocre. I later stayed in other hotels nearby and found some brilliant places to eat and regret I was not more adventurous when I stayed at the Belle Epoque If I was being a tourist and not working, I would certainly recommend this hotel‚Ä¶

I seldom write reviews. But I saw the mix bag of reviews for Belle Epoque, I felt the need to chime in.  I am not a big hotel kind of a traveler. So, when I booked the flights to Cairo, I started looking. This was the only (or the only nice looking) boutique hotel I found. Some friends warned me Egypt doesn't do boutique hotels well, and yes, the reviews freaked me out a bit. But I couldn't bring myself to book one of those chain hotels... so I took a gamble.  It paid off. Really paid of!  The neighborhood is tree-filled, lush green, relaxed and quiet residential area loved by embassies and posh locals. Lots of nice restaurants, cafes, shops within walking distance. Locals told me they walk everywhere in this neighborhood. Many also told me they often come to Belle Epoque  for the pool, or for lunch.  You may spend your day in the hustle bustle of busy chaotic Cairo doing tourists stuff, so why not pick the most laid back beautiful villa to go back to relax at night? I loved Cairo, and I am definitely coming back. And when I am coming back, I will definitely stay here again.  PS: beautifully decorated spacious rooms, nice and friendly staff. ‚Ä¶

Must visit excellent service super delicious food authentic historic ambiance. An experience not to be missed i would definitely go again. I Would mostly recommend it for breakfast or brunch. Very good coffee as well.

I am always researching where fo stay in Egypt as I offer tours in this beautiful country- this is the best in Cairo! A perfect colonial, nostalgic experience with dining to match!  The decor, swimming pool, gardens, sitting rooms and balconies all remind us of times gone by! This is a place to relax in style. The area is also high class so local Egyptians will dine here. Possibly the best food I have eaten in Egypt!

We stayed here for the nights when we first arrived in Cairo and enjoyed it very much! The location is super nice, as is the staff. Only tricky thing was to find the hostel, we had to ask people on the street for help which worked out fine too.  It‚Äôs a simple but very good hostel!

Thanks a lot for the hospitality about Maggy! I felt always at my home. The place is comfortable and it‚Äôs in downtown,near the best restaurant and nightlife. The room are clean and there‚Äôs a good WiFi.

I highly recommend the hostel, room is clean and shower is ok. Staff is helpful and friendly. No problems with the room mates, everyone treat each other with respect. For all who travels alone-Best for this price.

The hostel is amazing, beds are clean, stuff are always helping and welcoming,the location close  to many shops  I met more than 15 different nationalities   there The balcony with  so nice view  And thanks maggi   For host)

The staff at Bella Casa are kind and thoughtful. Anytime we experienced a problem, they worked as quickly as possible to mitigate the issue. The hostel is located in a great location that‚Äôs convenient for walking around to other sights, shopping, and food. The room we stayed in was spacious and included a private bathroom, as well as a balcony overlooking a fantastic view of the bustling Cairo streets. A special shoutout and thank you to one of the staff members Maggi (Maged) ‚Äî not only did he pick us up from the airport, but we all became good friends by the end of our time there!

First off, the hostel is very near to the Egyptian Museum and the metro that goes to Giza. The staff is friendly and welcoming to all guests and speak good English. Also, for this price and the location it is hard to find one this good.

Clean hostel , near to everything in downtown , stuff are so friendly and approachable, they always care about the satisfaction of their guestsb. And there a lot of games to play there ))) Thanks for everything guys .

I had an exciting time here, everyone was welcoming and fun. Met a lot of foreigners and it was like a family time. Would approve the hostel for anyone going to Cairo. Maggi thanks for the exciting times and also the games, was such a wonderful person.

The location is great near to everything you need such as restaurants and markets and shops The rooms are very clean and tidy The whole place is new and the price is very competitive especially for budget travelers

You can get 4 start above service from this place with lower price than others. The front desk receptionist and waiter to bring my breakfast(Awesome Egypt style) are very kind and helpful. Mine is a very clean room with black curtain so that I can sleep well. There is a socket converter for international traveler as well thought it‚Äòs a bit ropey.  As for cons, it locates at a construction zone so it can be dusty and noisy. Wifi sometimes can be slow and unstable. Power also went outage occasionally but it seems to be a problem for other hotels in this area too.

Service is very good, Staff very co operative, Mohammad Salim good nature person and all staff very friendly. Very clean, Highely recommended. Breakfast is gery good, Mohammed usama Hossam Sameh Assam

I had to stay a week in Cairo due to side tasks I had to fulfill at the GUC. This hotel offered everything I needed, it's close to GUC, the room was clean and it's reasonable priced. Due to my tasks at GUC i had to carry the breakfast time several times and also adjusted the breakfast itself several times. My sister's were always fulfilled as fast and accurate as possible. Thank you for the pleasant stay.

It was a pleasant stay here at Arabella residence. The Staff here are very friendly and present all the time. The morning bfast is much refreshing. Overall it was a wonderful time and I would recommend those prefer to visit Egypt to stay at Arabella residence.

The worst place to stay in Tagamo3 in worth of price and cleanness. I will never visit again. The furniture was broken, the bed not comfortable. The toilet not cleaned and you should ask for the amenities. The electric not stable.

The rooms are clean and the bathroom is clean and everything is good and I love it and my family loves the place too and the service is good and the beds make me sleep in like 5 mins and I thing it‚Äôs sooo worth trying

Fantastic say and staff, extended my stay from 2 days to 8. Staff are all welcoming and supportive throughout my whole stay. Extremely professional. Hotel is clean and very well equipped. I‚Äôve stayed in numerous amounts of hotel in Egypt, and this is by far the best, I am not from this country came god holiday from London. All speak very well English, and very accommodating. Definitely a place to recommend locals and tourists.
