The team was great and also the value for money, Mohammad Osama, husam and Bader they were very professional and I will refer this hotel to all my friends who need a reasonable stay that is near all facilities including the airport

it was amazing to stay here  it was my marriage and we spend a very comfortable couple of nights  every time we will visit cairo we will stay here  thanks for the staff thanks for every one  Khaled jad  best wishes

I stayed in single bedroom for two weeks and the room was nice and service was good. The room was large enough. I had good Wi-Fi connection too. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The place is in the middle of new cairo and it was near from restaurants and malls.

We were a family of 5 and it was just perfect ! We had two rooms on the 28th floor, spectacular view on one side Nile and Pyramids, and the other side, the beautiful Mosque city view, just amazing. But the best of the best is the service, the two receptionist, a lady and a guy, so helpful, to match our needs, organising airport transfer, uber which are safer than taxi in Cairo, everything to make us as happy as possible. Rooms are very nice, spacious, clean, excellent beds, what can you ask more, just thanks to the team.

I have been there for three nights last week it was very nice experience the room was clean The housekeeping he doesn't clean it during the stay but we didn't asked the brothers in the reception are friendly and polite it was very suitable for the price we come back as soon as possible

I reserved a nile view flat 27may  in galaxy royal suits Cairo for one night  I went to Cairo and arrived at 6pm. The reception told me sorry we do not have place for you and we reserved another flat in nile sky hotel. It was just few minutes before magreeb in Ramadan and I have to accept and cancel reservation in booking to avoid charges. I stayed one night in nile sky hotel without air conditioning   It was really a bad place I tried to contact the recipition but they do nothing

This is a property I would strongly recommend should you enjoy staying in a large 100 sqm+ suite in central Cairo. Reception service is outstanding even if breakfast is average, but you have heaps of space when booking a suite (2 bedrooms, each with an ensuite bathroom) + 1 lounge, all air conditioned, at an outstanding value for long term stays. I stayed with a friend during 15 days and we valued the genuine kindness of the owners! Book without thinking twice....

Family run business. We liked the location as it is away from the noisy centre of the town and only a short taxi ride away. Shops and fast food restaurants within ten minutes walk. Masjid Omar Bin Al-Aas was walkable.  Excellent Nile and Pyramids views from the room. Very spacious rooms with lounge and kitchen.  Beds were comfortable.  All the fixtures may not be perfect but the staff is very helpful and courteous. Hearty breakfast with the best Flafalls was included in our stay. The hotel very kindly oranised our pick up from the airport and organised an excursion  at a competitive price.  Overall, excellent value for money.

I booked this hotel one week before arrival on January 2019.on arrival day I reached hotel at 12pm and asked for check in the reception mahmoud said hotel is full then I'm waiting one hour in front of reception he told room still not available.then one guy came I belive ahmad offer me to stay in another room just for rest.i stay in the room until 2 pm but my room still not available.at 2.30 pm Mahmoud call me to check in and he told me my booking has been cancel just before half and hour. he told me booking cancel due to credit card decline which is ihad never ever face before with my credit card.the receptionist  is very rude and not even say sorry for what just happen to me and my family.anyway after getting the room key I was surprise the room floor very dirty and the toilet and bathroom in bad condition.this is the worst experience of my life to stay in this hotel.never ever book this hotel‚Ä¶

Older type hotel/suite. staff very helpful nice view of the Nile close to small shopping area places to eat nice and close. Hotel will call a Uber car if needed better than a taxi no hassles about fare

We (family of four) had made a reservation to stay for a night in Royal Galaxy Suites in early September 2018. The reservation was made over a month in advance. On the day when we arrived at the hotel, the receptionists stated that they had given the room to someone else as tried to debit the amount from the card but were unable to (this has never happened and I've used that card in over six countries including Egypt). They had sent a mail through booking.com to update card details but I was unable to access as I was traveling through the day.   They offered to send us to another hotel which was in a more remote part of town. When we arrived there, they stated that this would cost USD 90 instead of the USD 70 that was the original price. The rooms were of poor quality and they were just trying to take advantage of tourists who do not know the city well. We refused and moved out to find our own accommodation. They realized that we didn't take bait and within five minutes they sent the receptionist boy downstairs telling that the price was negotiable and that they would match the earlier price. However, we had decided to figure things out ourselves and walked out. These hotels use this as a business model to show fancy locations and rooms to customers and send you to another place (with a poorer quality) when you actually turn up. I also lost my faith in booking.com in allowing such hotels to operate. Never ever book in this hotel.‚Ä¶

The first impression when you arrive is that the place looks old and not well maintained. they shouldn't call it an hotel, it can be considered as guest house. The rooms are not well maintained and old.  However, the location itself is nice and the view to whole cairo is amazing. in addition, the friendly staff is very strong additive that compensates the negative things i found in this place.

I would have rated this 3.5 stars if I could, as 4 stars I think is too much...but 0.5 is not an option, so 3 stars is enough. The best thing about this hotel is ofcourse the view, wich indeed is great, with the Nile and also the pyramids (if you book a room with this view). We had a very nice feeling to stay in the balcony and watch the sunset. Also, the staff is polite and helped me to order some food and drinks that we ate in the balcony. Also you can buy sheesha and smoke it in the balcony. The room was spacious and clean. On the other hand there are some negative aspects also. The hotel itself is just a part of a big building, so only the 38'th and 39'th floors are for the hotel. The elevator looked a little bit shabby...Although clean, in the bathroom was a strong smell like a shop full of plastic china stuff (it was from the shower courtain); not that big of a problem, but still.  There is no restaurant like they say (at least on booking.com), but just a room with some tables to eat. The breakfast was quite poor, an omlette and some gem and the kitchen looked not very clean. Also no towels changed or cleaning the room in the morning. And sound proof not good. The idiot next room waked us up at 3 AM in the night because he banged the door and talked loud on the balcony... Poor wifi in our room.  All in all, it was an ok stay, great view, but a little too expensive for what you get. We paid 110 euros for 2 nights on the room with nile and pyramids view; I think a fair price would have been around 70-80 euros.‚Ä¶

The InterContinental Citystars in Cairo truly offers top class hospitality in a location conveniently close to the airport and adjacent to a sophisticated shopping mall.  The hotel restaurants offer a selection of excellent and diverse cuisines, service is impeccable and the staff are friendly yet discreet. Our hotel stay was the perfect complement to an intense tour of Egypt's historical sites.

It was the worst stay of all services and unexpected,,  1 The reception is very bad  2 The staff is unhelpful and not friendly  3 The reception manager is not cooperative at all, and he does not have any solutions to the hotel's mistakes  4 The rooms are old and bad, their furniture is bad and their smell is bad, the bathrooms are old, their marble is broken, and they have sewage.  5 The reception of the breakfast employee is rude and unwelcoming to guests at all.  There are so many comments that I don't want to waste my time writing them Attached is a summary of my visit to the worst 5-star hotel in the history of my travels, where my stay was for one day, and thank God for that, it was an experience and will not be repeated, no matter how much the hotel offers me upgrades,,

The hotel staff was what made this stay special. We had multiple problems with the rooms during our stay but Mohamed Mustafa intervened directly and resolved everything to our satisfaction.  In addition, Executive Lounge staff Osama Yassin, Ahmed Saeed, Merna, and Ramy Nader were welcoming and attentive.  They were all extremely pleasant and great communicators.    I want to call out Bellman Ahmed (don't have his last name, sorry) who was especially helpful when our local tour guide did not show up.  He made multiple phone calls to the agency and made sure that the issue was resolved.  He was very pleasant and professional.

Just perfect and very helpfull n kind staff Everything was ultra clean Room service is superior Food and service at Esplanade restaurant was more than perfect Cocktail dinner at business lounge was very deliciousüòä

Excellent stay superb breakfast professional staff exquisite health club nice massage, room service was good and responsive to complaints the pool was nice and clean I would definitely recommend it to everyone, I am a regular visitor and always look up to staying there

Luxurious hotel connected to Citystars mall in Cairo.  The architecture, design and decorations in this hotel are gorgeous.  The employee are very friendly, and the room is very spacious.  It‚Äôs location is unbeatable since it‚Äôs 10 kilometers from Cairo International Airport.

This is a very nice property close to many attractive sites. Wonderful staff willing to extend help whenever you ask for. Very goods variety of restaurants and tasty food. I liked Fyruz and Alkhal. We enjoyed the entertainment program in Fyruz. Really enjoyed it.

Again, I am here in Intercontinental City Stars Cairo. A wonderful place to enjoy and stay in one of the most luxurious hotels in Egypt. I so grateful for their hospitality as all staff spare no efforts to make your stay as a part of heaven. Location is perfect.

I'm a frequent traveler and it's hard to find a hotel that I like. I really like the intercontinental in cairo, because of the great location. The hotel is within walking distance of every place and is very quiet in the evenings. When I stay there, I always stay in the same room because I love the feeling of a hotel room with a nice view.  My favorite little feature that I like about the hotel is pool, the staff was very nice specially mr. ahmed hassan from front office , i would like to revisit the hotel again.

I was looking for a new hotel room for my family and this was the best choice by far! When we got into the room, we were surprised by how nice it was. The room was well-appointed with a comfortable king-sized bed and a large flat screen TV. The bathroom was even nicer; we all love going to the pool  together and it was so much fun The best part of this hotel, though, was the location: it was close to many things, In the end i would like to thank Mr. Hatem Samir and Mr. Ahmed Hassan for welcoming me.

Visit Cairo every couple of years and always stay here. Good, safe location. Staff are fantastic- warm and welcoming and very helpful and attentive. Rooms are a good size. Very clean and good bathrooms and shower pressure.  Thank you Havana hotel!

We have stayed at the Havana Hotel a number of times over recent years and never hesitate to return. The staff and management at Havana are one of its strongest assets. Always super helpful, friendly and efficient. It‚Äôs location in Syria St in Mohandeseen is another draw card with so many fantastic shops and restaurants (I like the barber shops too, the best shave and haircut you can find!). The rooms and bathrooms are well above standard for a 3star hotel in my opinion. Good restaurant and shisha bar on site, licensed bar, and great coffee.

Great location in Mohandisseen. Shops, banks, restaurants nearby. Rooms are a good size and very clean and well equipped. Staff really friendly and helpful. Good, plentiful breakfast. A great place to stay. Highly recommend.

After a long trip from Australia the driver was at the airport as planned and was very friendly and knowledgable. Hotel was good quality for a lead in hotel. Staff were very friendly and the room was ample in size and comfort. Very pleasant start to our holiday. Morning breakfast was also very good.

This small hotel is located on Syria Street, near the Arab  Road Mohandseen The room is modest but clean The staff is friendly Service is less than boring Its only advantage is close to restaurants and shopping

It is good hotel for family and good location also good staff  service and everything near you market and al gma arabi rode and the taxi every time can you find there I hope try to go there next time I like this hotel

The staff was v. Helpfull and kind Bed Sheets and towels are not that clean.. No elevator since the hotel is just 3 floors..but the staff will be there whenever u need to holdup ur things  Great location with many facilities around you( shops, markets, money exchange...) Recommended for business travel not lesiure

Our group stayed here during a week in Cairo.  The staff were friendly and helpful, with passable English.  Location was excellent with stores near by, especially a grocery. Breakfast was passable, not great but decent.  Wish they provided free bottled water in rooms.  Smoking is allowed, which wafted up into rooms at night, but many smoke in Cairo.  Good price, would stay here again.

I spent 1 night in this hotel, the staff is friendly, average furniture, very nice location near from Metro super market, exchange currency and many restaurants. there is no free parking as they said, regarding the cleanless  Recommended for short time visits.

The hotel is conveniently located in the Mohandessin area, personnel is friendly and helpful, rooms are large and clean. They organised a free taxi service from airport at my arrival. I did not try the breakfast so I can not rate this. Overall, great value for a 60$/night hotel.

This 3 star hotel we stayed in was for a night because our other hotel that we had booked in was not available for one night only dueing our trip, to cut it short the day of check out we had gone out in the morning to have breakfast and when we came back to check out we came to know that both of us friends who were in two different rooms had some money missing from our saftey box as we randomly counted them before leaving. Anyways the duty manager there did nothing to help he said that he checked the cameras in corridors and no one had entered our rooms. To cut it short my rooms safe box at my arrival was not working and when i asked the receptionist to get it fix he came with a box full of keys and had reset it and left and the sexond day this happened.  Even the taxi we had asked to pick us took us directly to the way to airport while we hadn‚Äôt told them too so when we asked him he is going to the wrong way he said that the guy at the hotel said you are going to the airport as i think they thought we are going back home to our country.  This is just a bad experience but definitely true as we both friends in different rooms got some money missing from our saftey box.  Please be careful thats is my message.‚Ä¶

Excellent value for money. The hotel is located in the Zamalek district, in an area well connected to the points of interest of the city and at the same time a quiet area. the breakfast was good and with excellent pastries

The hotel is in a good location and the room was clean, the bed comfortable. If you ask, you can get eggs cooked fresh for breakfast.  However, I requested a superior room because the room details stated that superior rooms have a balcony, and mine did not. This was very disappointing since this was the only reason I requested a superior room. Instead, it had a kitchenette which is strange and made it feel like a self contained apartment rather than a superior room in a hotel. I would have been better off with a regular room. Not long after I arrived, after waiting almost an hour past checkin time as the room was not ready, foul smelling water poured from an outlet under the sink, although I had not turned on the tap. The maintenance man did not listen when I explained where the water was coming from and that I had not turned on the tap, and instead fixed what would have been another problem had I done so, the broken pipe leading from the sink to the outlet above where the water came from. He also fixed a blockage which may have temporarily solved the mystery water issue. A young man came and carefully mopped the floor with antiseptic and clean water, but the smell lingered in the kitchenette for the duration of my stay, which fortunately was only one night.  When I went to have a shower I found the hot water was barely lukewarm, not matter how long I let the tap run for. There was no hot water in this room the entire stay.  Overall, it was overpriced for what I got, even for Zamalek.‚Ä¶

Compared to the general offer in the region it was quite good. Very well located, useful help desk and attentive staff. They offer private driver service, useful for tours and transfer to airport. I walked around Zamalek and the location of it really helps. Rooms are clean and comfortable.

gd for business, just to sleep and take a shower. take some business calls.  nice restaurants and hangout slots around. centrally located in zamalek area where lot of activities can be done, nt value for money.

Stayed here for 5 nights and absolutely loved this hotel. The room was clean and spacious and the bathroom was also really clean. The staff were so friendly and kind and went out of their way to help us with everything. The location of the hotel was perfect - there is a Starbucks and McDonald‚Äôs in walking distance. There is a bank to exchange money nearby and lots of cute little cafes too. The area is really safe and we would often go out late in the evening and had no issues. Would definitely recommend staying here.

There are more pros than cons about this little hotel. The location is fantastic and in the heart of Egypt‚Äôs finest neighborhood, Zamalek. Within a walking distance, you will find countless shops, restaurants, coffeeshops, supermarkets and pharmacies. Literally everything you will ever need.  The hotel has some nice bars and restaurants. For a hotel this size, I was surprised they have some good options for a drink or a meal.  The room is small but very clean and you wouldn‚Äôt need it much if you are planning to move around.   Staff are generally very helpful and polite which is again something you might not find in 5-star hotels around Cairo.  Now when it comes to the cons of this hotel. It will be the elevator which is very slow and tiny so if the hotel is busy, you will suffer a bit.  Also, there‚Äôs no soundproofing system so you can hear everything happening next door but the managers were very supportive to control this.  I will definitely be staying here again.‚Ä¶

180$ per night for a very small normal room !!  No breakfast included!  Booked at this hotel for 3 nights, when I reached the hotel and saw how small and normal the room is for such fee, I went directly to the reception and told them I wanna cancel the reservation cz It‚Äôs not what I expected. They said okay no prob but there is a cancellation fee which is 122$, so If you want you can stay the night and pay the fee so you won‚Äôt lose it.  We stayed me and my friend, the second day they come and say we need 67$ more !!!  So basically the room is for 190$ (more than its own price) !!!!!!!!

We stayed for one month back in May, and honestly wish we will return soon. President Hotel is so great! The rooms are spotless, modern, clean.  All the porters and cleaning staff are really nice people. Not to mention the hotel has such good bars also Monkey abar and grill and Cairo cellar, busy every night!  The terrace restaurant on the 11th floor is amazing with great views. We tried almost everything on the menu, and it's all fresh and tasty. Staff attentive and nice too.  Would highly recommend this hotel. Located in a nice area of zamalek and 5min walk to yamama shopping centre and pub 28

The staff are so friendly and attentive. Very well priced Delux Studio (including a kitchenette) which is great for short and longer trips. Super comfy bed, lots of work and desk space plus a little dining table in the room. The WiFi works well enough for online work and is great considering it is free. Nice location with coffee shops and supermarkets within walking distance. Would definitely stay again and just extended my stay as it's so lovely!

Stayed there for one night and need to overnight due to an early morning flight. Hotel is just 10 mins drive to airport in a nice and quite area.  Next to hotel is a mall but is kind of miserly now  as it almost close with a  couple of shops still open...  Room was nice, clean, big and very nice decorates.  had dinner and breakfast there and both were ok.

Great hotel service! Very clean rooms and the staff were very friendly. The place is quite. I recommend this hotel for family staying. Personally I did not enjoy the breakfast but it wasn‚Äôt very bad. I would definitely go back to Gabriel hotel if I visit Cairo again :)

This review is regarding day use at the Gabriel hotel pool.  I have been here more than 20 times for day use and ive spent the night 4 times and used to be a big fan. But since Andrew left its gone down the toilet. First of all we booked through the whatsapp booking. They asked for photo i.d of all my friends that wanted to come. Kind of ridiculous. Then they wanted all our facebook accounts. Presumably to check we dont look ugly or poor. Again ridiculous, this is a swimming pool not Studio 54. We are two couples in our 30s40s. We should not have to show a stupid social media presence to enter a pool. On arrival they told us that the reservation was to reserve attendance not to reserve sunbeds. That's not what a reservation is. So there were no umbrellas left and not enough sunbeds for our group (3 present and 2 joining later). There was one double bed left right next to the showers and speakers - least desirable spot. We asked for a spare sunbed to be bought over and put beside our bed as we are a group of 5. They refused. Said it was too difficult and just kept repeating "no way" because according to the obnoxious attendance the beds fit 7 people. The bed was the width of 3 pillows meaning if three people laid side by side like sardines they could fit, but not comfortably. I can guarantee no egyptian woman would be expected to be 7 to a sunbed but screw the white chicks they can suck it up? After an extended argument they put a sunbed next to the double bed which was no difficulty at all. We then asked for the spare umbrella but they refused saying the umbrellas that were ironically on wheels could not be moved. We had driven a long way so chose to stay, but without any shade we left after 3 hours. We would have liked to spend the day - the hottest day of the year so far. Its also important to mention that the dj blasts annoying house music too loud. They wont turn it down. This has been a problem on another visit when we were the only family at the pool and they still wouldnt turn it down a fraction. We couldn't talk  side by side without shouting.  Also on another visit when we had to be vetted on our facebook to make sure we were not scumbags there were people so ridiculously drunk they vomitted in the pool. We reported it to the waiter who went over to have a word and walked away with their drinks order! Its gotten gradually worse, but this visit really was the limit. Wouldnt recommend to anyone.‚Ä¶

First of all, this isn‚Äôt a 5 stars hotel!!!! It‚Äôs just a small hotel (arround 25 rooms) without buffet breakfast, broken cheap-fancy furniture, and minimum cleaning.   The hotel itself is a party for Egiptian people: starting in the pool (where you can‚Äôt simply relax because of the noise of ‚Äúthe music‚Äù - arabian reggeton‚Ä¶ later on the party continues in the ‚Äúrestaurant area‚Äù which is exactly in the middle of the hotel, so you can easily hear the excesively loud music from your room till very after the midnigth‚Ä¶  The breakfast is poor, and defficient quality. People attending the tables don‚Äôt speak english, and what you get isn‚Äôt frequently what you really ordered.  We choosed this hotel because of it‚Äôs nearby the airport, and it‚Äôs side by side to a big shopping mall (SunCity) which is mostly dead (5 floors and only very very few shops open).  Deffinetly I do not recommend this property unless you are looking for bad rest, egiptian partys all the time, bad food and a barely dead surrounding.  FAR, VERY FAR FROM A 5 STARS‚Ä¶ run away!‚Ä¶

Loved the Gabriel Miami!! Let me first start by saying customer service is superb! The minute We pulled up  to the property We were greeted at the car with the bell man waiting to collect our bags and guide us to the front desk. Izzy who works at the front desk, had everything ready and waiting for our arrival, she was 10 steps ahead lol and I can appreciate that. Thank you Izzy!! They try their best to accommodate your requests. 5/5 for customer service and staff. Cleanliness of the room 5/5 and comfort 5/5. Did not like that the bar was close for the nights we stayed there so that really was our only con about our stay. I definitely recommend the Gabriel, two thumbs up!

Myself and family stayed at this hotel before returning home from the airport. It was fabulous, rooms clean and a great size. Check-in seamless. Staff really helpful. Would have liked to have stayed for a couple of days really. Sadly didn't manage to try the restaurant.

Oh my God! How to start!? First of all this hotel is definitely not a 5 star hotel. It is in a very bad location, the view of the rooms are just not finished construction sites, it is beside a decadent shopping mall, far far away from the city. The room itself with stained bed linen, all the water from the faucets were dark brown, hairs in the pillows, stains in the carpet.  There was also a party in the main restaurant with loud music that we could listen in our rooms. Horrible!

Came to Miami with my family for the first time ever! The rooms were very spacious and accommodating. Our check in was very smooth we didn't even have to wait Gaston was very nice and gave us our room even if we were a bit early. I would like to thank Jane the concierge in specifically she was very sweet and went above and beyond with arranging transportation and setting us up for a boat ride.  Overall satisfied with the amenities! The pool is awesome.

The staff was great and welcoming since I first arrived. I had to stay an extra nights in Cairo to wait for my PCR test so this was a great last minute find. The front desk help me set up my PCR test and were very helpful overall. Mohamed Salama gets a personal shout out because he took the time to show me around the mall that is connected to the hotel and even bought me some coffee! I appreciate the hospitality from all here! Thank you!

We had an overnight in Cairo with an early departure. This excellent hotel is part of a Supermall in the up n coming section of ‚ÄúNew Cairo‚Äù. It allows some window shopping, as many stores are empty, where the affluent Egyptians partake and has an interesting food court if the two restaurants remain closed as during our stay.  15 minutes taxi from airport and an interesting location for those not interested in venturing into Cairo, it combines top notch service with an eclectic and curious ambiance. All the comforts and conveniences you have likely missed during your Egypt tour, await you here. We missed out on the restaurant review as it was closed for a private event (unusual) but the room service was excellent and delicious.

The Lotus Hotel is an excellent place to stay in downtown Cairo, depending on what you want. If you want to stay in same-same sterile modern international standard accommodation, you wouldn‚Äôt choose the Lotus Hotel. If, however, you seek old-world charm (without the fancy makeover that has arguably spoilt so many of the old-world hotels in Egypt), the Lotus is a really great choice. The rooms are simply furnished, very clean, & very adequate. The highlight of the hotel is the staff, who are wonderfully kind, helpful, welcoming, & 100% genuine in their care of their guests. The hotel is in a great downtown location, with plenty of local caf√©s, bars, restaurants, & shops in easy walking distance. I stayed at the Lotus on 3 occasions during my recent visit to Egypt. It will be my preferred choice on my next visit too. ‚Ä¶

It's hard to put into words how special my time was Lotus Hotel. As a single and first-time traveler to Cairo, it was the perfect place to stay for a week, and understand what daily life is like. I was able to walk to so many places once I felt confident with the rhythm of the streets (thanks to Samir Fayek). This place has so much character and warmth to share even if it's not a "luxurious" hotel. (Personally, I'm more interested in the depth and a story -- if you're looking for that, you will find it here. ) Ayman, Emad, Abeer, Ibrahim, and Adel (and others that I know I'm forgetting, sorry!) made me feel so welcome and couldn't have been more gracious. On my next trip to Egypt, no matter where I am, I will go out of my way to return to Lotus to say hello to everyone there. Mr. Wafik Doss (owner of the hotel) is a gem and a true professional in the world of hospitality, and I will continue to stay at his hotels in the future when I'm back in Cairo. Mr. Doss kindly introduced me to Mina and Samir Fayek (tour guide experts) that I highly recommend using if you're staying at Lotus or Windor. (They've been working together for ~40 years.) Wafik and the Fayek Tour Guides work from their hearts; I was lucky enough to experience it and will be forever grateful.‚Ä¶

The best crew in Cairo. Mr. Labib has been very very hospitable and accommodating. Thank you for your help and guidance. Please come here, its worth it. The guy helped me visit all the i.portant olaces in Egypt and actually guided me through my entire vacation!!!

This was the second time I stayed at the Lotus with family. The hotel has been around some time, having survived the ups and downs of the tourism industry. It offers good value for money and the staff are all very friendly and helpful and speak English - some well. The beds are comfortable and the hotel gives a choice of western or Egyptian breakfast included in the very reasonable rates. I liked the manager very much and found him very helpful during the difficult 2020 COVID-19 pandemic. I almost had to stay on after the Cairo airport closed and would have felt safe there for weeks if that had happened. The hotel is well located too - close to Tahrir Square, the Egyptian Museum and many restaurants and other amenities.

I stayed 3 nights at this place. The location is right where you want to be downtown.  It's a ten minute walk to the museum and plenty of eating options close by.  The hotel is an old time kind of place but I liked it. It had character.  The people who worked there also were friendly and and good banter. There is a bar upstairs where you can get a beer and chill out after the sightseeing during the day.  If any criticism maybe the breakfasts could be better. However for the price and the quality of the rooms ,mine with a balcony I found the place to my liking.  If I ever go back it will be there. Or possibly the Windsor hotel the one I should of been in which is the sister hotel closed for now. Keep up the good work guys.  We will return one day !!

I am Indian and I live in France. Egypt is my first trip. The first five days I went to an hotel very touristic. Walking, I found the Lotus Hotel Restaurant. I went for lunch with my wife. The egyptian food was very good. Not expansive and very tasty. We decide to stay in the Hotel then. The bar, restaurant, room, are very good. Welcome and service too. Very good security. For me it's a very good place to stay in Cairo. After my trip in Assouan, Louxor and Alexandria I booked one more time 4 nights in Lotus Hotel Resturant. We were very happy to come back. We eat very good kochery and very good spaghetti. The atmosphere is super !

Vintage Cairo, with much of the decor original to the building.    Excellent value, great Downtown location.  Staff friendly and most helpful. Fun bar (Polo Bar) at night.   I spent several nights at the Lotus Hotel, and I recommend it.

The hotel has a great location in Downtown Cairo. It dates to 1950 and has had no major renovation since then. For those on a budget and who are familiar with 1 and 2 star hotels, the Lotus is a great choice. This means weak WiFi, iffy plumbing, thin towels, and simple bkfst. It has a fun bar, a restaurant, they'll do laundry, and you can walk to downtown sites. Some devoted foreign guests (it has its fans) but mostly Egyptian. The bar has a hipster on a budget vibe.

I had a reservation from 20 till 23 December and another one from 21 till 22 for a friend , and when i arrived to that place after 18 hours traveling coming from Europe the elevator was not working well, the receptionist after seeing my Egyptian passport didn‚Äôt chek me in , the reason is that my passport says that i am from Cairo and cairo citizens are not allowed to stay in hotels at Cairo for security reasons i got shocked, i showed him also my italian ID and i am not living in Egypt and I don‚Äôt need to hold another passport in my home country but he said no of i have any foreigner passport i can stay , i have the house in Cairo but i had to book in that poor place for work reasons because its close to Tahrir , I cancelled the two reservations and i went to another hotel they welcomed me and they were so kind and polite with me and I appreciate it ‚Ä¶

I slept in Lotus hotel for 4 nights, the staff is nice and every thing was good, break fast need to be improved but with budjet prices you cant expect fancy breakfast ...  I encouraging every one to sleep their for good location and safety and its budget prices

Mixed feelings with this place. Good location with comfortable bed and a convenient airport pick up. That said the floor blackened our feet, the curtains had a strange smell and without a shower curtain or mat the small bathroom always had a wet floor. The pictures I think are very dated as the common seating area has seen a lot of traffic, is dusty, uncomfortable and not a pleasant place to have the breakfast of bread, jam and cheese.  Thanks for the vote if you found this review helpful.

Perfect location in the middle of the city centre. People are very friendly and helpful with kind hospitality. The rooms are simple but all clean. Very nice place to find your way in the chaotic cairo city centre.

Right in the heart of the chaos of Cairo.  Good accommodation provided for the price that was paid.  The room and shared bathroom were clean and everything worked as it should.  There are heaps of great places to eat close by the hotel and the staff can offer suggestions on where to try.  The included breakfast was basic but adequate.  The included wi-fi was a bit hit and miss but this was the same all over Egypt.  The staff were professional and friendly.  They had offered us free pick up from the airport but unfortunately when we arrived there was no one there to meet us.  Apparently they organised it for the wrong time.  We booked a tour of Giza through them for a reasonable price.  All in all we were happy with the service provided and would stay here again.

We had a 3-day stay at this hostel after reading many great reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel staff were knowledgeable about the area and were able to recommend some favourite local restaurants. I wasn't too keen on having a shared bathroom, but the rooms with a private bathroom were sold out when we booked.  The room was clean and simple when we arrived. There was an armoire for us to store our clothing. The A/C had a bucket to collect drips underneath, but this was never a problem. There were two shared bathrooms to use and they were kept clean and stocked with toilet paper. During our stay, we never had issues with the bathrooms being occupied when we needed them. The common room has books to borrow, and satellite TV, but no A/C. Despite our room overlooking a busy street (during Ramadan), we didn't find the noise to be too loud. Unlimited fresh towels were provided, and Wifi is free (and signal strength good) in all rooms.  You can't beat the hotel location. It is so central that you don't need a taxi to visit the shopping district (July 26th street and Ataba Market), many restaurants, and several attractions (Tahrir Square, Museum, Nile Corniche). The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Ramses Train Station which was very convenient for us.‚Ä¶

For the low budget, this hostel is very good. Their rooms and bathrooms are basic and also clean.  The owner and his staffs are all good people to talk to. And they are willing to help and give advice on anything relating to having a good time in Cairo or Egypt.  They can arrange airport transfers and if you book atleast a certain number of nights, you will get a free transfer.   Location wise is in downtown, busy area and don't have to worry about safety late at night as the area is always filled with people. You can hear traffic from the room, so prepare earplugs if you are a light sleeper.  There are lots of restaurants to eat at and there is a confectionery right opposite the hostel.  I got a free upgrade to a room with 4 beds and attached bathroom despite booking for single bed shared bathroom.  In all, I recommend this hostel for budget travellers.‚Ä¶

As titled, I spent 3 separated nights in travelers house, it just made me be like at home. The host Adel and the staff Jasmine are super kind and helpful.  Jasmine is not just a worker there but becomes one of my best foreign friends, she took me to the famous traditional Koshary restaurant and even cooked for me the night before I left.    This is not a high-class hotel, but definitely a warm place if you want to make some friends and take rest.  The location is also very nice, you can easily grab the best dessert downstairs because the best El Abd is just across the street from travelers house.  It only takes around 10-15 mins by walk to the museum as well.  The only thing I would expect more is that they can refinish the room if they plan to make something different.  Some of the furnitures and facilities are not quite new.  But for a backpacker like me, this is still a nice place to stay.‚Ä¶

I booked this hostel based on reviews, and for once i was disappointed I have stayed in hostels before and have had better experiences  Pros Free wifi Great staff Centrally located Great communication via email Free airport pick up one way Price  Cons You enter the hostel via an old run down building in downtown The hostel has to be accessed by an old lift We had an ensuite room, there was a depression in the floor of the room, which was a hint of structural issues Peeling plaster off walls The bedsheets had holes in them The room was unclean, carpets dirty Bathroom unclean, no toilet paper either  We spent a few hours and rebooked another hotel. We explained to the staff that it was not personal and they said the cleaning lady had not been for a few days and they could sort out the cleaning for us. This hostel has great potential if they can sort out these issues‚Ä¶

One of my favorite spots of the city is this hostel !  The staff treats their guests not only like guests but also like friends. They speak good English and can help you with everything (sightseeing tips, tours ...) You can always have a seat in the  "living room" and share your interests with other people. The hostel is in the center of down town and you can reach everything easily by taxi or metro.  Don't hesitate to ask for what ever you need, they will help you in any case. Adel, Yasmin, Maghed, Sam ... Thank you for everything, I'll definitely come back !

We just loved everything about it... The staff , the room and their hospitality . You cant ask for more with such a value deal.  These guys are so friendly that you really feel like you are in home rather than hostel or hotel. Adel n we chatted till late hours and i have to admit he is a really nice guy and a good friend to me. will definitely visit this place whenever i get a chance to come to cairo again.

Travelers house hotel always has central located and good price for sure. I think I don't have to repeat it again. But the most important thing is Maged, he is a super friendly guy, you will find a lot of fun with him after say hi when you check in. This hotel and Maged is a great reason to force me come back Cairo next time. Why not book it now?

Nice hotel  for the price we paid, and with good location, close to shopping, the Nile river and  food , the  room was clean , and service was good, only bad thing , the most important one, - the sa.. didn"t work,

Price is reasonable for what you get. Location is great. near Tahrir square.  Room is large and clean with a refrigerator and well cool A/C. shower and toilet room was clean and maintained. Towels felt a bit overused.  Breakfast is large and includes bread, vegetables, cheese, deserts, drinks, eggs and more. We enjoyed it. Stuff is English speaking and ready to help. Wifi signal was stable and work well at the lobby but in our room (9th  floor) the signal was weak and not stable.

¬†I had to get to room number three before I could say it was habitable for a human being. The first room had major water damage, the second room had mold and fungus all over the bathroom (see attached pics). A staff member told me "we are aware of the issues with the upper floors" yet they try to pass them off to customers anyway. Also, the hotel may accept foreigners but it doesn't cater to them - forget about getting a drink of anything with alcohol in it, and forget about even getting a glass to your room if you plan to self-cater. The hotel only has plastic and paper disposable dixie cups ! They have no ice buckets and the best I could get was a plastic bag full - the place has no class of any kind. I'd suggest the nearby Sheraton or a chain hotel that would not be thinking so regionally. I wouldn't stay there again, sorry.‚Ä¶

I will make it simple and put the pros and cons of staying in this 3 star hotel.  Pros: Perfect location in the middle of Midan Tahrir with a magnificent view of the square from my room window  Friendly staff from the reception to the restaurant and housekeeping. Large room and electric kettle and bottled water supplied daily. The hotel is connected to La Poire one of Cairo's better known cafes.  Cons: Rooms are tired and in desperate need of renovation with stained carpets. The bathroom leaked from both the sink and the shower. The drain in the shower didn't work and flooded the bathroom everytime I took a shower. Breakfast was basic and tasteless.  This hotel is not  cheap for the mediocre quality it offers  and  needs renovation soon. Just to add that the clientele was mainly Arab from various Arab countries with some Westerners and Africans.‚Ä¶

Staff needs urgent training. Aside from one person in the reception, the others were terrible. The one who greeted me in was unwelcoming. After taking my passport information and charging my card, he got a personal phone call and he stepped away leaving me there standing for several minutes without any information from the room or other. When he came back, he rudely said that the bellman would guide me to the room. Staff definitely needs urgent training on manners, politeness and being welcoming in general. Breakfast was terrible. Don't bother to book this hotel with breakfast (they offer a pre-packaged version that is not fresh at all). It is better to go to the small cafe place on the corner that provides excellent options.

Loved staying in this hotel, great location, next to Egyptian museum, Tahrir square, Nile and downtown, big reception area, security@scanning at the entrance, friendly staff, spacious rooms, nice bathrooms,comfy beds, plenty of storage, clean, AC (heater in winter), couldn't have breakfast because of early departure, got our breakfast packed in nice silver boxes to take away, that was a nice touch:) I think it's generally hard to find quiet room in city like Cairo, so yes, always more or less noise from streets, but we got used to that during our stay there.

This hotel is wonderful! Situated downtown near the Tahrir Square. Walking distance to markets, places to eat, museum, the Nile, etc. The hotel has 24 hour security and scanning at the entrance. Reception is very helpful. Complimentary breakfast is a large buffet of options. Rooms are clean, bathrooms are nice, and the AC works well. Fully recommend staying here.

Worse hotel i have ever seen very dirty rooms, not ready water leakage, very dirty wimdows very dirty refrigerator (with pictures) tv was not working i cleaned and prepared my room with the staff that some of them dont put mask very noisy very bad service employee very rood specially the kid in the reception he shouted on me as if he gave me the room for free!!! In addition they didnt let my friend enter to my roon although he is in the same hotel Worst hotel ever!!!

This hotel is in the heart of Cairo city, and therefore comes with very noisy rooms DAY AND NIGHT as main streets and traffic are around.   Friendly staff, who - I have to say- do not expect tips every time they serve you (which is very rare in Egypt)   Mediocre hotel: -Breakfast is very good -Rooms are ok if you don‚Äôt mind to sleep on firm mattresses -Pillows are not the best -Towels are very rough and scratchy  -I found a hair on one of a shampoo bottles from a previous customer - No hair conditioner - No slippers - Spacious dated rooms - Clean, but not spotless - Bathroom has mold  - Room keys have to be replaced every time you close your room and go out. And every time I get to the hotel at night, I go first to the reception to make sure I have access to my room. It‚Äôs not only me who had this issue! The entire group I‚Äôm with suffered from not working keys. - taxis and Uber know the hotel well.. so no hassle getting back to the hotel -Internet not good if you plan to work or make video calls. It‚Äôs only ok for sending messages or requesting an Uber   Luckily, I can sleep in noise, but for those of you who need quietness to sleep, stay away  ‚Ä¶

The hotel is located in down town near the Egyptian museum, so it is easy to walk to many places, and the price of the hotel is good enough for the budget travelers, but I had a very bad experience when I booked a tour to the pyramids with them, because the guide Husam, who made my dream to visit Egypt a nightmare, he is very pushy and very greedy, and when he finally figured out that I am a budget traveler he ignored me and didn't give me enough information about the history and the culture of the country,and he started talking to the driver instead of talking to me,  after we finished the tour he asked me for tip, but I didn't  because I didn't enjoy the tour,and the funny thing is that he told me that the hotel charge so much for the tours and he gave me his contact information,  he told me that if I come back to Egypt he will give me a cheaper price, so I think he is not a loyal person, overall I recommend the hotel for the budget travelers, but I don't recommend to book any tours with them.‚Ä¶

From the day of check in, we were treated like a VIP. Ibrahim came everyday to clean and replenish. The nightly entertainment was included in our stay and well worth the experience. Food was very good and breakfast buffet, also included, was amazing. Nabeih was very polite and informative, took care of our every need and made our morning a dining experience. Room service was very prompt on bringing food. Every part of the hotel was clean and always smelled nice. I would definitely book a stay here again. And recommend to my friends.

- Room: nice and comfortable  - Breakfast : excellent and includes most of Egyptian foods like Fool, falafel , koskosy , feeteer etc. - view : direct on the nile side , better to ask for nile view  - sky resturant : good menu with different kinds of vegetarian and non Veg. - staff : very good and doing their best to make you happy specially the breakfast Resturant , reception, room service. - Room prices : little higher in compare to nearest type of hotel . - Night Show: very good and includes songs , belly dance an tanora traditional dance .

ÿ≥ÿπÿ±Ÿá ŸÖŸÜÿßÿ≥ÿ® ÿå ŸÖŸàŸÇÿπŸá ÿ¨ÿ®ÿßÿ± ŸàŸÖÿ∑ŸÑ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑŸÜŸäŸÑ ÿ≠ÿ™Ÿâ ÿßŸÑÿ∫ÿ±ŸÅ ÿßŸÑÿ∫Ÿäÿ± ŸÖÿ∑ŸÑÿ© ÿ±ÿßÿ¶ÿπÿ© ŸÑŸàÿ¨ŸàÿØ ÿ≠ŸÅŸÑÿßÿ™ ÿ≤Ÿàÿßÿ¨ ŸäŸàŸÖŸäÿßŸã ÿ£ŸÖÿßŸÖŸÉÿå ÿÆÿØŸÖÿßÿ™Ÿáÿå ŸÜÿ∏ÿßŸÅÿ™Ÿáÿå ÿÆÿØŸÖÿ™Ÿáÿå ŸÅÿ∑Ÿàÿ± ŸÖÿπÿ™ÿØŸÑÿå ŸÖŸàÿ∏ŸÅŸäŸÜ ŸÖÿ≠ÿ™ÿ±ŸÖŸäŸÜ Ÿà ÿÆÿØŸàŸÖŸäŸÜ, ÿ¥ÿßÿ¥ÿ© ÿ®ÿ±Ÿàÿ¨ŸäŸÉÿ™ÿ±ÿπÿ±ÿ∂ ÿ∂ÿÆŸÖÿ© ŸÑŸÖÿ¥ÿßŸáÿØÿ© ŸÇŸÜŸàÿßÿ™ ÿ®Ÿä ÿ•ŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ∂Ÿäÿ© good price, amay location,services,clean, breakfast, staff are helpful and nightly live music plus sports live show through large screen for full enjoyments. w

The correct way to advertise Nile View hotel would be. Stay in a -5 star old rundown boat watching toxic waste dumping in the river. With an old rustic black mold infested carpet and mold in sink and shower and for entertainment staff entering your room late at night. And for a bonus get sick from the food and stay on the toilet looking at the Mold in the sink and shower. And for your safety in the event of an emergency there is a dirty old mattress in the hallway that you can hide under to keep you safe from predators. This is an experience of a lifetime. You can book this exciting holiday on Nile View deceptive website. Nile View hotels advertising is very misleading. It‚Äôs not a 5 star hotel it's a nothing star disgusting filthy old rundown boat that was so bad we both got very sick from the deplorable conditions. There is black mold everywhere in the carpet on the walls in the sink on the floors this was the most disgusting rundown hotel we have ever stayed at. And even the ceiling was falling apart. We witnessed hotel employees dumping toxic waste in the Nile. This hotel should not be allowed to be open as it is a health hazard. Our stay on the dirty old boat was a nightmare. Just read the numerous negative reviews and look at actual pictures posted by myself and others that stayed at Nile View they tell the truth. And no matter what lies Nile View post it does not change this fact ‚Ä¶

Very bad experience. They canceled my reservation on Nile view side without any notice or warning, and give it to foreign guests instead of me, then tried to convince me to accept port view instead of Nile view. The duty manager was very rude person, he gives me his back while talking, and left me with no options rather than leaving the place. Not recommended at all.

Who can imagine that this fine boat hotel  is still not open!! I enjoyed very much my stay with German group of 20 who nearly cancelled their booking from Feb, 28 till Mar. 02, 2020 only because we discovered that this great boat relocated in Maddi and still not open.  Instead, boat management was thoughtful enough to arrange for an A/C brand new shuttle bus dialy! First we thought this is only to & from the museum only. But we were mostly pleased to discover that this thoughtfulness extents to every where, any time and any numbers of time! Thoughtfulness is reflected in staff attitude as well! We and the owner are really lucky to have this staff who LOVE the boat, love their work and care soooooo much for customer satisfaction. I barely had the chance to order anything! They care enough to fullfil every need and any remark before you even say it!!  Nile view Zamalek (now Maadi): you made me proud, you made all the guests happy, you gave us such a wonderful experience that I want really to thank each and every one of you. I can't believe how caring, clean and kind every one of you are! It's not just hospitality it's true kindness & care coming from professional people who received us befoooooore getting readying and finishing innovations! But they really made a "hard to please group" ; feel home. Can't thank you enough, we will sure be back to see you after renovations After special entrance gate is finished. After sundeck and covered pool are ready  Food there is unforgettable! I had the most wonderful kabsa, the best hawawshy and an amaaaazing mixed grill. Breakfast buffet is memorable! Oh my God! What great bakery do they have!!! Best omlette in town! Tameya is fried before you. All kinds of hot drinks! Real fresh orange juice. Real care and morning smile. Even if you are in a hurry, they would notice and make you the best snacks to go! O my God after 2 days I'm still overwhelmed with your kindness people! I remember each and every name of you: Reception: Ahmed, Sheriff Mostafa & Adel. Room service: Refaat Food and beverage: Nabieh Omlette stand: Hamad (very caring) Chief at the kitchen is the best (not sure about the name) Even room cleaning: Maha Bill man. Security men who would help you park your car. Everyone .. I'm sorry I haven't met you all. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Can't wait till I'm back.‚Ä¶

Wanted to stay on the Nile whilst in Cairo but most of the 4 and 5 star places were not within our budget and found Nile View was.It was not too bad,very small rooms as you would expect as it is a retired cruise ship.The pool was terrific to have a dip in after a long hot day site seeing.The only problem we encountered was music from upstairs which went to the wee small hours.

Please note that this hotel would not keep any rooms for you even after they confirm you that a room (or rooms) is reserved for you. They just look at the rooms available when you check in and assign one of the available rooms to you. They just don‚Äôt care if the available room is not of the type you requested.  We reserved two rooms for 3 nights and requested that they should be next to each other. The hotel staff acknowledged and sent me an email with confirmation numbers. This happened 4 months before our stay. But still, when we checked in, they gave us rooms in two different sections of the hotel. Essam (not sure how it is spelt) was at the front desk and he was extremely uncooperative. He was adamant that those were the only rooms available even though our reservation was confirmed 4 months in advance. He finally told us that he would give us two adjacent rooms the next day.  But the next day, Essam did the same thing again. He reassigned rooms to us but in two different sections again. We argued with him again but it was of no use. This man would try strongly NOT to help customers. Fortunately for us, there was one more person at the front desk and he tried to help us. His name was Ahmed. After listening to our request, he found out that there were two adjacent rooms available on a different floor and he assigned them to us. Our request was finally accommodated. Our first positive experience at this hotel was with Ahmed.   I had another weird experience at this hotel. I went to the restaurant on the roof top one day. Instead of directing me to a table, the waiter asked me, ‚ÄúHow can I help you?‚Äù. I then asked him, ‚ÄúDo you have vegetarian food?‚Äù He replied, ‚ÄúWhat is vegetarian food?‚Äù I was stunned! He was a waiter at a restaurant and he didn‚Äôt even know what vegetarian food was. This place is obviously run by weird guys.  The only other positive experience was with the staff at the breakfast. They were all nice and friendly.‚Ä¶

After reading some very bad recent reviews i was about to cancel our reservation but a positive review from a fellow South African and a reassurance from the hotel that we would wouldn't experience the any of the problems mentioned in other reviews. Well I am glad that we stuck with our plan, the location is perfect, views of the Nile in the evening are stunning we ate all our meals for the two days we were there in the restaurant and we couldn't fault anything. The breakfast were really good as well with a large selection of fruits meats pastries etc. Yes the "rooms" are not big but they are cabins not rooms, this is a Nile Boat not a hotel! The rooms were clean and everything worked.The staff were all amazing and tried their best, there were a few language issues as this is not a tourist establishment but frequented mostly by local people. We were always made to feel most welcome by the other guests and even joined in the festivities of a birthday party and an engagement party. the only complain was yes there is a smell of cigarette smoke in corridors etc but the is Egypt there is no such thing as a non smoking area.Would go back there again.‚Ä¶

Not organized dirty not tasty very bad service low quality all expressions can‚Äôt be enough to describe this place simply !!!!! I don‚Äôt advise any one to try the only positive is the view and the mighty Nile river

O dono do hotel, Mohammed, foi sempre super simp√°tico mesmo depois dos enumeros favores que lhe pedimos. Podemos tomar banho depois de uma longa viagem at√© ao Cairo antes da hora do check-in.  Permitiu que deixasse-mos as malas no hotel quando voltamos ao Cairo uns dias depois. E a todos os pedidos respondeu com um ch√° e com um "You are welcome". Sentimo-nos de facto bem-vindas a este espa√ßo.  Para al√©m de tudo isto, a localiza√ß√£o do hotel √© excelente.

I was treated well very relaxing friendly staff. The atmosphere is also very good and the team is very professional. Before I took the massage I was given different types to choose from. I recommend their services

My experience at the St. Regis Cairo was exquisite. Upon check-in, I was greeted and taken care of in a very personalized manner.  They had an upgrade available, and put me in a suite overlooking the Nile River.  I was escorted to the concierge, who offered me an itinerary of activities during my stay in Cairo, and then was shown to my suite.  The suite itself was amazing! It was fully stocked with plenty of bottles of water, and there was a bouquet of roses with a hand-written note along with some welcome snacks, and a personalized dessert congratulating me for a recent accomplishment.  Soon after getting settled in, there was a knock on the door and my personal butler came in to introduce himself to me, and inform me of the services he was able to provide to me. I was able to experience the gym, spa, outdoor pool, and a restaurant during my stay at the St. Regis Cairo, and was impressed with each new experience.  I'd definitely recommend staying at the St. Regis Cairo if you are in Cairo for any period of time.‚Ä¶

Best hotel in cairo , good services,  friendly staff , so clean , good location ‚Ä¶  Near from down town , a lot of restaurants , lovely housekeeping , room is so clean , big , good view .   Really i like it

5 out of 5 stars! The staff and facilities were amazing. I liked how the steam room, sauna, and showers were clean. The locker room area was clean too. The jacuzzi was clean as well. I loved the variety of showers. Mohammad Abdel Hady was amazing, helpful and friendly.

Best treatment I ever had, the installations are in excellent conditions and the spa therapists were great.  Highly recommend to use their facilities, you have to schedule first.  Very friendly staff from desk check in to in staff

The best Thanksgiving vacation and dinner in our life....who knew it would be in exotic Cairo? The special Thanksgiving menu at J&G was a truly elevated interpretation of classic dishes. The pumpkin soup, stuffed turkey and pumpkin pie and ice cream were superb, and the hanging crystal ambiance was lovely.  The St Regis Cairo beautifully blends classic Astor Art Deco with Middle Eastern and Asian touches that are a feast for your eyes, and the steakhouse, Singaporean and Italian restaurants are exquisite. The duck and tangerine chicken at Tianma are particular favorites, as is the clay pot gnocchi sorrentina at La Zisa.   Hand-hammered lanterns of every cultural influence decorate common areas and rooms. The indoor heated pool was perfect, and you have wonderful views of the Nile throughout the hotel.‚Ä¶

Thank you very much for the wonderful stay and trip, it was amazing, Hussain and bayoumi from a butler was very helpful and supportive, all the staff were very lovely and room and furniture was very nice and amazing

We checked in at the hotel and we were greeted with warm smiles. The hotel is clean the staff is extremely professional. We were provided with the opportunity to stay in an apartment instead of the two rooms we booked which was an amazing upgrade. We had lots of space for the 4 of us. The staff ensured we did not need anything. Breakfast was amazing each day. On the day of my birthday, I had the most pleasant surprise in our room when we returned, I had a cake, balloon, and flowers for my birthday. This was well appreciated. I cannot thank them enough for the accommodations they are truly a 5 star location with amazing people working there to ensure all your needs are met while you relax and enjoy.

Excellent first experience at St Regis Cairo. Great attention to detail and pampring. Catering is impressive, ambience is great. Rooms are done up to satisfy all your visit needs and relaxation. Only defect in my opinion is the small size of the outdoor pool

The place was amazing, loved the room and the view, as a suprise for our 5th year anniversiry there were sweets in the room.  We loved the restaurants that were in the building, it was a great location and easy to get around.  Memmorable time in Egypt, great escape the chaotic city.

Its a 5 stars deserving hotel at the centre of Cairo on the river _THE NILE_ where you enjoy a luxurious stay, sleep well and satisfy your senses. beauty is every where around you there, you receive the quality of service you deserve

One of the nicest Four Seasons I‚Äôve stayed at. The staff is absolutely over the top polite, helpful and professional. The rooms are spacious, well appointed and the bathrooms are enormous with separate WC and bidet. Best of all though are the restaurants and downstairs lobby tea bar which transport you to another era. The Chinese restaurant (The name is 8)  was so excellent and the service was so incredible that we would‚Äôve eaten there every night but forced ourselves to explore other places, none comparable. Excellent designer shops also inside the hotel and fantastic concierge who helped us book some amazing tours and a sunset faluka boat tour with wine.

A centrally located hotel with courteous staff and brilliant rooms . The food , location , view of the Nile and things to around are plenty . The approach to the hotel is a bit congested but once inside the hotel it‚Äôs a pleasure . A attached small mall is good but expensive .I would come back

Due to check in in two days time for 4 nights and by chance looked on their web site to find out that the outdoor pool facilities are closed until March 2023 as confirmed on a call with the reservations team, we received no notification that the facilities would be closed

Hotel was decent as expected for the price. My room was facing the road opposing the zoo and there was a lot of noise at night. I had the impression that the balcony door was open. I was staying in a deluxe room but i saw no difference from the standard room, maybe more corridor room. The restaurant/bar at the pool wasn't great: they closed earlier than advertised and the drinks at the bar were awful. They don't know how to make a manhattan and the caipirinha was the worst i have ever had. Please also watch out: at check out, the desk person converted my Egyptian Pound invoice into USD and then proceeded to charge my credit card in GBP with a 4.5% markup without informing me. I pointed out to him that he was supposed to ask me in which currency i wanted to settle the bill, not decide for me. He tried to say that it was not him and that the machine automatically converted to GBP but i let him know that this was not teh first time i was checking out of a hotel with a credit card. Very dishonest and Unprofessional from a hotel of that standard. The 4.5% markup cost me an additional ¬£120. I don't know if the management told them to do this but it left me with a very bitter taste at the end of my stay.‚Ä¶

Every single person we interacted with at the Four Seasons was professional, yet super friendly. The staff at breakfast, including the chefs, were lovely with our requests for almond milk and sometimes decaf with our lattes, the front desk, cleaning, and greeters at the curb--to a person, we were treated so well. Still missing that delicious and bountiful breakfast!

The Four Seasons Cairo was a nice hotel but seemed a little worse for the wear. It was directly across from the Cairo Zoo which was in terrible shape and detracted from the overall ambiance. We traveled during Covid and the security was pretty obvious even though the hotel was mostly empty.

An excellent hotel with very comfortable rooms and very attentive staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and the ambiance of the hotel. Great swimming pool with large deck area and food service.  Hotel has eight restaurants in which we dined and all of which have superb food and service. They had our room ready for our 5:30 AM arrival and provided late checkout to accommodate our late airline schedule. Can‚Äôt say enough good things about this great hotel.

I stayed at FS Cairo Nile River during a four night sightseeing trip to Cairo on the way to Asia with my family. Having stayed at a variety of FS properties all over the world, I would not hesitate to highly recommend this hotel to even the most seasoned FS customers.  Though the property itself may not be as fancy as some of the FS hotels in other locations, it was the staff who made our stay above and beyond our (already high) expectations of FS service. There was nothing too big or small that they couldn‚Äôt accommodate. The concierge was amazing with helping us book all of the tours, excursions, travel we needed assistance  with. And when we needed to fly back early from a day trip to Luxor because one of our family members was having a health issue related to the extreme heat, they took care of all of the logistics.  Cairo is a very overwhelming city that can have significant language and cultural barriers to the North American traveller and the FS Cairo Nile is there to help navigate and make sure your trip is amazing. I would not hesitate to recommend this property.‚Ä¶

Firstly, I must say, that it seems some people in other reviews for this hotel, are getting confused between the 2 different Four Seasons hotels in Cairo. This is a review of The Four Seasons Hotel Cairo at Nile Plaza.   I stayed here last week for a couple of nights and everything was great. They were able to check me in early which was a bonus. I made use of the spa area and had a treatment, which was reasonably priced.   The outdoor pool area is a lovely oasis from the bustling and chaotic city, so I went down to the pool for a few hours a couple of times.   The restaurant for breakfast is spacious and has nice River views, and plenty of different options.   All staff were attentive and helpful.
Review

excellent food and wonderful service.  The pane vino restaurant was delicious and our waiter Adel rahman was helpful, friendly and very efficient.  We found the price is very reasonable and the view was great. This is a must place to eat if you‚Äôre in this area

Hotel location is good. Walking distance to a couple of tourist spots in downtown Cairo. Breakfast is nice. House keeping guy Taha on 15th floor is very nice and helpful. Good place for long stay. Safe and comfortable.

GATE 1 arranged this luxurious hotel for our Cairo stay ! It was an amazing experience, very friendly, hospitable , comfortable, efficient! The breakfast was fantastic ; views from rooms of either the Nile or Tahrir square were simply magnificent!  The luggages , check ins, check outs of ALL 57 of us were handled seemlessly by GATE 1 ! The buses were new, with WIFI and charge ports in every seat ! The drivers were  friendly and professional too ..,  THREE CHEERS to GUDES RIHAM, NEHAL and our driver ZACHARIYA! üëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèº  The restaurants were fabulous too , especially the Indian  and Thai ones !

Great Hotel with Solid Service. Especially the receptionist Yasser helped me and my mom book a reservation at the Revolving Restaurant & we had an amazing date and ambience over there which we really enjoyed.   Highly recommend and especially letting our dear friend Yasser do all the bookings, tours and reservations for you !

‚Ä¶.. that there was a time, before retirement, when the Intercon group was my very favourite and I enjoyed their highest status of Royal Ambassador ‚Ä¶ but these days I travel using my own money but still choose this brand when I am able to. The receptionist smiled when he found my card had lapsed some 14 years ago but my smiling request for a Nile view room was ignored as he is clearly not able to use his discretion for ‚Äúold friends‚Äù!! He did however offer my a rate on the daily breakfast that my agent had not sort to include in my booking ‚Ä¶. a good guy who went the extra mile!  Breakfast is a Bun Fight in the In and Out Cafe!! The receptionist very organised and one of the staff named Omnia a service ‚Äústar‚Äù ‚Ä¶ the perfect staff member that we dearly loved to have in the days when I ran hotels myself  The breakfast restaurant clearly lacks organisation ‚Ä¶ in my four days here they have never ever managed to have sufficient fruit juices available to meet demand ‚Ä¶ it is a crying shame! The price charged for breakfast is substantial and the food offering and general service does not reflect that  We have also had a meal in the lobby cafe each evening of our stay ‚Ä¶ and here we see classic Egyptian management at work! When I opened restaurants in Egypt we found that one of the major hurdles was to teach managment to be proactive in quickly addressing guests needs and not expecting staff to do everything ‚Ä¶. I am easy on service because I understand but having to approach service staff and demand attention or serve myself my own drinks means that I have had enough!  I like this hotel and will return ‚Ä¶ it is so very easy to get to anywhere in Cairo and the Bell Captains help in securing me local taxi was everything as it should be. The front door service, reception desk and Omnia deserve full recognition!!!  Final Question? ‚Ä¶.. why is the same sandwich served three different ways in three days ‚Ä¶ the F&B director needs to question why standards are not being followed‚Ä¶

We stayed , I and my wife, in Semiramis intercontinental Cairo, for 16 nights from 19/10/2022 to 4/11/2022. It was , as always, a wonderful experience . The reception was very courteous , we were upgraded to a stunning suite, the ladies in the executive lounge looked after us very well. The food was of wonderful variety..this is my 11th year of staying in Semiramis , will never stay anywhere else, in fact we , already, booked our trip for next year. I would like to thank Karim Zereef who helped us enormously, thanks to Mena  in the front desk, the ladies in the lounge, Mena, Hidi, Reem, Nermin . Thanks to Amanny, Waleed, Mehmood, Muhammed, Abu Zaid and the rest. Thanks , once again, to all of you who made our stay so nice and pleasurable‚Ä¶ See you, all, next year!! Najim Ghulam and Hala Safari‚Ä¶

My wife and I stayed here two nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  Very good location and attentive staff.  Our room was large, bed very comfortable and we enjoyed sitting on little deck over looking the Nile and the city.  The dinner and breakfast buffet was extensive, food well prepared and there was room for people to move around without banging into each other.  All in all a very nice stay and we would recommend.

The worst reception and service I have ever had in a so-called 5-star hotel. No recognition of my Ambassador status. Disorganized check-in and check-out. They gave me a room that was not ready yet. The terrace bar of the hotel is simply dirty. The management of this hotel should be ashamed of the quality of the respect given to the customers. IHG should audit this hotel thoroughly.

I‚Äôve been to over thirty  intercontinentales, and as a royal ambassador I can say this was one of the top one or two. The hotel is remodeled, the staff (especially Haremos and Waleed in the club lounge) were very attentive and friendly.   The ambassador club is also one of the best I‚Äôve seen, out of all the intercontinentales I‚Äôve visited. Only the one in Seoul is of the same caliber.   The location is perfect, right on the Nile and next door to the museum.

Booking and staff are very good and friendly.  THE ROOMS ARE A BIT TIRED,  Doors does not close properly. They are very old and they have not been modernised.  The views are great overlooking the Nile and I could see the pyramids from my balcony.  Breakfast was good, but it was very busy and doesn't feel like a personal experience.  Some of the staff are stressed and some are pleasant.  Reception staff are good and helpful.  We had a room which was next to the lift shaft.  This room was very noisy all night and I had to fight to get it changed.  Overall, the experience is good but not excellent.

The InterContinental Citystars in Cairo truly offers top class hospitality in a location conveniently close to the airport and adjacent to a sophisticated shopping mall.  The hotel restaurants offer a selection of excellent and diverse cuisines, service is impeccable and the staff are friendly yet discreet. Our hotel stay was the perfect complement to an intense tour of Egypt's historical sites.

It was the worst stay of all services and unexpected,,  1 The reception is very bad  2 The staff is unhelpful and not friendly  3 The reception manager is not cooperative at all, and he does not have any solutions to the hotel's mistakes  4 The rooms are old and bad, their furniture is bad and their smell is bad, the bathrooms are old, their marble is broken, and they have sewage.  5 The reception of the breakfast employee is rude and unwelcoming to guests at all.  There are so many comments that I don't want to waste my time writing them Attached is a summary of my visit to the worst 5-star hotel in the history of my travels, where my stay was for one day, and thank God for that, it was an experience and will not be repeated, no matter how much the hotel offers me upgrades,,

The hotel staff was what made this stay special. We had multiple problems with the rooms during our stay but Mohamed Mustafa intervened directly and resolved everything to our satisfaction.  In addition, Executive Lounge staff Osama Yassin, Ahmed Saeed, Merna, and Ramy Nader were welcoming and attentive.  They were all extremely pleasant and great communicators.    I want to call out Bellman Ahmed (don't have his last name, sorry) who was especially helpful when our local tour guide did not show up.  He made multiple phone calls to the agency and made sure that the issue was resolved.  He was very pleasant and professional.

Just perfect and very helpfull n kind staff Everything was ultra clean Room service is superior Food and service at Esplanade restaurant was more than perfect Cocktail dinner at business lounge was very deliciousüòä

Excellent stay superb breakfast professional staff exquisite health club nice massage, room service was good and responsive to complaints the pool was nice and clean I would definitely recommend it to everyone, I am a regular visitor and always look up to staying there

Luxurious hotel connected to Citystars mall in Cairo.  The architecture, design and decorations in this hotel are gorgeous.  The employee are very friendly, and the room is very spacious.  It‚Äôs location is unbeatable since it‚Äôs 10 kilometers from Cairo International Airport.

This is a very nice property close to many attractive sites. Wonderful staff willing to extend help whenever you ask for. Very goods variety of restaurants and tasty food. I liked Fyruz and Alkhal. We enjoyed the entertainment program in Fyruz. Really enjoyed it.

Again, I am here in Intercontinental City Stars Cairo. A wonderful place to enjoy and stay in one of the most luxurious hotels in Egypt. I so grateful for their hospitality as all staff spare no efforts to make your stay as a part of heaven. Location is perfect.

I'm a frequent traveler and it's hard to find a hotel that I like. I really like the intercontinental in cairo, because of the great location. The hotel is within walking distance of every place and is very quiet in the evenings. When I stay there, I always stay in the same room because I love the feeling of a hotel room with a nice view.  My favorite little feature that I like about the hotel is pool, the staff was very nice specially mr. ahmed hassan from front office , i would like to revisit the hotel again.

I was looking for a new hotel room for my family and this was the best choice by far! When we got into the room, we were surprised by how nice it was. The room was well-appointed with a comfortable king-sized bed and a large flat screen TV. The bathroom was even nicer; we all love going to the pool  together and it was so much fun The best part of this hotel, though, was the location: it was close to many things, In the end i would like to thank Mr. Hatem Samir and Mr. Ahmed Hassan for welcoming me.

EVERYTHING & EVERYONE was awesome!! We were welcomed with complimentary Egyptian mezzeh and wine. The restaurant had delicious food & the breakfast selection was one of the best I‚Äôve ever had! Our room was so spacious and the staff made us feel like we were at home. They even had a great selection of excursions for us to choose from and gave us the best tour guide ever!! The hotel concierge, Abdul & Muhammad, treated us like royalty and gave us an awesome tour guide! Our tour guide was Medo and we can‚Äôt wait for another adventure with him! He was so charismatic and a great Egyptologist!!! Can‚Äôt rave about this place and hospitality enough!! MUST STAY when visiting Cairo!!

I would like to thank Geky ossama, Ahmed Nabil, Ebran, Andrew, Mahmoud abd el aziz, mohamed reda and the rest of the staff/waiters for being helpful and friendly.   They were punctual, keen on helping the tram and to provide an outstanding service for the business event.   And I loved the food, good quality and great taste.

the management team and the staff was very helpful and friendly. they were very supportive in organizing the event with us. won't be the last cooperation for sure. many thanks, and we look forward to cooperating with you again.
